loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is encouraged that she was granted loans twice in the past and has fully paid them on time. Those loans really helped sustain her laundry brush nets and send her children to school. Although her sales is not always good, she maintains her positive outlook in life that things will get better.

She is humbly asking again for a 19,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for rolled fish nets, nylon thread and other materials to make more laundry brush nets to sell.

She is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart and continued support of her livelihood. Her earnings will surely help cover their daily sustenance and fund her children's education.

Lucy's simple dream is for her business to grow and see her two high school children go to college. She believes education is their hope and path to allow her children a better quality of life. Every week Lucy meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials to make laundry brush nets.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David deals in growing and selling cocoa, which he has practiced for many years. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He earns additional income from his big cocoa plantations by harvesting and selling to cocoa companies; he works hard to meet his family's basic needs and dreams of educating his children to attain a minimum qualification.

David is requesting a loan to help him to improve his cocoa farm by planting more cocoa.

loans.use: to improve his cocoa farm by planting more cocoa.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who has four children. All of them attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a retail shop, selling mosquito nets, for the past five years. She mentioned a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of mosquito nets to resell. She decided to join Yehu to expand her net-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of mosquito nets to resell.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a single mother of one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married mother of three children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 10 years she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a lack of capital in her business.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman; she lives at a rental house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma has operated a tailoring business for the past seven years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a divorced woman who has no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a kanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of kangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of kangas for resale.

loans.name: Tania Yaosca

texts.es:
La sonrisa de Tania, muestra lo orgullosa que está por estar trabajando en uno de sus grandes metas, que es convertirse en una de las mejores ingenieras industriales del país. Esta joven de 18 años de edad, consiguió una beca por su excelente nivel académico, pues cada vez que entra al aula da todo de sí al recordar que considera a la Ingeniería industrial como una excelente forma de contribuir con el desarrollo económico en industrial de su país.
Tania está a punto de terminar el segundo año de esta aventura llena de números y creaciones, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para  comprar una computadora portátil, pues la considera como una herramienta básica para el desarrollo de sus trabajos asignados, además que la motiva a esforzarme más en alcanzar la culminación de su carrera y así retribuir todo el apoyo que ha recibido de la universidad. En sus planes está, conseguir su título universitario y buscar en estos momentos unas pasantías de medio tiempo que generen ingresos para su hogar y para ella misma.
texts.en:
Tania's smile, shows how proud she is to be working on one of her big goals which is to become one of the best industrial engineers in the country. This 18 year old youth got a scholarship for her excellent academic level and every time she enters the classroom she remembers how she thinks of industrial engineering as an excellent way to contribute to the economic development of the industry in her country.

Tania is about to finish her second year of this adventure full of numbers and creations. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy a laptop as she considers it a basic tool for her assigned work. Also it motivates her to make a greater effort to reach the end of her studies and repay all the support she has received in university. In her plans are obtaining her university degree and find a part time internship at this time which will generate income for her home and for herself.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong is 41 years old. There are four people in her family. Cultivation and husbandry are her main income. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from pig raising income. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family’s member, especially the kids.  She has daily income from garden such as vegetables, chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Senghong's Group

texts.en:
Senghong is living in Battambang province. She is a 35-year-old mother of five children, only one of whom is in school. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming, tailoring clothes and working as a paid worker to get a fee. Moreover, she spends her spare time raising pigs to sell as well. Her pigs got ill and her rice is in a drought, so these are the challenges for her in earning income to support her family. She could earn only 7 USD per day recently.

Due to having not enough working capital, she is now leading a group which consists of two members to apply for this first Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy a tailoring machine to speed up her tailoring of clothes so that she can satisfy her customers. In addition, she will take the rest of the money to buy two pigs and pig feed to support her pig raising business. She hopes her business will be expanded through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine to speed up her tailoring of clothes so that she can earn more income to save for her child's studying.

loans.name: Yuqing

texts.en:
Yuqing is 59 years old, a single mother of one child. Her husband died many years ago. Yuqing found a job in her hometown as a toll collector for collecting parking fees. In additional, she will help her son to operate a second-hand car shop in spare time.

Yuqing’s mainly customers are passersby and she need to charge fees from those cars. Her working place is near a school which has so many cars every day. While, it is not an easy job for her, because she needs to maintain the public order and ensures the normal order of the parking road traffic. Sometimes, she will meet some people who are unsatisfied with the charges and quarrel with her. However, Yuqing can solve it peacefully.

Yuqing requested ￥10,000 from MicroCred. She will use the loan to purchase the auto parts for her second-hand car shop. As she grows older, she wants to earn more money to have a better life for her son.She has a dream that their business will be better and better in the future with the help of Microcred.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Aileen is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is 23 years old and married with two children, one of whom attends school.

He is currently working with Bundibugyo district local government in Uganda as a primary school teacher. He took up the job after training in the profession, and he has hopes of building his house but is challenged by the low and delayed-salary payment.

He has requested a loan to buy land as part of his future plans of building his family a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy land for his family.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a single woman who has one child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a food cafe business for the past five years, selling to the neighbours. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, beans, and cooking fat for her business. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, beans, and cooking fat for her business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with six children, three of whom attends school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a married mother of one child who attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity  nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food .

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase Irish potatoes and cooking fat for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase Irish potatoes and cooking fat for her business.

loans.name: Rajan

texts.en: Rajan  is 42 years old, married woman and a mother of 3 children. She is doing business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Rajan  hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time.

loans.name: Tombowa Suzanne

texts.fr: Tombowa est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec quatre enfants à charge. Agée de 42 ans, Tombowa vend des bijoux pour subvenir à ses besoins. Pour s’approvisionner, Tombowa se rend quatre fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de colliers et de boucles d’oreille en vue de gagner des bénéfices et d’aider son mari à supporter ses charges quotidiennes de la famille et de bien prendre soin de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Tombowa is a married woman who lives in Tokoin with four children in her care. She is 42 years old and sells jewelry to meet her needs. To get her supplies, Tombowa visits the market four times per month and is seeking this loan in order to purchase dozens of necklaces and earrings with the goal of turning a profit, helping her husband with the family's day-to-day expenses, and taking good care of their children.

loans.use: purchase one dozen necklaces and one dozen [pairs of] earrings.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married woman with six kids, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Biasha operates a grocery vegetables-selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and Irish potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Sreyeng's Group

texts.en:
Sreyeng’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sreyeng makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of four children, three of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over three years, Fatuma has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of inflation in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase new  clothes for resale

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Mrs. Tinh is a 35 years old and married. She has two under 18 year’s old children. She would like to improve her living standard, especially her children but lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a hygienic latrine. Farming and salary are main income source of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en: Layla is a 45-year-old divorced mother of three children. Nine years ago she started working as a chef to cover the needs and expenses of her children as she is the only breadwinner. Layla is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother who is trying hard to improve her family's living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. Layla hopes to continue to satisfy her children needs and provide them with a better future.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of inflation. 

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, Irish potatoes and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, Irish potatoes and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwanamgeni

texts.en:
Mwanamgeni is a married woman and has been blessed with four children, three in school. She lives with her husband and children in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over seven years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with one child,who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, milk and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is married with two children, one attending school. He is a food vendor in a local market and also sells water. Through this work, he has been able to cater for his family's welfare plus sustaining his businesses.

Iman dreams of educating his children up to university and above all living a desirable life. He works very hard and sacrifices so much by moving to different markets to sell his foods to achieve his future dream. He believes that nothing can keep him from achieving his dream, due to the fact that he works hard towards it. He is requesting a loan to buy more foods like bananas for selling so that his income levels can increase.

loans.use: to buy more foods like bananas for selling

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: Thy’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Thy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as construction worker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Aasho

texts.en: Aasho  is 51 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 4 children.  Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. She also sells animals' milk to the people of her town to raise an extra amount of income.  Now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She aspires to save money for providing prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Mariam owns a house that r has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariam has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past five years, she has operated a mat weaving business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase weaving materials for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase  weaving materials for her business.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a married woman. She has one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Farida has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is married and has two school-aged children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a Khanga ( women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married. She has two kids, one of whom attends school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a motorcycle spare parts business from home. Her potential customers are motorcycle operators. Her major challenges are seasonality and competition in her business.

With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Mère de cinq enfants, Amivi est une femme divorcée âgée de 32 ans qui habite à Tokoin. Amivi est une marchande de bassines et de sceaux qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et de quartier en quartier pour gagner des revenus. Amivi nécessite ce crédit pour commander des unités de bassines et de sceaux en vue de maximiser son profit afin de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et prendre bien soins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The mother of five children, Amivi is a divorced woman aged 32 who lives in Tokoin. Amivi is a retailer of basins and buckets who restocks four times a month at the market and resells out of her home and from district to district, in order to make a living.

Amivi needs this loan to order some basins and buckets and maximize her profit so as to cover her daily needs and take good care of her children.

loans.use: to order some basins and buckets to resell.

loans.name: Nisel

texts.en: Nisel is in the gasoline retailing business in Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She engaged in this type of business knowing the gasoline station is far from her location. She's making good sales these days and she wants to have enough to sell. She is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase additional liters of gasoline for retail.

loans.use: to purchase additional liters of gasoline for retail

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto es un hombre de 67 años de edad, divorciado, tiene un hijo de 29 años, y su negocio es la confección de chamarras de cuero. 
Él es independiente, emprendedor y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max Paredes’ área comercial de manufactura e importación en todas las áreas.
Augusto es morena de cabello corto y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que es independiente, bien en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la confección de chamarras de cuero, él se ocupa de comprar cuero para pintarlo y confeccionar prendas como, chamarras, guantes, gorros y otros, “realiza ventas por mayor, reparto a tiendas y también hago trabajos a pedido…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que realiza ventas por mayor la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial. Su sueño es abrir una tienda, él desea realizar la compra de una máquina de coser industrial. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución ene 45 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que [augusto solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser cuero industrial para confeccionar chamarras de cuero.
texts.en:
Augusto, 67, is divorced and has a 29 year old son. His business is making leather jackets. He is independent, responsible and a self-starter. He started his business in the "Max Paredes" zone of the business area for manufacturing and import.

Augusto has short brown hair, is slim, his mother tongue is Aymara and he speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his son who is independent and living in his own home that is made out of brick and cement and which has all the basic necessities.

His business is making leather jackets. He buys leather to stain and make clothing such as jackets, gloves, hats, among other things. He comments that he sells in bulk, and distributes to stores, but also does work as requested. The advantage of his business is that he sells in bulk. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy an industrial sewing machine.

His dream is to open a store and he hopes to buy an industrial sewing machine. This is his first loan with the organization since starting this work 45 years ago. This is why Augusto is requesting a loan to buy an industrial leather sewing machine to make leather jackets.

loans.use: to buy an industrial leather sewing machine to make leather jackets.

loans.name: Sangira Group

texts.fr:
Bosco  fait partie du groupe  Sangira et  habite à  Ngozi. Il a 41 ans et est marié à Césarie ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 7 à 18 ans, tous étudient. 

Il a fait le commerce de haricot, de riz, de banane,...   depuis  8 ans. 

Il est son treizième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  du haricot, du riz, de banane à revendre cuits dans son restaurant, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Bosco is a member of the group called Sangira and he lives in Ngozi. He is 41 years old and married to Césarie, a farmer. Together they have four children, aged between 7 and 18, all enrolled in school. He has been selling dried beans, rice and bananas, etc. for eight years.

He is on his thirteenth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is requesting, he is going to grow his working capital and buy some dried beans, rice, and bananas to resell as cooked food in his little restaurant, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to see his children study.

loans.use: to expand his working capital and buy dried beans, rice, and bananas to resell as cooked food in his restaurant, so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to deposit money on his mobile money account  to increase his capital.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Maiyashi Village. Sani joined Babban Gona to expand his  farm and grow his  agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Sani will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Sani now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Meng's Group

texts.en: Twenty-year-old Meng is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. Meng is growing rice as the main income for her family while her husband is driving a taxi to earn additional income. Together, they earn about 12USD per day to make a living. Since the crop is threatened by pests and diseases, it grows unhealthily and produces lower-than-expected outputs. It is Meng’s first loan cycle with VisionFund and she, who is the group leader, will use her loan to purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizer to improve the farmland. She hopes she can upgrade the standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizer to  increase productivity of her crop yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tudun Saibu Village. Ahmed joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ahmed will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help himearn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.  This season, Ahmed has grand plans to harvest 70 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ahmed now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Asabe

texts.en:
Asabe is a Babban Gona farmer from Shamaki village. Asabe joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Asabe will have access to top-of-the-line farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds.

This loan will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase her net income, Asabe would like to use her extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en: Tha is a 30-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is in school while another one is under the age of schoolchildren. She, together with her husband, has been growing rice as the main source of income for ten years. She can earn about 45,000 KHR per day and can save approximately 25,000 KHR after deducting daily expenses. This is her first time applying for a loan from VisionFund. As the leader of a group of two, she will use her loan to build a decent latrine. She believes that this purchase can help her children live in a healthy environment and protect them from infectious disease so that they can go to school regularly.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine to help her children live in a healthy environment and protect them from infectious disease so that they can go to school regularly.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dokantagwai Village. He joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to repair his house or move into a bigger home.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yahaya will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average of 14 bags per hectare. This year, Yahaya has set high goals of harvesting 30 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Yahaya has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farm's yields.

This year, Abdulahamid has set high goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Abdulahamid has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase her increase her income considerably.  This season Rahila has ambitious plans to harvest 20 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rahila now has the opportunity to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is a Babban Gona farmer from Waziri Village. she joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Rhoda no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve her yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase her increase her income considerably.  This season Rhoda has ambitious plans to harvest 20 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rhoda now has the opportunity to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Clarah

texts.en: Clarah is aged 30; she works very well with her community where she works with young rural girls and women, assisting them to further their education and conduct English lessons. She is also working with community members and other stakeholders in training them in Integrated Sustainable Agricultural practices in order to boost up and add value to their agricultural businesses. In schools she works together with learner guides to follow up with school dropouts and ensure that children are well. In schools, she is working with them on how to manage waste and make it resourceful; for example paper and ashes. She is assisting vulnerable children with stationery, sanitary wear, and food. With the Kiva loan she intends to buy more cattle, feeds and drugs. This loan is going to enable her to boost up her business with cattle pen fattening. She believe that this loan is going to improve the standards of her  family, transform her life, and help her to construct more improved structures at her homestead.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle, feeds and drugs.

loans.name: Serena School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Florence. She is the Deputy Head Teacher of Serena School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Lweza in Wakiso with 120 students. Serena School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistently clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Serena School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Florence ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a divorced mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Tokoin avec son enfant et son mari. Akou est âgée de 54 ans et  s’active énormément pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Akou est une revendeuse de pagnes baltique et des casseroles qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile puis dans les quartiers environnant. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Akou sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes baltiques et des unités de casseroles afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Akou is an energetic married woman who lives in Tokoin with her child and her husband. She is 54 years old and works incredibly hard to be in good financial circumstances. Akou is a retailer of Baltic pagnes [clothing made from traditional cloth] and saucepans; she gets her supplies four times per month at the market and resells them from her home and in nearby neighborhoods. 

In order to meet her goals, Akou is seeking this loan to purchase pieces of Baltic pagne cloth and saucepans so she can meet the needs of her customers and have financial autonomy to help her children with their academic education.

loans.use: To purchase four saucepans and four pieces of Baltic pagne cloth [used in traditional clothing].

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanakombo operates a charcoal business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators. She also operates a clothes-selling business that earns her additional income.

With this Kshs 40,000 loan, Mwanakombo will purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Nary makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and officer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 33 years old married with two children. He has been running a motorcycle services business for the last five years. His monthly income is KES 15,000.

He is borrowing loan of KES 113,500 to buy a motorcycle for transporting goods and providing services to his customers. This is his first loan from Visionfund.

He will use the profit from his business to buy spare parts for the motorcycle and pay school fees for his children His hopes and dreams for the future are to buy another motorcycle and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle for transporting goods and serving his customers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is aged 51 years old. He is married and has five children to support. He has been in this business for the last five years. He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more trees for planting to enable him to meet his clients' demands for trees. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and also to buy a dairy cow for milk production. His hopes and dreams are to expand his farming business and be successful.

loans.use: To purchase more trees for planting in order to enable him to meet his clients' demands for trees.

loans.name: Mary

Mary has operated a tailoring business for the past six years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth, material and sewing thread for her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth, material and sewing thread for her business.

He hopes to complete his house but is challenged by the low pay. He has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy building materials like iron sheets and timber.

loans.use: to buy building materials like iron sheets and timber.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like soft drinks, mineral water, edible oil, beverages, noodles, canned goods and toiletries. She is married woman with three children. Her youngest child is 20. Aside from operating a sari-sari store, she cooks and prepares homemade meals to the locals in her place.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies for the store like assorted groceries, such as rice, meat, vegetables and seasonings. With these, she would be able to maintain the stocks of her store and sell a variety of meals to be served to her respective customers. Thus, she could start some expansion and be able to handle her finances.

In the future, Victoria would like to do her best to successfully manage her business for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the store like assorted groceries such as rice, meat, vegetables and seasonings.

Sakorn will use her portion of this group loan to buy a water filter to have access to safe drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families. They will also save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

She has had a retail shop business for 4 years.

With the anticipated profits, Charity will be able to restock her business and even diversify to rearing goats for resale.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have several businesses and succeed in life.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

texts.en:
Letecia is 61 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

Letecia has been in this business for 8 years now. 

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk food, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Fabian Ramiro

texts.es:
Fabian es un hombre muy trabajador tiene 48 años es divorciado... el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz y se dedica a engordar gallinas.

El dinero solicita para comprar semilla, productos para cuidar el maiz ademas para comprar balanceado para las gallinas.

El sueño de Fabian es comprar otro terreno para seguir sembrando en los tiempos libres le gusta caminar y conversar con los vecinos.
texts.en:
Fabian is a very hard-working man, he is forty-eight years old and divorced. He works in agriculture, planting corn, and he raises chickens.

The loan he is requesting will be used for buying seeds and products for tending to his corn crop, and to buy chicken feed.

Fabian's dream is to buy another plot of land to plant on. In his free time, he likes to go for walks and talk with his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy seeds and products to tend to his corn

loans.name: Segundo Audelo

texts.es: Segundo, tiene 50 años, utiliza su silla de ruedas para movilizarse,  sin embargo esto no ha sido un impedimento para seguir progresando. Ha sacado adelante a sus 3 hijos, que estudian aún en el colegio. Su vida ha sido muy difícil, quedo viudo,  cuando sus hijos iniciaban su adolescencia. Sumado a esto   tuvo que trabajar muy duro. Sale de su casa acompañado  de uno de sus hijos a  Vender legumbres, verduras, granos, de casa en casa, por todo el barrio cercano a su vivienda. Desde hace cuatro años, empezó a criar animales menores, como  cuyes, conejos y cerdos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Produce  tanto para la venta   y subsistencia. En este negocio él obtiene más ganancias.  El quiere  tener un lugar con mejores instalaciones para su criadero y no tener que movilizarse mucho por su impedimento físico.Con este crédito va a comprar más cerdos pequeños para engordarlos y vender. Se considera una persona emprendedora y es ejemplo para muchas personas que le conocen, ya que le ven el ímpetu con que  trabaja y sueña para  cambiar su vida. Como él lo dice: Tengo que trabajar muy duro para sobrevivir.
texts.en: Segundo is fifty years old. He uses a wheelchair to get around, but that has not stopped him from striving to get ahead. He has raised his three children, who are still in school. His life has been very hard, he was left a widower when his children were just entering adolescence. On top of that he had to work very hard. He leaves his home along with one of his children to sell beans, vegetables, and grains, door to door, throughout his neighborhood. Four years ago he began raising small animals like guinea pigs, rabbits and pigs to improve his standard of living. It produces enough to sell and for subsistence. He makes better income at this business. He would like to have a better-outfitted space for raising the animals, where he would not have to move around too much because of his disability. With this loan he will purchase more piglets to fatten and sell. His is a very enterprising man, and is a role model to many people who know him, as they see the dedication he has to his work, and his dream to change his life. As he himself says: I have to work very hard to survive.

loans.use: buy more piglets to fatten them up and sell them

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman and has been blessed with three children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en: Son’s Group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Son makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor and officer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with four children. She lives at her own house that has piped water and electricity. She cites food as her greatest monthly expense.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the marketplace. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Hamid

texts.ru:
Хамид добродушный и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 32 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Хамид живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он также занимается своим бизнесом. Хамид занимается дехканством и животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле Хамид занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот.
 Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Хамид хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Хамид заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hamid is a kind-hearted man with a positive attitude toward life.  He is married and he has three children.  He lives with his family in a small house in the countryside.  He has his own business, which helps him to support his family.  He works as a farmer and also raises livestock.  He has some land: part of his land is actually dry land, the rest is irrigated land.  On his irrigated land, Hamid grows carrots, potatoes and grains.  His wife helps him to take care and raise the livestock.

Hamid's animal husbandry business brings him a good income so, for this reason, he would like to increase his cattle headcount and expand his activity.  He has turned to Kiva's field partner, MDO Arvand, in order to get a loan to buy livestock.  He thanks them in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy some livestock.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province, in Cambodia.

Sokha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and a construction worker to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water to her family.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru: Майраму 42 лет. Она проживает в Кубадиён. Она жена и мать. Ее муж занимается животноводством. Майрам занимается животноводством уже долгое время. Майрам приняла бизнес своих предков. Почти все жители района занимаются сельскохозяйственной деятельностью, так как и другой работы очень мало. Поэтому многие мужчины находятся на заработках. Сейчас Майрам активно продвигает свой бизнес и хочет добиться признаний своей области. Причина обращения за кредитом со стороны Майрама является увеличения поголовья скотов. Ее сбережения не позволяют ей приобрести не обходимое количество скот, и она приняла решения полагаться на заемные средства.
texts.en:
Mayram is 42 and she lives in the Qubadiyon district of Tajikistan.  She is a wife and mother.  Her husband is involved in animal husbandry.  Mayram herself is following in her ancestors' footsteps and she has also been raising livestock for a long time.  Almost all the residents of the district are involved in agriculture, because there are very few other jobs.  For this reason also, many Tajik men have left the country to work as migrant workers elsewhere.

At the moment, Mayram is actively developing her business and she wants to receive recognition in her field of work.  She particularly wants to increase her livestock headcount, which is the reason why she is taking a loan.  Her savings are not sufficient and do not allow her to purchase the number of animals that she needs to buy, so she has decided to rely on a loan.

loans.use: to buy some livestock and increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Amada Isabel

texts.es: Amada se convirtió en una empresaria independiente luego de vincularse a una novedosa forma de comercio; ella recibió la invitación de una amiga que promovía ventas por intermedio de catálogos que oferta un sin número de productos especializados en el cuidado personal y logró cautivarla.  Amada interesada en  buscar un medio de ingreso adicional, no dudo en incorporarse en esta labor y empezó a ofrecer a sus conocidos, amigos y vecinos del sector donde reside en el municipio de Barranquilla contando con una gran acogida.  En la actualidad cuenta con 10 años de funcionamiento y está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en artículos del catálogo; cremas corporales, splash, perfumes, joyas y demás.  Con esta inversión es muy importante para poder responder a las solicitudes de sus clientes. Su meta a futuro es abrir un local y realizar adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en: Amada became an independent entrepreneur after linking herself to a novel form of business.  She was invited by a friend who was promoting sales through the medium of catalogs, which offer a countless number of specialized personal care products.  This captivated Amada, who was interested in finding an additional source of income.  She became involved in this work and began selling to her acquaintances, friends and neighbors in her area of Barranquilla anticipating a great reception.  She has been operating for 10 years and is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in items to sell via catalog: body creams, body spray, perfumes, jewels and more.  This investment is very important to be able to respond to her customer's requests.  Her goal for the future is to open a storefront and adapt space in her home.

loans.use: to invest in items to sell via catalog: body creams, body spray, perfumes, jewels and more

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is single with three children, two of whom attend school.

He operates a retail shop and is also a farmer. These two sources income help him in his other developments. For example, he has been able to buy more land for farming through the savings he got from his businesses.

Julius hopes to operate his shop on a wholesale level. If he borrowed money, there is no doubt he will be able to pay it back on time. He requests a loan to buy boxes of soap, bags of sugar, and general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap, bags of sugar, and general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda where he grows cocoa to help support his family. He sells his crop to cocoa companies that buy directly from farmers, and earns additional money by raising cattle. His main challenge is the limited amount of capital he has to invest in the cocoa business during the peak season when sales are very high. He hopes to improve his business in future, build a permanent house and educate his children.  He has requested a loan to pay for labor to prepare his cocoa farm for harvest.

loans.use: to pay for workers to help with his cocoa garden.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en: Mwanamkuu is married and blessed with three children, two of whom attend school. She lives with her husband and children in a house that neither has electricity nor plumbing. For the last nine years, she has earned a living by selling fish from her home to restaurants and passersby. Her biggest challenge is people who fall behind on making payments. Mwanamkuu has requested this loan to buy more fish to resell. She dreams of expanding her current business and establishing a new one in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell.

loans.name: Noun's Group

texts.en: Noun’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Noun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: José Angel

texts.es:
José Ángel es un pequeño productor de café de la zona Norte de Nicaragua. Su deseo es que su familia tenga mejores condiciones cada día. Por eso cada mañana se levanta a trabajar su pequeña finca para ir construyendo la semilla que dejará a sus 2 hijos algún día.

Este año, está solicitando un crédito para garantizar la compra de insumos que le permitan asegurar las actividades de mantenimiento de su cafetal. Con esta inversión, logrará una mejor cosecha y con ello mayores ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de este productor es que en un mediano plazo, la productividad de su finca se incremente y le permita garantizar a sus hijos mejores oportunidades para su formación y futuro.
texts.en:
José Ángel is a small coffee farmer in the northern part of Nicaragua. His dream is that his family have better conditions every day. Because of this, he wakes up every morning to work his small farm to build the seed that he will leave to his two children one day.

This year, he is requesting a loan to guarantee the purchase of supplies that will allow him to assure maintenance activities on his coffee farm. With this investment, he will achieve a better harvest, and with it a better income for his family.

The dream of this farmer is that in the mid-term the productivity of his farm grows incrementally and allows him to guarantee his children better opportunities for their growth and future.

loans.use: to buy required supplies to maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat  is 37 years old, married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 5 children. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 30000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 58 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ofelia has been raising pigs for 27 years and also earns additional income from photography.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a hardworking man in Kamwenge, Uganda where he operates a retail shop that mainly sells phones and their accessories. He supplements this business with a special butcher and rearing of cows to earn additional income in order to improve standards of living. He hopes to become prominent in business and cause development by creating more job opportunities in his town.
He has not succeeded in his plans due to inadequate capital to expand his businesses and satisfy his dreams. He is requesting for a loan to buy more phones and accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy more phones and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married mother of three children, none of whom attend school because they are grown-ups. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twelve years, Mwanamkasi has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Meshomari

texts.en: Meshomari is married and the mother of six children, some of whom do not currently attend school because they are grown. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor plumbing. For the last four years, she has operated a retail shop where she sells household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Her biggest challenge is inflation. Meshomari has requested this loan to buy sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Kilo

texts.en: Kilo is married with six children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor plumbing. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. Kilo earns a living by running a stall in town where she sells groceries and vegetables to town residents and neighbors. Her main challenge is competition. She has requested a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy cabbage, oranges, tomatoes, and a sack of green vegetables to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, oranges, tomatoes, and a sack of green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, Risper has operated a clothes-selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, Risper wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour,beans and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour,beans and cooking fat

loans.name: Thoai

texts.en: Mrs. Thoai is 53 years old, married and has one child. She works hard to support her family. She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve health of her family’s member and also for environment protection. Husbandry and fishing are the main income of her family and she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: Азимчон мужчина в возрасте 53 лет. Азимчон женат и имеет  2 детей. Азимчон по профессии учитель русского языка. Данное время он работает средней школе.  Дочка Азимчона закончила среднюю школу и хочет поступить в университет. После поступления в университет они  должны оплатить обучение за первый год его обучения там. Но у Азимчона на сегодня не имеется такой большой суммы, чтобы сразу заплатить. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд, когда узнал что есть возможность получить кредит на оплату образования. Азимчон  желает получить кредит для оплаты обучения своей дочери. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Azimjon is 53, married, and the father of two children.  By profession, he is a Russian teacher and he currently works in a secondary school.  His daughter has just graduated from secondary school and she wants to go to university.  The family therefore needs to pay for her first-year tuition fees, but Azimjon doesn't have such a big sum of money to pay her whole tuition fee.  For this reason, he turned to Kiva's field partner, MDO Arvand, as soon as he heard about the possibility of receiving an education loan.  Azimjon wants to receive a loan to pay for his daughter's education.  He looks very forward to a positive outcome and he thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is currently operating two jeepneys (which is a Filipino form of a bus and the most popular public transportation in the Philippines). Managing this type of business really is challenging since you need to make sure that engines are working fine, you also need to carefully choose drivers that are disciplined, cautious and has knowledge on how to drive carefully and operate engines.  Nestor wants to thank Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for approving his previous loan and he also wants to express his deepest appreciation for your generosity dear lenders.

Like any other business goal, Nestor wants to succeed in the industry, he also aims to invest for properties, save money for their future, continue to support his children’s education and provide needs for his family. That’s why he’s persevere to succeed in the business. Aside from hard work and patience, capital is one of the bases for business’ success to take place. That’s why Nestor decided to apply for another loan of P50, 000 since he’s planning to buy another jeepney unit. The amount will really be a great help for his business and he’s hoping that you’ll consider again his story.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Nestor  spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where he can gain strength spiritually and where he hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy another jeepney to expand his services.

loans.name: Adeela

texts.en:
Adeela is a 27 years old married woman and mother of three children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a clothing sales business, which is the only source of income for the family.

Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that Adeela is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the profit, he will put aside some savings to pay for the electricity and gas bills. Adeela hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Evangiline

texts.en: Evangiline is married and the mother of two school-aged children. She lives with her family in a house that has neither has electricity nor plumbing. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.  She operates a business where she sells Khanga (a cloth used by women) from home and by going door to door to neighbors and passersby. Her biggest challenge is the high cost of transportation. She is requesting a loan to buy more Khanga cloth to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas (a type of cloth) to resell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years Betty has sold used clothes door to door to her neighbors and passersby. The high cost of transportation is a major challenge for her.

In order to boost her business, Betty joined Kiva's field partner Yehu in order to access its loans. She has applied for a 20,000 KES loan to buy additional bales of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy additional bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years Bahati has sold used clothes door to door to her neighbors and passersby. The high cost of transportation is a major challenge for her.

In order to boost her business, Bahati joined Kiva's field partner Yehu in order to access its loans. She has applied for a 25,000 KES loan to buy additional bales of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy additional bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bintimuhamed

texts.en:
Bintimuhamed is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business.  She sells from her home to her neighbours and passersby. Seasonality is a major challenge to her business. 

Bintimuhamed decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a Kshs 15,000 loan to purchase wheat and maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Kelly Alicia

texts.es:
La felicidad que corre por la mirada de Kelly, hace que todos los de su aula se contagien del orgullo que siente de estar a un último paso para convertirse en licenciada en Comercio Internacional. A sus veinte años de edad, trabaja los días de semana y estudia el cuarto año de la carrera todos los sábados para no interrumpir sus sueños en ningún momento. 
Kelly cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien tiene un taller de torno, lo que la hace sentirse respaldada a diario y más en esta última etapa que está iniciando, que es su posgrado. De manera que ella solicita un préstamo para pagar todo su posgrado en Comercio Internacional. Ella considera que esta oportunidad de conseguir su posgrado, en estos momentos, la coloca en este mundo competitivo de profesionales en una buena posición, puesto que se graduará con su título de licenciada y su posgrado al mismo tiempo. En los planes de esta joven con gran visión esta ser emprendedora en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
The happiness that runs through Kelly's face infects everyone in her class with the pride she feels for being at the last phase to receiving her Bachelor's Degree International Business.

At 20 years old, she works weekdays and goes to school (the fourth year of her program) every Saturday in order to not interrupt her dreams. Kelly has the support of her husband, who has a lathe shop and who makes her feel daily that he has her back -- more in this last phase that she's starting, which is her postgraduate study.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan to pay all of her postgraduate studies in international business. She considers that this opportunity to obtain her degree in this instant places her in the competitive world of professionals in a good position, given that she will graduate with her Bachelor's Degree and her postgraduate at the same time.

This young lady's grand plans are to be an entrepreneur in her own business.

loans.use: to pay for postgraduate studies in international business.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia  is 32 years old, hardworking woman who has 3 children. She has been providing the service of sewing clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Asia ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Asia  has requested for a loan amount 40000 PKR. She intends to use this loan  to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Kouy's Group

texts.en:
Kouy lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Besides being the leader of this five-member group, she farms rice and makes extra money working as both a tailor and teacher in order to support her family.

In Kouy's village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. To alleviate this problem she is borrowing 840,000 KHR from Kiva's field partner iDE-Cambodia for the group to buy five water filters for themselves. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married. He operates a produce business selling maize and coffee.  He is a hard working man and manages his business very well. 

Due to Samuel's hard work, he has managed to save money and start a bar, which increases his income. He desires to become a big coffee dealer, but lacks capital. He is requesting money to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and coffee to sell

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman and has been blessed with nine children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Roneth

texts.en:
Roneth is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roneth is 31 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Roneth has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Roneth has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Familia Cedros Group

texts.es:
El grupo Familia Cedros está conformado por cuatro mujeres muy trabajadoras, siempre muy comprometidas con sus familias, y con un gran espíritu emprendedor. Ellas habitan una comunidad muy tranquila con raíces de la etnia indígena mazahua, las personas aún conservan su vestimenta típica y su lengua materna. Las actividades principales de la región son la cría de ovinos y el cultivo de maíz y de nopal. 

 Reynarely es una joven muy alegre de 26 años que vive en unión libre con César, ellos son padres de una pequeña que está a punto de iniciar su educación a finales de agosto.
