 Reyna, como le llaman de cariño, se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades como servilletas, servilletas, deshilados, bordado en listón y prendas tejidas. Desde pequeña, Reyna siempre mostró gran interés en este tipo de actividad. "Me encanta trasformar materiales para decorar" comentó muy contenta. Además, desde los 15 años comenzó a tomar cursos para desarrollar aún más sus habilidades.

Hace cuatro años, Reyna solicitó su primer crédito en VFMéxico, finanicamiento vital para iniciar su negocio. Con el dinero obtenido compró tela, estambres, agujas, listón entre otros materiales. La casa de Reyna es el lugar donde deja volar su creatividad y donde ocurre esa transformación, sus clientes ya la conocen y llegan a su casa a comprar piezas o hacen pedidos especiales para distintos tipos de eventos.
 
Reyna se muestra muy orgullosa por sus logros, a través del tiempo ha adquirido experiencia lo que le ayuda a elaborar una gran variedad de manualidades cada vez en menor tiempo. Además está muy agradecida por el apoyo económico que ha conseguido gracias a VFMéxico. Con el nuevo préstamo comprará más material, específicamente hilos, listón y tela.

Otro punto a favor del negocio es que Reyna tiene la oportunidad de pasar suficiente tiempo con su pequeña y atender las actividades del hogar a la vez que genera ingresos. Su meta es continuar aprendiendo para mejorar la calidad de sus productos. 

 Las demás integrantes del grupo son Verónica quien invierte en productos para el hogar; Isidora; en borregos y Rosaisela, en ropa.

*La fotografia fue tomada en el parque del municipio, Reyna es quien viste el suéter blanco*
texts.en:
The Familia Cedros Group is made up of four hard-working women. They are always very committed to their families and have an entrepreneurial spirit. They live in a very calm community with roots in the indigenous Mazahua ethnicity. The people still preserve the typical clothing and the language. The principle activities in the region are raising sheep and growing corn and nopal.

Reynarely is a very happy young woman. She is 26 years old and is in a common-law marriage with Cesar. They are the parents of a little girl who is about to start school at the end of August. Reyna, as she is lovingly called, earns a living making crafts such as napkins, embroidered handkerchiefs with ribbon, and knitted clothing. Since she was small, Reyna always showed interest in this type of occupation. "I love to transform materials in order to decorate," she mentioned contently. Also, from the time she was 15 years old she began taking classes to further develop her abilities.

Four years ago, Reyna requested her first loan from VFMexico. This financing was vital in starting her business. With the money she received she bought string, yarn, needles, ribbon and other materials. Reyna's house is where she lets her creativity free and where the transformation occurs. Her customers already know her and come to her house to buy pieces or make special orders for specific types of events.

Reyna appears very proud of her accomplishments. Over time she has gained experience that helps her to make a large variety of crafts in less time. She is also very grateful for the financial support that she has received from VFMexico. With the new loan she will buy more material, specifically string, ribbon, and yarn.

Another positive point to her business is that she has the opportunity to spend plenty of time with her daughter and tend to the household chores while she earns an income. Her goal is to continue learning in order to improve the quality of her products. The other members of the group are Veronica, who works in home products; Isidora in sheep, and Rosaisela in clothing.

*The photograph was taken in the municipal park, and Reyna is the one wearing the white sweater*

loans.use: to buy string, ribbon, and yarn.

location.town: Concepción chico, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: 14 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “14 DE DICIEMBRE” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de flores, venta de frutas, venta de faldas para cholitas, venta de productos lácteos, venta de chamarras y sombreros. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución, que se realizó en zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chamarras y sombreros; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñada hace tres años.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de chamarras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “14 DE DICIEMBRE” communal bank will begin its eleventh cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch regional hub. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of directors with Lourdes as President. The variety of businesses run by members of the communal bank include selling food, flowers, fruit, cholita skirts, dairy products, jackets, and hats.

The loan they will take out will benefit female small business owners, including Lourdes. She says that she has been part of Pro Mujer for five years, joining through an invitation from an institution promotion in the area. Now she has a business selling jackets and hats. She states that she learned this business from her sister-in-law three years ago.

The loan she will take out now will be for increasing capital (buying jackets in bulk)
that she will get from the sellers in the city of El Alto. She will later sell them in her sales space.
This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy jackets.

loans.name: Caracol Group

texts.es:
Caracol lleva por nombre el grupo ubicado en una comunidad donde prevalece la cultura mazateca, tradiciones, costumbres y lenguaje donde el 90 % de la población habla mazateco, la escuela de la comunidad es bilingüe, las actividades principales son el cultivo de caña de azúcar y la pesca.

El grupo eligió el nombre por la comunidad la cual asemeja el caparazón de un caracol, las integrantes del grupo son: 

María – Ropa 
Epifanía, Reyes – Fletera Y Taxi
Lucia, Isidoro - Mojarra
Emma – Abarrotes 
José – Zapatos 
Esperanza – Antojitos 

Doña Epifanía tiene 54 años enviudo hace 12 años y desde entonces se ha convertido en padre y madre de sus 4 hijos de los cuales dos dependen económicamente de ella, anteriormente ella se desempeñaba como docente en la escuela de la comunidad, al graduarse su hija le cedió plaza y fue así como hace 10 años decidió iniciar con el servicio de fletera pues para salir de la comunidad a la carretera donde se toma el autobús se deben recorrer cerca de 6 kilómetros los cuales son difíciles cuando el calor están en su punto máximo o cuando llueve.

La necesidad de ofrecerle lo mejor a su familia y brindarles estudio a sus hijos además de solventar los gastos del funeral de su esposo, doña Epifanía brinda empleo a 2 personas quienes son los choferes de las fleteras sueldos que solventa con las ganancias obtenidas.

Los préstamos que le han sido otorgados los ha invertido en el servicio de las camionetas con el fin de brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes, los conductores de la fletera se han comprometido con traer limpia la unidad, conducir con precaución y para poder estar al tanto de lo que sucede adquirió tres equipos de radio, de tal manera monitorea las unidades si les falta gasolina, se ponchan, se atascan y acudir a su rescate.

Lograr tener una concesión mayor de taxis y continuar con el patrimonio para sus hijos es por lo que lucha día con día doña Epi como le conocen para lograr tener 5 o más unidades que brinden un servicio de calidad cuyos costos sean accesibles  aumentando sus ingresos.

El préstamo que le han solicitado lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de  las dos camionetas y en tapizar los asientos de la batea.

El grupo agradece por las oportunidades que les han brindado al otorgarles nuevamente un préstamo pues para ellos significa una nueva oportunidad de crecimiento para cada una de sus actividades.

*Ellos son los integrantes del grupo Caracol, doña Epi es quien viste blusa color verde.
texts.en:
Caracol is the name of the group located in a community where the Mazatec culture, traditions, customs and languages prevail, and where 90% of the population speaks Mazatec, the school in the community is bilingual and the main activities are cultivating sugarcane and fishing. The group chose the name because the community looks like a snail shell. The members of the group are: María – clothing;  Epifanía and Reyes – freight and taxi business; 
Lucia and Isidoro - Fish (Bream); Emma – grocery store;  José – shoes; Esperanza – snacks. Epifanía is 54 years old. Twelve years ago she became a widow, and from then on she has been father and mother to her four children, two of whom are still financially dependent. Previously, she worked as a teacher in her local school. When her daughter graduated, she gave her the position. This was how, ten years ago, she decided to start a freight business because in order to leave her community and get to the highway where one takes the bus, one must travel some 6 kilometers that are difficult when it is very hot or when it rains. In order to give her family the best and give her children an education, and also to pay for her husband's funeral expenses, Epifanía gives employment to two people who are the drivers of her freight business. She pays their salaries with the obtained earnings. They have invested the given loans in the service of station wagons in order to give quality service to their customers. The drivers of the freight business have promised to keep their cars clean and drive carefully. In order to be informed of what is happening, she acquired three radio equipments, which help monitor if the cars run out of gas, have flat tires, get stuck in traffic, and to come assist them. To get a larger taxi concession and to continue with this business for her children, Epi - as she is known in her town- struggles day by day to have 5 or more cars to give a quality service with accessible costs and increase her income. The loan they have requested will be invested in maintaining the two station wagons and reupholstering the car seats. The group is grateful for the given opportunity of a new loan, because it means a new growth opportunity for each one of their activities. *These are the members of the Caracol Group. Epi is wearing a green color blouse.

loans.use: to give maintenance to the station wagons and to reupholster the car seats.

location.town: Cosolapa Caracol, San Miguel Soyaltepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on different fruits and vegetables that he sells.

loans.name: Blanca Yaquelina

texts.es:
Blanca, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado y es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de 20 y 10 años de edad, su hijo mayor trabaja en la agricultura y su hija menor estudia en la escuela de la comunidad. 

Blanca, tiene un molino de nixtamal, una panadería artesanal y comercializa cerdos; sus hijos le ayudan a atender el molino y a vender el pan, ella negocia con cerdos desde hace 8 años y su hijo sale a vender pan en una motocicleta.

El crédito lo necesita para ampliar el horno, comprar lámina y madera para que no se moje cuando llueve, porque tiene más demanda y no tiene el dinero suficiente para ampliarlo.

Además, comprará latas para ampliar su panadería, para generar empleo para sus hijos y tener un negocio que les genere muchas ganancias a nivel familiar.
texts.en:
Blanca, 37, studied up to the ninth grade and is a single mother with two children, 20 and 10. Her older son works in agriculture and her younger daughter studies in the community school.
Blanca has a hominy mill, an artisanal bakery and she sells pigs. Her children help her with the mill and selling bread. She has been selling pigs for eight years and her son goes out to sell bread on a motorcycle.
She needs the loan to expand her oven, to purchase corrugated tin and wood so they don't get wet when it rains, because she has more demand and she doesn't have enough money to expand it.
In addition, she will buy tinplate to expand her bakery in order to generate employment for her children and have a business that generates more earnings at the family level for them.

loans.use: to expand her oven, to purchase corrugated tin and wood so they don't get wet when it rains, and to buy tinplate to expand her bakery.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over nine years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a retired high school teacher for a local school district in San Diego. During his teaching career, David would coordinate educational group trips for his students at the school. David’s colleagues would always ask him for help scheduling and coordinating their tours, so he saw that there was a market for a business that assists teachers and educators in booking and scheduling a variety of trips.

David established his business, A Plus Educational Tours, five years ago. After his retirement, he decided to focus on making it his full-time business. His business coordinates educational and college field trips, and sports and performing tours for various schools in San Diego, Nevada, and Arizona.

David will use his Kiva loan to upgrade his website and to add an online payment option. (http://www.apluseducationaltours.com)

One day, David hopes to be able to cover the costs to take low-to-moderate-income students on free or very low-cost tours.

“I love seeing the anticipation on the students' faces before they are about to step on to a college campus for the first time,” says David. “It is very rewarding to be able to show them that the dream of going to college is possible for them.”

loans.use: to upgrade his website and to add an online payment option for his clients.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres Xexac Group

texts.es:
Emprendedora de grandes aspiraciones y metas es Maria de 38 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de dos hijas de las edades entre 8 y 9 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del caserío xexac.
Maria(la primera del lado derecho de la foto) para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa  hace un año decidió elegir una actividad que le permitiera a ella obtener un mejor ingreso y la actividad que ella dignamente escogió fue la venta de ropa típica, la razón por la cual ella se inclinó por este tipo de negocio es porque en su comunidad toda la gente viste de traje típico, gracias a su amabilidad, buen servicio con los clientes su producto ahora ya no se da abasto es por ello que ha considerado necesario solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como; fajas, cortes blusas.
El gran sueño de Maria es que su negocio sea más grande para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
An entrepreneur with a lot of ambition and goals, Maria, 38 years old, is single and with a beautiful family of 2 daughters between the ages of 8 and 9. This humble family live in a community of the Xexac village.

Maria is the first one on the right side of the photo. To obtain revenue and to support her partner with the household expenses, she decided a year ago to do something that would allow her to obtain a better income. The activity she selected was to buy and sell traditional clothing. The reason she decided on this business is because everyone in her community wears traditional clothing. Because of her kindness and good service with her customers, she runs out of her product. For this reason she considered it was necessary to obtain a loan to purchase products such as, sashes, skirts and traditional blouses.

Maria’s dream is to expand her business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Vickie

texts.en:
Vickie has been interested in natural herbs, incense and oils for most of her life. She decided that she would take charge of her future, and try to become more self-sustainable financially.

Her business, Vickie Incense, was established four years ago. She sells oils, incense, soaps, room deodorizers and accessories.

She is currently in school for greenery, a certification for landscaping, plants, etc. Vickie is also going through a program called PASS, which is a program that helps people become self-sustainable. She will be marketing her business by attending the local farmers markets and flea markets to develop a relationship with them, which will help her to expand the business.

Vickie will use her Kiva loan to purchase inventory and supplies for her business. Her ultimate goal with the business is to have it be an avenue for the youth at risk to use for employment and sales training. At this time, she is understanding that it takes time to build her business and is using every opportunity to do so.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and supplies for her incense business

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than came to the United States from Burma in October 2010 as a refugee. He has since gained his permanent resident status. While he was living in Burma, he worked in the jewelry industry for many years. When he came to the United States, he was looking for a new career that would be easy for him to enter into with limited English skills.

A friend who was working as a chef got Than into the food industry. He then trained as a chef for 2 to 3 months before he began working as a sushi chef in an AFC Sushi franchise for two years. After two years of working in the industry, Than decided to purchase and open his own franchise location in a local grocery store. He opened his first sushi bar located inside the Ralph’s Grocery Store in the Point Loma area of San Diego.

Business was going very well, so he has recently expanded the business through the purchase of three additional franchise locations within grocery stores. He has hired three new employees to run these locations.

Than will use the $5,000 Kiva loan to pay the new employees he has hired for the additional franchise locations. He will continue to run the business as the chef at his current location, and therefore needed to hire employees to work as chefs for the remaining locations.

loans.use: to pay the new employees that he hired to work at his new locations of his sushi business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 62 years old and is married with five children. For the past three years, she has run a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Veronica is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Veronica is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with seven kids, all of whom attend school. She operates a business selling vegetables in the market to town-dwellers and her neighbors. Joyce owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees. Her business challenge includes client debt. Joyce decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Joyce is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to purchase a stock of green vegetables and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Richirani

texts.en:
Richirani is a widowed woman who is blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. For over eight years, she has operated a fish-selling business. Richirani sells from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. She lives with her children in their own house without electricity or running water. Richirani’s major business challenges are seasonality and perishabililty which lead to financial losses.

Richirani is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of fish to sell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married woman with one child who attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. 

With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase maize flour, rice and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice and beans for resale

loans.name: Paulini

texts.en: Paulini is 47 years old, married with six children, five of whom go to school, and living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer and at the same time a retailer selling water to the locals for additional income. He has been in that business since 2013 to earn a living and serve his community by bringing services closer to them. This was after his people were complaining of long distances to access water. For extra income, he grows and sells cocoa. He dreams of expanding his business; however, he is limited by inadequate capital and high license fees. Paulini has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma operates a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason with the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw

loans.name: José Marcos

texts.es:
José Marcos tiene 43 años de edad y cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en la caficultura. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos y musáceas, pero en la caficultura encontró un medio para solventar la mayoría de las necesidades de su familia; su finca cuenta con suelos ricos en materia orgánica y de gran potencial para la producción de café y otros cultivos.

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permita garantizar el mantenimiento de su cafetal y aumentar los resultados de su cosecha. 

Con la visión de garantizar la alimentación, la educación y la salud de su familia, la meta de José Marcos, es hacer de su finca una unidad de negocio rentable que le permita dar a su esposa e hijos un mejor bienestar. En los próximos años, se ha propuesto continuar invirtiendo en su finca realizando actividades de manejo de tejidos y establecimiento de nuevas áreas de café, para incrementar su producción e ingresos.
texts.en:
José Marcos is 43 years old and he has four years experience in growing coffee. Before this he worked growing basic grains and bananas. In coffee he found a medium to solve the majority of his family's needs. His farm has rich organic material which has great potential for the production of coffee and other crops.

For this season he is requesting a loan to buy inputs and fertilizer that will guarantee the upkeep of his coffee crops and increase the results of his harvest.

With the idea of guaranteeing the food, education and health of his family, José Marcos' goal is to make his farm a profitable business unit which would allow him to provide his wife and children greater well-being. In the coming years he proposes to continue to invest in his farm doing some plant mangement to establish new areas of coffee to increase his production and income.

loans.use: to buy inputs and fertilizer to apply on his coffee crops.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en: Sarom, 49, is a farmer living in Bovel district of Battambang province. She is the mother of one child. She has been growing rice for 10 years as the main source of income. She can also earn income via selling grocery items to support her family’s living. Because of lacking of capital to support her farmland, she decided to get a loan with VisionFund, which is the first time for Sarom. She is leading a group of two members. As the group leader, she will use her entire portion of the loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to produce a good yield. She hopes that her rice farm will grow well so that she can sell it at a higher price to increase her income to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to produce a good yield in order to increase her income to save for future needs

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy is a hardworking woman, 33 years old. She is married and has two children. Her family’s income is mainly from small business, husbandry and fishing. She would like to take the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member.Her husband is a builder and with support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Analie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Analie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 44-year-old married father of two children, who has been working hard in home painting and interior design since 1991, to make his living.

Hassan has a very good reputation in his domain. He is a hard worker who puts so much effort on expanding his working zone to attract more customers, and increase his income.
Today, and since his family's needs are increasing, Hassan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children school tuition fees.
Hassan's main aim is to provide his family with a better living and especially his children and education is very important for him that's why he makes sure to stay capable of providing them with the best.

This is Hassan's second loan cycle with Al Majmoua, his previous loan was acquired to pay for his son medical needs. he proved to be a good standing borrower.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.es: Deyanira es una microempresaria habitante en el municipio de Barranquilla y su carisma para los negocio le permitió incorporarse en el comercio a partir del año 2010; luego de recibir la propuesta por parte de una amiga de vender mercancías de uso personal entre ellas prendas de vestir, calzado, cosméticos, cremas corporales y perfumes, empezó a promover entre sus amigos, vecinos y referidos, productos para cancelar con facilidad de pago a precios de oportunidad. Como nos acercamos a las festividades de amor y amistad, una temporada en la que el comercio de ropa se activa, Deyanira está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá  en la comprar prendas de vestir; blusas, jeans, suéteres y vestidos. Esta inversión es muy importante para mejorar el surtido de prendas y dinamizar las ventas.  Su meta a futuro es continuar ampliando su base de clientes y abrir un local al público.
texts.en:
Deyanira is a small business owner who lives in the municipality of Barranquilla. Through her business charisma she has been in sales since 2010, when a friend proposed selling personal use products including clothing, shoes, cosmetics, lotions and perfumes. She began offering friends, neighbors, and referrals products at special prices that can be paid off in installments.

Due to the upcoming Colombian celebration of love and friendship, a season when clothing sales pick up, Deyanira is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in purchasing garments: blouses, jeans, sweaters, and dresses. This investment is very important in order to improve her selection of garments and energize sales.

Her future goal is to continue expanding her customer base and open a store to the public.

loans.use: to buy garments: blouses, jeans, sweaters, and dresses.

loans.name: Bintimohamed

texts.en:
Bintimohamed is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past nine years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for resale

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Чумагул  доброжелательная и молодая женщина, ей 52 лет. Она замужем. У неё трое детей. Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Чумагул вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Чумагул выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Чумагул получает хороший доход. Муж Чумагул также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Чумагул с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота.Чумагул заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Jumagul, age 52, is a kindhearted married mother of three.  In order to have a stable source of income to feed their family, she and her husband have decided to have their own business.  They are now involved in animal husbandry.  Jumagul raises livestock and sells meat and milk.  She makes a good income from this activity.  Her husband also works in a local workshop, a job which brings them an additional source of income.  Their combined incomes are enough to provide an average standard of living and, at the moment, they have enough resources to cover their needs.

Jumagul and her husband want to buy a few additional head of livestock for fattening.  For this reason, Jumagul has turned to Kiva's field partner MDO Arvand in order to get a loan to buy more livestock.  She thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо доброжелательная и молодая женщина, ей 40 лет. Она замужем у неё трое детей. Мархабо живет вместе со своей семьёй в городе Истаравшан, она занята в малом бизнесе, фактически она покупает материал и вышивает из него одежду, которую перепродают на рынке. Всё что она зарабатывает, расходуется на содержание семьи. У неё нет возможности накопить денег для другие более перспективные цели. Её сын в этом году поступил в университет. Мархабо хочет получить кредит для оплаты договора обучения сына. Она обратась в ООО МДО Арванд за кредитом. Она очень благодарна ООО МДО "Арванд" за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Marhabo, age 40, is a friendly young woman.  She is married and the mother of three children.  She lives with her family in the city of Istaravshan.  She has her own small business: she buys fabric to make clothes which she then resells at the market.  All the money that she makes is spent to provide for her family and she can't save any for other long-term goals.  This year, Marhabo's son is entering university.  Marhabo is therefore taking a loan to pay  his tuition fees.  She has turned to Kiva's field partner, MDO Arvand, to receive this loan.  She is very thankful for their support and trust.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Nora Guadalupe

texts.es: Nora de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia  con sus padres, ella se dedica al cultivo del maíz y frijol, adicional a eso se dedica a la crianza de ganado, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de fertilizante, herbicidas, abonos, etc. Y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor  calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nora is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her parents. She works growing corn and beans and also she works raising cattle. She is a responsible and hard-working person. With what she obtains from her sales she pays some of the household expenses. She is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, manure, etc. and doing so be able to have a higher quality of living together with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, manure, etc.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS LUCHADORAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Melodia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de api, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, salón de belleza, servicio de instalación de gas a domicilio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Melodia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia con el apoyo de su mamá y con un capital, con el que contaba.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Las Luchadoras” Communal Bank is is entering its sixth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago III regional office. The group is composed of eight members, directed by a board of directors, of which Melodia is the president. The businesses run by the members of the group are varied, including a neighborhood store, api [local drink] sales, clothing sales, cosmetics sales, a beauty salon, and a home gas installation service. The loan that they take will benefit small business owners.

Melodia is a member. She mentions that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago through an invitation from an advisor who belongs to the institution. Currently she has a business selling clothing. She leaned this business several years ago through her own initiative, with help from her mom and some starting capital.

The loan that she is now going to take will be used to increase her supply. She will buy clothing in bulk from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto, and then she will sell it in her store. This type of work allows her to generate resources to financially support her family, since she is married and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and health care offered by the insitution.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Alicia Guadalupe

texts.es: Alicia de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz y maicillo desde hace 20 años, vende sus cultivos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder continuar con sus cultivos y tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Alicia is 40 years old and lives in her own house with 3 children. She's been growing corn and sorghum for 20 years. She sells her produce in the the different markets close to her home which helps her cover some of her house expenses.
She's requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and thus be able to continue growing her crops and have a better income.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is married with children. He operates a retail shop, does farming and also deals in timber. By doing this, he has been able to take care of his family, without interfering with his business' capital. Nathan has realized more clients needs that are lacking in his retail shop, but the present capital cannot meet them all.

He requests for money to buy jerrycans of cooking oil, cassava flour, millet flour, among others for selling and meeting his clients need. He used the previous loan to buy books to sell in his shop and managed to pay back his loan well.

loans.use: to buy more daily needs items to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees .

For over six years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Walkiria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Walkiria es reconocida por la luz que proyecta con su sonrisa cada vez que entra a un salón, debido a su positivismo y sus grandes visiones por convertirse en una gran profesional del comercio internacional. Además la felicidad que le corroe por ser una madre soltera con grandes deseos de superación junto a su pequeño bebe de tan solo un año de edad, hacen de ella sentirse más motivada.  Por otro lado, el apoyo que tiene por parte de su madre, quien está jubilada y tiene su propio negocio, la hace sentirse segura. 
A sus 22 años de edad, ella lucha a diario por salir adelante y convertirse en una profesional. Tras terminar su carrera de Comercio Internacional, ahora solo falta cerrarla con un broche de oro, como lo es un posgrado. Por esta razón, ella solicita un préstamo para pagar su posgrado en Comercio Internacional, ya que lo considera como un aspecto de las competencias profesionales que le ayudará a tener ventajas en el mercado laboral. En sus planes tiene emplearse en una embajada o en una ONG, pues le encanta el inglés y trabajar en las áreas de atención al público.
texts.en:
Walkiria is known for the light projected by her smile every time she enters a room, due to her positivity and her grand vision to become a professional in international business. Also for the happiness that consumes her, since she is a single mother with a great wish to move ahead, along with her little baby, who is only one year old and makes Walkiria feel even more motivated. On the other hand, the support she receives from her mother, who is retired and has her own business, makes Walkiria feel secure.

At 22 years of age, she fights every day to move ahead and become a professional. After finishing her studies in international business, she now just needs to add the finishing touch, which is her graduate degree.

She is requesting a loan to pay for her graudate degree in International Business, since she considers it to be a professional competency that will give her an advantage in the labor market. She plans to find employment in an embassy or in an NGO, since she likes English and working in the public eye.

loans.use: to pay for her graduate degree in International Business.

loans.name: Met's Group

texts.en: Met’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Met makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Santos Secundino

texts.es:
Santos es un pequeño emprendedor de 32 años, dedicado a la producción de café. Vive en su finca con su esposa y sus 8 hijos. Desde hace aproximadamente 15 años, el café ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos para esta familia. En los últimos tres ciclos, ha logrado incrementar su producción en un 15%.

Para este ciclo, está solicitando un crédito para la compra y aplicación oportuna de los insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal, y lograr continuar mejorando la productividad de su finca. El está seguro que con un buen plan de inversión y la correcta administración de los recursos con los que cuenta, logrará aumentar la cantidad de su café y con ello los ingresos para garantizar un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is a small business entrepreneur who has spent 32 years producing coffee. He lives on a farm with his wife and 8 children. For approximately 15 years, coffee has been the primary source of income for his family.

In the last three loan cycles, he has been able to increase his production by 15%. For this cycle he is seeking a loan for the purchase and opportune application of supplies and fertilizers required for his coffee crop, in order to continue improving the productivity of his farm.

He is certain that with a good investment plan and good administration of the resources he has, he will be able to increase the quantity of his coffee, and thereby increase his income in order to guarantee a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers required for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Mrs. Hoa is 40 years old, she is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and two children. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Husbandry and fishing are  main income source of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity  and  selling fish, which her husband caught.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de pan dulce lo hace de manera ambulante por las diferetes colonias, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposa logran solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pan dulce por mayor y así poder tener junto con su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 46 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He sells sweet bread by traveling to the different villages. With what he generates and help from his wife they are able to take care of some of the house needs.
He's requesting a loan to buy wholesale sweet bread and be able to have a better quality of life with his wife.

loans.use: buy wholesale sweet bread.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman and has been blessed with three children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over seven years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 56 years old, married woman and a mother of 6 children; one of her son is shown in the photo. She with her son is doing work of agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

In order to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Nusrat has applied a loan of 30000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with three children all whom attend school.She owns a house that has electricity  but no piped water.Her greatest monthly expense is food.
She has operated a food cafe business for the past five years,selling food to the neighbours.She mentioned lack of capital in her business.With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour.cooking oil and plastic tables and chairs to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour.cooking oil and plastic tables and chairs

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 62 years old; she is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 30000 to purchase more calves and heifers to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more more calves and heifers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a widowed mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José David  es un hombre de mucho humor y con buena visión para la agricultura. Dice que ha heredado de sus padres la pasión al trabajo en el campo, y que desde pequeño le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, en particular el rubro café. Desde hace 9 años, logró tener su propia finca  en la cual cultiva este rubro y ha llegado a tener muy buenos rendimientos.

Está seguro que puede continuar mejorando esos rendimientos con un manejo adecuado de su plantación. Para ello, está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar de manera oportuna la compra y aplicación de los insumos que requiere su cafetal.

Para este productor, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos puedan tener mejores oportunidades para su formación y crecimiento económico, por tanto se esfuerza cada día para ir ayudándoles a construir ese futuro.
texts.en:
José David is a man of good humor and great vision for agriculture. He says that has inherited his passion for working in the fields from his parents. When he was young, they taught him to work the land - in particular, the coffee plantations.

Nine years ago, José David obtained his own plantation, where he cultivates coffee and has come to have a very good yield. He is sure that he can keep continuing his production with the appropriate management of his plantation. For this reason, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy the supplies that his coffee crop needs and apply them in a timely fashion .

For this farmer, his greatest dream is for his children to have better educational opportunities and economic growth. He makes an effort every day to keep helping them build this future.

loans.use: to buy supplies that his coffee crop needs in order to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mrs. Mai is a hardworking woman, 23 years old . She lives with her family in a small house and without hygienic latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and fishing. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Adelaida Alcira

texts.es: Adelaida de 41 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo y su hija de 1 año de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de comida y platillos típicos y que gracias a su gran amabilidad  posee un numerosa clientela que la recomienda, es así como genera sus ingresos económicos, con lo que ha logrado cumplir sus propósitos además de brindarle todo lo necesario para su pequeño hijo. Adelaida desea realizar la construcción de un muro de contención ya que actualmente no tienen uno y en invierno hay deslaves lo que lo hace peligroso para su familia es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, varillas de hierro, etc.,
texts.en:
Adelaida is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their one year old daughter. She's a hard working woman that sells traditional food and thanks to her friendliness she has a very numerous clientele that highly recommends her. This is how she generates her income and has been able to cover her needs and provide for all the needs of her young son.
Adelaida wants to build a retaining wall which she currently doesn't have and would be needing during the winter which brings landslides, potentially creating a dangerous situation for her family. She's requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron rods.

loans.use: invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron rods to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que brinda sus servicios como asistente de enfermería y es así como genera sus ingresos con los brinda lo  necesarios para su hijo y lleva los insumos necesarios para su hogar. Ana desea realizar la construcción de un muro perimetral en su vivienda ya que actualmente no tiene y quiere brindarles más seguridad a su familia, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, cemento, arena, mano de obra, etc., para construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and a two year old son. She's a hard working woman who provides services as a nursing assistant which is how she generates her income to cover the necessary expenses for her son and her home.
Ana wants to build a perimeter wall for her home so her family can be safer. She's requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in bricks, cement, sand, and labor to build the perimeter wall for her home.

loans.use: invest in bricks, cement, sand, and labor to build the perimeter wall for her home.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is a married woman with three children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food

She has operated a mobile money transfer business (M-pesa) for the past six years serving her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of the lack of capital in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to add to her M-pesa business float. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: to add to her M-pesa business float.

loans.name: Kenia Yadira

texts.es: Kenia, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo y reside con él  en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. En busca de obtener ingresos decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de ropa como ser: blusas, camisas, pantalones, camisetas y otra que le piden sus clientes. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante desde hace 7 años.  Kenia se encuentra solicitando un préstamo por un monto de 7,000.00 Lempiras para comprar más  camisas, blusas, pantalones etc. Para vender y aumentar los ingresos. Este prestamo es el cuarto ciclo solicitado en la institución. Su meta de  es que el negocio siga creciendo, y darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Kenia is 32 years old. She is a single mother. She has one son and lives with him in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Seeking to obtain income, she decided to establish her own business of selling clothing such as blouses, shirts, pants, t-shirts, and other items that her customers request. She has been making sales as a street vendor for seven years.

Kenia is applying for a loan in the amount of 7000 lempiras in order to buy more shirts, blouses, pants, etc., to sell and increase her income. This loan will be her fourth loan cycle with the institution. 

Her goal is for her business to continue growing and to give her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, blouses, pants, and other items to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is 43 years old. He is married with five children. He has had a mining business for 10 years. He will be using the loan to buy mining tools to help him supply more construction materials such as building stones and blocks and make more income to help him pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand the quarrying business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy mining tools to help him supply more construction materials and make more income to help him pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Paulo Antonio

texts.es: Paulo de 46 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposa y sus dos hijas de 25, 10 y nieto de 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida brindando sus servicios como seguridad en una planta térmica, es así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijas y brindado los insumos necesarios, además recibe el apoyo de su esposa quien labora como costurera. Paulo tiene el deseo de continuar la construcción de su vivienda que aún no está termina para poder irse a vivir con su familia, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, cemento, arena, grava, varillas de hierro, etc., para continuar con la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Paulo is 46 years old and lives in his own house with his wife, two daughters of 25 and 10 years of age, and a 5 year old grandson. He's a hard working man who's employed as a security guard at an energy plant. That's how he generates his income which has helped his daughters get ahead and has provided for the home needs. He also receives the support of his wife who works as a seamstress.
Paulo wishes to continue building his house which is not yet finished so he can live with his family. He's requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron rods to continue building his home.

loans.use: invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron rods to continue building his home.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a married woman with one child who is too young to attend school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatest monthly expenses.

Gertrude has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her customers are her neighbours and people in the market place. 

With this Kshs 30,000 loan, Gertrude  will purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam, a 47-year-old Palestinian refugee, is a married father of four children. Houssam has been providing transportation services since 2012. He used to run a small grocery store, but since he is living in a Palestinian refugees camp, his grocery store which was located there didn't provide a very good income.

Houssam provides transportation services to university students and employees who need his services. He has requested this loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to perform needed maintenance on his car to be ready for the coming school year.

This is Houssam's first loan with Al Majmoua; he hopes that in the future he can buy a new car through a future loan.

loans.use: To perform necessary maintenance on his car to be ready for the coming school year.

loans.name: Madoe

texts.fr: Madoe est une femme célibataire âgée de 30 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Sans enfant, Madoe s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant   des articles de mercerie et des tissus. Pour s’approvisionner, Madoe se rend quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des cartons de fil, des rouleaux de doublure et des sachets de boutons, Madoe nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Madoe va pouvoir aider bien agrandir son commerce et aider sa famille dans les besoins quotidiens éprouvés.
texts.en: Madoe is a single, 30-year-old woman who lives in Tokoin. With no children, Madoe works hard to earn her income selling notions and fabric. To get her supplies, Madoe goes to the market four times per month. To purchase boxes of thread, rolls of lining [fabric], and packages of buttons, she needs this loan to pay for her supplies. With the resulting profit margin, Madoe will be able to significantly expand her business and help her family with their day-to-day needs.

loans.use: purchase one box of thread, three rolls of lining [fabric] and one package of buttons.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman. She has two children, both of whom attend school. Mwanaidi rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanaidi operates a firewood selling business, selling from from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Jorge Amilcar

texts.es:
Jorge Amílcar es un caficultor de 40 años casado con Lisseth, Él se dedica a la producción de café bajo distintos sellos de certificación como ser: Comercio Justo y Rainforest que comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL, el lleva 20 años en la producción de café y 5 años trabajando con sellos de certificación.
Jorge Amílcar  tiene 4 hijos bajo su cargo y él trabaja a diario para darles lo mejor a sus hijos, Él quiere que sus hijos tengan oportunidad para formarse y aprender sobre para que sepan valerse en el mundo.
Actualmente en la región se ha vuelto muy popular producir orgánico, estas prácticas mejoran la calidad del café lo que hace posible obtener mejores precios por el producto cosechado, además hace las fincas más sostenibles y amigables con el ambiente, es por eso que Jorge Amílcar quiere convertir sus fincas a producción orgánica.
Jorge Amílcar Solicita un crédito para llevar a cabo las labores de certificación y replantación de su cafetal, con las ganancias obtenidas por su café el espera obtener ingresos suficientes para darles a sus hijos una calidad de vida digna, darles una buena educación e iniciar la creación de un pequeño patrimonio familiar.
Un crédito ayudara Jorge Amílcar a iniciar a cultivar y producir café bajo prácticas amigables con el ambiente y además le proporcionara ingresos extras para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Amílcar is 40-year-old coffee grower, who is married to Lisseth. He works in coffee production under certain certifications such as: Fair Trade and Rainforest. He sells his coffee through COCAFCAL. He has been growing coffee for 20 years, and has 5 years working with the certifications.

Jorge Amílcar has 4 children in his charge, and he works every day to give his children the best he can. He wants his children to have the opportunity to be educated and learn, so that they know how to provide for themselves in the world.

Currently in the region, it has become very popular to grow organic. These practices improve the quality of coffee, which makes it possible to gain better prices for the harvested product. In addition, it makes the farms more sustainable and environmentally friendly. It is for that reason that Jorge Amílcar wants to convert his farms to organic production.

Jorge Amílcar is requesting a loan to perform the tasks to certify and replant his coffee form. With the earnings obtained from his coffee, he hopes to obtain enough income to give his children a decent quality of life, give them a good education, and start building a small family estate.

A loan will help Jorge Amílcar to start to cultivate and produce coffee using environmentally friendly practices, and also will provide him extra earnings to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials to convert his farm to organic, such as: coffee plants, organic fertilizers, and payment for labor, among other things.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre de 33 años de edad es casado con una linda familia. Daniel es un hombre que no se detiene ante las limitaciones que la vida le presenta, pues con esfuerzo y ganas de seguir prosperando se logra todo, fuera de sus obstáculos Daniel se ha sacrificado para darle a su familia lo necesario. Él está muy contento con el crédito al que tuvo acceso pues con este apoyo el logro comprar sus semillas de flores y abono para este cultivo y a Dios gracias le fue muy bien. Daniel con el afán de seguir prosperando nuevamente acude a un préstamo para la compra y venta de aguacates  que en esta ocasión es su nueva actividad y con el que espera también obtener mejores ingresos.
Daniel su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales para que tengan mejores condiciones de vida. También tiene las esperanzas de comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 33 year-old man who is married and has a beautiful family. He is a man who doesn't let himself be limited by the obstacles which life presents him; and with strength and a desire to be prosperous, he is able to achieve a great deal. Daniel has made sacrifices to give his family what they need. 
He is very happy with the loan which he had access to, because with the loan he was able to buy flower seeds and fertilizer for his crop. Thanks to God it all went well. With the goal of continuing to make progress, Daniel now requests another loan to purchase and sell avocados, which his new business venture. He hopes his earnings will increase. 
Daniel's greatest hope is to see his children become successful professionals so that they have a better quality of life. He also has hopes to purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy and sell avocados.

loans.name: 219 Grupo Asunta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GRUPO ASUNTA” iniciarán el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eliana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa para niños, venta de comida, venta de papa y chuño, venta de zapatos, venta de refrescos, servicio de transporte. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eliana es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una promoción de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y chuño; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por necesidad propia hace más de quince años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la  otorgación de créditos y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la foto no aparece la señora Beatriz porque, después del desembolso, tuvo que irse a puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The communal bank called Asunta Group will begin their first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata branch. The group is composed of 10 members and is led by a board of directors, of which Eliana is president. The businesses of the members of this communal bank are varied. Among them are: cosmetic sales, children's clothing sales, food sales, sale of fresh and frozen potatoes, shoe sales, beverage sales, and transport services.
The loan this group will receive will benefit micro enterprises, Eliana among them. She says that she entered Pro Mujer at the suggestion of an advertisement from the institution. She currently has a business selling fresh and frozen potatoes. She says that she learned this business out of personal need over 15 years ago.
The loan that she will now take out will be used to increase her capital (to purchase potatoes in bulk), which she will acquire through vendors in her community. Then, she will sell the product out of her sales space. 
This work enables Eliana to generate an income to support her family economically. She is married and has four children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Eliana says that she likes the loans which it distributes and the health programs as well.
One member of the group, Beatriz, is not pictured in the photo above because after the loan was distributed she had to go back to her store.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa Liliam

texts.es:
Lilian, de 64 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, se casó pero en su matrimonio no pudieron procrear hijos y hace 8 años se divorcio de su esposo, adoptó un sobrino que ahora tiene 14 años de edad  y estudia séptimo grado y en su casa viven solos los dos.

Lilian, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 15 años, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, la cual tenía junto a su ex-esposo, pero el decidió dejársela a ella, para que la trabajara, pero además de eso se dedica a la ganadería con la ayuda de su sobrino.

Lilian, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca parida, porque en su tienda tiene mucha demanda de queso y leche y de esa manera podrá también vender productos lácteos, para obtener mejores ganancias.

El sueño de Lilian, es que en un futuro ella pueda obtener un crédito más grande que le permita aumentar su ganado y mejorar su tienda.
texts.en:
Lilian, 64 years old, has a sixth grade education. She married, but she and her husband could not have children. Eight years ago, she divorced her husband. She adopted her nephew, who is now 14 years old and is in the seventh grade. Only the two of them live in the home.

Lilian has had a small store for the past 15 years, where she sells basic goods. She used to share the store with her ex-husband, but he decided to leave it to her, so that she could work in it. In addition, she works with livestock with the help of her nephew.

Lilian needs a loan to purchase a milk-producing cow, because in her store there is a lot of demand for milk and cheese. This way, she can also sell dairy products, to obtain more profits.

Lilian's dream is that in the future she can have a larger loan that will allow her to increase the amount of livestock that she has, and improve her store.

loans.use: to buy a milk-producing cow.

loans.name: Leivi Xiomara

texts.es: Leivi de 25 años de edad que habita en vivienda familiar en compañía de sus padres, su esposo y sus dos hijas de 2 y 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida brindando sus servicios como mecánico de reparación de portones eléctricos, es así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijas y brindado los insumos necesarios para su hogar. Leivi tiene el deseo de poder continuar con la construcción de su vivienda para poder irse a vivir con su familia, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillos, mano de obra, etc., para terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Leivi is 25 years old and lives in her family's home with her parents, her husband, and their two daughters of 2 and 9 years of age. She's a hard working woman who works as a mechanic reparing electric gates. That's how she generates the income to get ahead her daughters and take care of her basic house needs.
Leivi wishes to continue building her house so she can go live with her family. She's requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and labor to finish building her house.

loans.use: invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and labor to finish building her house.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Emily owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Emily has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business. In addition, she operates a firewood-selling business that earns her another source of income

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Nimunyonje

texts.en:
Nimunyonje is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees .

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Langoni

texts.en:
Langoni is a widowed woman, and has five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a fruit-selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits  for resale

loans.name: Nigesa

texts.en:
Nigesa is a widowed woman who is living together with her three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a cashew nuts selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Mwanamkuu is requesting a loan to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a widowed woman with three children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a fruit and coconut selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits for resale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has four children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a fruit-selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges is the lack of capital.

With the Ksh 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits for resale

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married and has three children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a fruit and coconuts selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is a lack of capital in her business.

With the Ksh 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
