Binti is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years old and married with three children. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, condiments, home care producta and other groceries.

Virginia has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Grupo Barrio San Bartolo Sololá Group

texts.es:
Estela es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de dos hijos de las cuales tienen las edades entre 1 año y 3 meses, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad denominada San Bartolo. Estela gracias a su gran visión de superación ha logrado que otras mujeres  sigan su ejemplo, ella desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas, eligió esta actividad porque lo realiza desde la comodidad de su hogar y esto le permite cuidar de sus hijos. Por ser una mujer que posee liderazgo es la representante del grupo barrio san Bartolo Sololá. Estela solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en su  negocio de venta de tortillas; ella comprara maíz, leña y una nueva estufa industrial.
Su mayor esperanza es construir una casa de terraza para ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Estela is a 25 year old mother. She is single with a beautiful family of two children whom are between the ages of 3 months and 1 year old. This dear family lives in a community called San Bartolo. Thanks to Estela's great vision of self-improvement, she has gotten other women to follow her example. For the last two years, she has made a living selling tortillas. She chose this trade because it is performed in the convenience of her home and this allows her to take care of her children. As a woman who possess leadership qualities, she is the representative of the Bartolo Sololá neighborhood.

Estela requests this loan in order to invest in her tortilla sales business. She will buy corn, firewood, and a new industrial stove.

Her greatest wish is to construct a terraced house to offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and a new industrial stove.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan proviene de una familia de tres miembros, se dedica a  la construcción para poder costear sus estudios universitarios, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad.
Su anhelo es ser un contador exitoso y respetado por la sociedad. Agradece la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera para poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juan comes from a three-member family. He works in construction to be able to pay for his university studies. He is studying for an accounting degree. His dream is to be a successful accountant, and respected by society. He is grateful for the opportunity to be able to grow and improve. 
He asks for this loan to be able to pay the fees for his degree, and continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Kossiwa Emma

texts.fr: Agée de 45 ans et mère de quatre enfants, Kossiwa est une femme mariée vivant à Baguida. Kossiwa est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner, Kossiwa demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue  d’épargner et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is forty-five years old, married and mother to four children. She lives in Baguida and sells charcoal. She buys her stock four times a month from the market and resells it from the front of her house.

Kossiwa has requested this loan to order sacks of charcoal and increase her earnings. These will be used to build up her savings and to pay for schooling and supplies for her children for the coming school year.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Rahamatou

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Rahamatou est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans résidant à Tokoin. Rahamatou est une coiffeuse qui s’approvisionne des mèches au marché deux fois par mois et les revendent dans son salon de coiffure. Rahamatou nécessite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de mèches en vue de gagner des bénéfices afin d’appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et les besoins en nourriture et santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Rahamatou is forty-three years old, married and mother to three children. She lives in Tokoin and works as a hairdresser. She buys new hair extensions twice a month from the market, and sells them in her hairdressing salon.

Rahamatou has requested this loan to buy dozens of hair extensions to increase her earnings and help her husband to care for their children and provide food and healthcare for the family.

loans.use: to buy 12 dozen hair extensions.

loans.name: Imfura Ii Group

texts.fr:
Augustin  fait partie du groupe  Imfura II et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 46 ans et est marié à Rose, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 2 à 18 ans, dont  4 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  la bière depuis  32 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  caisses de  bière  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait pratiquer l'agriculture et l'élevage  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Augustin is a member of the 'Imfura II' Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is forty-six years old and married to Rose, a farmer. Together they have five children between the ages of two and eighteen years. Four of their children currently attend school.

Augustin has been selling beer for thirty-two years. This will be his second loan with the field partner, Turame. It will increase his working capital and allow him to buy many boxes of beer for resale.

In the coming years, Augustin would like to grow vegetables and raise livestock. He would also like to see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy many boxes of beer for resale.

loans.name: Adjovi Mawushi

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, Adjovi est une femme mariée et mère de six enfants vivant ensemble à Baguida. Pour soutenir sa famille, Adjovi vend les détergents et s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Adjovi réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Adjovi désire ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de savons et des sacs de détergents afin d’agrandir son stock et gagner bénéfices qui l’aidera à soutenir son mari à couvrir les charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Adjovi is forty-two years old, married and mother to six children. They all live in Baguida. To support her family, Adjovi sells detergents. She buys her stock four times a month from the market.

Adjovi has requested this loan to increase the profitability of her business and meet the needs of her customers. She will order dozens of soaps and sacks of detergent to increase her stock levels, improve her earnings and help her husband pay for their household costs.

loans.use: to buy 20 dozen soaps and 4 sacks of detergent.

loans.name: Amavi Mawulawoe

texts.fr: Amavi est une femme mariée de 43 ans habitant à Baguida. Mère de trois enfants, Amavi est une marchande de pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Pour commander des pièces de pagnes de haute et moyenne qualité, Amavi sollicite ce prêt afin d’acquérir un grand nombre de stock et par suite gagner des bénéfices afin de soutenir sa famille et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amavi is forty-three years old, married and mother to three children. She lives in Baguida and sells pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing). She buys her stock twice a month from the market, and sells them from the shop in her home.

Amavi has requested this loan to order a large quantity of high quality and mid quality pagnes. This will improve her earnings and allow her to support her family and provide for a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy 5 high quality pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and 25 mid quality pagnes.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase new  clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase new  clothes for resale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 24year old father of 3 children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in buying and selling cocoa, and gets additional income from his cocoa garden which he has done for four years. He works hard and has plans of educating his children, buying land and expand cocoa growing. His main challenges are price changes, expensive labor and inadequate capital for expanding the business.  He wants a loan to hire cocoa gardens for harvest and selling to cocoa companies.

loans.use: to hire cocoa gardens for harvest and selling to cocoa companies.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is married has no children. She has owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a fruit selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges is lack of capital.

With the Ksh 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits  for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits  for resale

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en: Hudson is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a retail business where he sells potatoes, cabbages and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and other items

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 32 years old and has two children. Phoebe is married and has two children who are presently in school.

Phoebe is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Phoebe requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Phoebe has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other supplies to use in her business for her fishing business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is forever thankful to the Kiva lenders for the great job they have done in boosting her business. The previous loan funded by Kiva lenders helped her to expand her sales and profit. She was able to meet her family financial obligations well and on time. Because of the great stride it took her, she is seeking another loan.

Rose is a business lady who deals in the sale of old clothes especially bed sheets, bed covers and mattresses. She also does agriculture as her major sources of income since 2003.
Rose has applied for a loan two million from Ugafode to restock bedding as she anticipates sales during the back to school season. Her dream for the future is to educate all her children so that they attain a better future.
She faces challenges of competition and seasonality; she describes herself as a shrewd person in business.

loans.use: to buy used bedding for sell.

loans.name: Chokit

texts.en:
Chokit is 26 years old and single.

Chokit runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, milk, juices etc.

Chokit has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, milk, juices  etc.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a single woman who has no kids. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family .

Mwanamisi operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of perishability in her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, fruits and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, fruits and onions for resale.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Sofia has been operating a poultry selling business for over two years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Sofia dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Lucylin

texts.en:
Lucylin is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family .
Lucylin operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase a sacks of green vegetables, crates of tomatoes, crate of oranges and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sacks of green vegetables,crates of tomatoes, crate of orange fruits and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school.She owns a house that has electricity and piped water .Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a quarry business for the past three years selling her products at the market.She mentioned transportation as a major challenge in her business.With the loan she is requesting for she wants to purchase materials for her business.She decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Nern's Group

texts.en:
Nern lives in a rural village of Battambang province, is 24-year-old and she has one school child and she needs to support her child’s education as well. Nowadays, she grows cassava and she has a small music band to play in some ceremonies and wedding party for a fee. She has been involved in her business for six years.

Due to not having enough working capital to grow cassava for this season, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan. In a group of two, Nern is the group leader. For Nern, she has never been with VisionFund and this is the first time for her. Through this loan, she is going to manage it to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor fees to increase productivity of her crop yield. She hopes that the first loan will help her to get more income and she can upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield so that she can raise her income to keep her kid in school

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 32 year old Ugandan male who is married and has three children aged 12, 8 and 2 and two of them attend school.
Fred is a business man who operates a retail shop since 2010 in order to earn a living and be able to look after his family.
He has applied for a loan of 2 million to buy merchandise for his shop in order to generate more profits; he will buy sacks of sugar, rice, baking flour, cooking oil, stationary, among other items in preparation for the back to school season that is looming. He appreciates UGAFODE support and partnership.
His dream to educate his children expand his business but he says the challenge is competition.

loans.use: to boost his retail trade by buying merchandise for trade.

loans.name: Anifa

texts.pt:
A senhora Anifa de 62 anos de idade é comerciante, viúva mãe de 1 filho já maior de idade, sustenta um neto que vive com ela na casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar cervejas , vinhos, sumos, refrescos, agua mineral para reforçar o seu negócio.
O seu sonho é crescer no seu negocio para responder as necessidades de seus clientes e adquirir um contentor onde poderá revender produtos de 1a necessidade.
Tem como desafios financeiros e tem  também um guest house para reforçar a renda, os crédito anteriores foram para o reforço do seu negocio.
texts.en: Anifa is a 62 year old businesswoman and a widowed mother to her grown-up son. She also supports her grandson who lives with her in her home. She plans to use this loan to buy beer, wines, fruit juices, soft drinks and mineral water so that she can restock her business. She dreams of expanding the business so that she can better respond to her customers' needs and buying a container unit from which she would be able to sell essential items. She still faces financial challenges despite also running a guest house which supplements her income. In the past, she has used her loans to restock her business.

loans.use: to buy beers, wines, fruit juices, soft drinks and mineral water to re-stock her business.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 42-year-old married mother of three children. Fifteen years ago, she started selling cosmetics and Tupperware from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions.

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her child's university tuition fees and increase her business merchandise with new collection of cosmetics and Tupperware.
Randa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her children with better future.

loans.use: to pay her child's university tuition fees and increase her business merchandise with new collection of cosmetics and Tupperware

loans.name: Najat

texts.en: Najat is a 42 year’s old married woman living with her two children, still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family in order to satisfy the family needs. Today, in order to pay her children educational fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register them with the coming school year. Her only target is to see them pursuing their education suitably.

loans.use: to register her children at school for the coming school year.

loans.name: Shabani

texts.en:
Shaban who is in his late 20s is single and has no children. He has been running two projects, selling charcoal and running a retail shop for five years now. He works from 12am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Shaban’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase on his business stocks and has managed to pay back his loans successfully. He is so grateful with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. He used the profit to take care of himself, to reinvest in business, loan repayment and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to reinvest in the shop inventory. He dreams of building expanding his business.

Shaban will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to resell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells potatoes and other vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of products. He will use the Kes 8,000 loan to buy a solar lamp for use in his business  premise. He hopes that in the future, he will start up a butchery. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp for use in his business  premise

loans.name: Temotea

texts.en:
Temotea has been engaged in fishing for almost 10 years now. She sold fish and crab to the local in the community. She is widow with six grown children. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

She decided to take a loan to buy fishing materials like nylon, fishing net, floater and crab net. These materials are vital in augmenting her daily catch. With these, she could sold fish in higher volume and her earnings will improve. She could avail to purchase healthy diets and able to handle her finances.


She is hoping that she could set aside some savings in preparation of the old age.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nylon, fishing net, floater and crab net

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en: Felistus is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm where she keeps poultry and goats. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought and high cost of poultry feeds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more chicken and goats. She hopes that in the future, she will start selling cows. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and goats

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Liza has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Liza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Ranim

texts.en: Ranim is a 30 year-old Lebanese married woman, mother of two children and living with her husband, who is the income provider. She states that living costs are becoming very expensive. This is the reason why she is in real need today of borrowing a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, which funds will be paid at once to cover her children's study fees. Her first goal is to insure a good educational level to them.

loans.use: to cover her children's study fees.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed who is in his late 30s is married with one kid. He has been running a cosmetics business for eight years now. He works from 08am to 05:30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mohamed’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase on the cosmetics stock and has paid back his loan successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. He used the profit to take care of his family, pay school fees, loan repayment, and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy new and fast moving products. He dreams of establish another cosmetics business.

Mohamed will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy new  and fast moving products.

loans.name: Laudi

texts.en: Laudi is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 37 years old and has three children. She is really attached to her family. Her husband is the main income provider in the family to be able to cover the heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. Today, the fact that the new school year is coming, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children educational fees. The family only target and dreams is to see those achieving higher positions.

loans.use: to pay her children educational fees

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with one child who is still small to attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past one year, selling meat goat. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. Zawadia dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
A  senhora Ana de 48 anos de idade  é comerciante mãe solteira de 4 filhos dois dos quais já maiores de idade  a trabalhar fora do país os outros dois vivem na cidade, destes, um esta no lar e outro na casa dos avôs e a estudar. Sustenta uma neta que vive com ela na casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar cimento, ferro, blocos, arames para ampliar a sua casa atualmente quetem  apenas um quarto.
O seu sonho é ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades de seus clientes e construir uma casa grande,fazer instalação elétrica, canalizar agua para oferecer melhor lar a sua família e adquirir  uma viatura.
Tem como desafios financeiros tem  estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as mesmas e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en: Ana is a 48 year old businesswoman and a single mother to four children: two of whom are already grown up and work abroad , one other lives at home with her and her remaining child lives with his grandparents as he is studying. She also supports her grand-daughter who lives with her. She plans to use this loan to buy cement, building rods and blocks, and wire so that she can extend her home, which currently only has one room. She dreams of expanding her business so that she can better respond to her customers' needs, of building a larger house with electricity and water facilities so that she can provide her family with a more comfortable home, and of buying a vehicle. She faces financial challenges despite having been working and searching for more work to help her overcome these challenges so that she can fulfil her dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement, building rods and blocks, and wire.

loans.name: 28 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “28 DE AGOSTO” iniciarán el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Erika es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de mantas, servicio de construcción, venta de flores, venta de material escolar.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Erika es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por una promoción de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y las reuniones de pago que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "28 de Agosto (28th of August)" loan group is in its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Copacabana. It is composed of eight members and is directed by a board where Erika is president. The businesses that the members of the community association carry out are varied, and between them there is: selling clothing, selling food, selling blankets, construction services, selling flowers and selling school materials.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro businesses where Erika is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer through a promotion from the institution.

Currently, she has a business selling clothing. She learned this business many years ago through her own initiative. The loan that she will now take out is to increase her income by buying clothing at wholesale prices, which she will get from the venders in the city of El Alto, and afterwards she will sell it in her stall.

This form of work allows her to get resources to support her family economically. She is single and has one son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings and the payment meetings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale prices.

loans.name: 14 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “14 DE SEPTIEMBRE” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nicolasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas, venta de refrescos, venta de leche, venta de salteñas, venta de queso, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nicolasa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de prendas de vestir de lana; da a conocer que este negocio lo inició hace varios años y lo aprendió de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto para posteriormente, a la elaboración,  comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "14 de Septiembre (14th of September)" loan group will begin its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal of Copacabana. It is composed of nine members and is directed by a board where Nicolasa is president. The businesses that the members of the community association carry out are varied, and between them there is: selling sweaters, selling soft drinks, selling milk, selling meat pies, selling cheese, and a neighborhood store.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro businesses where Nicolasa is a member. She says that it is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer. She joined from an invitation from a promotion through the institution.

Currently, she has a business selling wool clothing. She learned this business many years ago from her parents. The loan that she will now take out is to increase her income by buying wool at wholesale prices, which she will get from the venders in the city of El Alto, and after making the clothing, she will sell it in her stall.

This form of work allows her to get resources to support her family economically, because she is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale prices.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN FRANCISCO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son la venta de queso y venta de leche.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus papás, quien le ayuda en este negocio es su esposo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de una vaca lechera, que adquirirá de su comunidad, esta compra le beneficiará en el aumento de capital  y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones  y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "San Francisco" loan group will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal of Achacachi. It is composed of eight members and is directed by a board where Virginia is president. The businesses that the members of the community association carry out are selling cheese and selling milk.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro businesses where Virginia is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago. She joined from a invitation from a friend who is a customer of the institution.

Currently, she has a business selling milk. She learned this business many years ago from her parents, and her husband helps her with the business. The loan that she will now take out is to buy a dairy cow, which she will get from her community. This purchase will benefit her with increasing earnings and she will then sell the milk in her stall.

This form of work allows her to get resources to support her family economically, because she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARCO IRIS” iniciarán el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de juguetes, venta de ropa, venta de chamarras, venta de comida, venta de comida y servicio de transporte. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de juguetes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia y con los pocos ahorros que tenía.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de juguetes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas del departamento de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Arco Iris (Rainbow)" loan group will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal of German Busch. It is composed of nine members and is directed by a board where Ana is president. The businesses that the members of the community association carry out are varied, and between them there is: selling games, selling clothing, selling jackets, selling food, and a transportation service.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro businesses where Ana is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer from a massive promotion invitation that they did in her area.

Currently, she has a business selling games. She learned this business many years ago through her own initiative, and with the little savings that she had. The loan that she will now take out is to increase her income by buying games at wholesale prices, which she will get from the wholesale venders in the department of Oruro, and afterwards she will sell them in her stall.

This form of work allows her to get resources to support her family economically, because she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy games at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Suma Inti Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA INTI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Esperanza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura y venta de chamarras, venta de polleras, venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de banderines, venta de overoles, venta de ropa deportiva.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Esperanza es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de chamarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando como costurera en el extranjero y cuando retorno al país decide emprender su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas e hilos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la costura de chamarras, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Suma Inti" loan group will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal of German Busch. It is composed of eight members and is directed by a board where Esperanza is president. The businesses that the members of the community association carry out are varied, and between them there is: making and selling jackets, selling skirts, selling shawls, selling food, selling pennants, selling coveralls, and selling sport clothing.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro businesses where Esperanza is a member. She joined Pro Mujer from a invitation from a friend who is a customer of the institution.

Currently, she has a business making and selling jackets. She learned this business from working as a dressmaker overseas and when she returned to her country, she decided to start her own business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her income by buying fabric and thread at wholesale prices, which she will get from the wholesale venders in the city of El Alto, and after making the jackets, she will sell them in her stall.

This form of work allows her to get resources to support her family economically, because she is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings and the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy thread at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Jiban Joti Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Dalimba, standing to the right, is a 29-year-old lady. Her family consists of her husband, her two children and her parents-in-law.

She is a woman with great ideas and a creative mind, and she is a very ambitious woman. Dalimba has willpower that led her to be a productive woman in her community. She is always looking for activities that can improve the family income.

She bought a sewing machine and trained on it until she became proficient. She started to make clothes and some products and sold them; that helped her to cover some of the household expenses.

Dalimba, along with her group member, is requesting financial help of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy more fabrics and yarns to invest in setting up her business and attracting clients, and in this way creating a positive impact on her earnings.

Her dream is to have a big tailoring business that provides a good income and creates jobs for the women who need jobs to help their families.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and yarns to invest in setting up her business.

loans.name: Jiban Joti Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Daimati, 34, is a differently abled lady from a remote village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. The lady standing to the right in the photograph is Daimati.

She is a determined and ambitious lady who has confidence and strong willpower to succeed in life and achieve her goals.

Daimati is a vegetable vendor by profession. She sells green vegetables in the nearby market and earns her livelihood. She is a married mother of one daughter and her husband works as a bus driver in the near by town.

Daimati, along with her other group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase more green vegetables for resale to increase her income. She is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase more green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Jobel Alberto

texts.es:
Jobel  tiene 35 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la producción de café con ya más de 15 años de experiencia en el rubro, Jobel está soltero y vive con su madre la cual está bajo su cargo y cuidado, Jobel trabaja a diario para darle a su madre todos los cuidados de los que requiere y merece. El sueña con tener acceso a todo los que su madre necesita para tener una vida de calidad.
Jobel  actualmente está interesado en una práctica que se ha hecho muy popular en la zona y es la producción de café certificado orgánico, Jobel ya vende café certificado comercio Justo pero quiere obtener un sello más para aumentar las posibilidades de mercado de su café. 
Jobel  solicita un crédito para iniciar el proceso de certificación orgánico de su cafetal para lo que ha decidido replantar e iniciar el proceso con las plantaciones totalmente nuevas, con las ganancias obtenidas por el café orgánico vendido Jobel  tendrá los suficientes ingresos para mantener las necesidades de su madre. 
Un préstamo ayudara a Jobel  a replantar y a certificar su cafetal lo que le permitirá vender su café a mejores precios, y tener mayores oportunidades para sobresalir en el mercado del café con un producto de calidad además de hacer su cultivo más sostenible y amigable con la rica biodiversidad de la zona.
texts.en:
Jobel is 35 years old. He works in agriculture, specifically the production of coffee. He now has more than 15 years of experience with this labor. Jobel is single and he lives with his mother who is under his charge and care. Jobel works daily to provide all of the care his mother requires and deserves. He dreams of having access to all of what his mother needs to have a quality life.

Jobel is currently interested in a practice that has become very popular in the area which is the production of certified organic coffee. It's true, Jobel currently sells coffee that is commercially certified, but he wants an additional seal to increase the possibilities of marketing his coffee.

Jobel is seeking a loan to begin the process of organic certification for his coffee crop for the quantity he has decided to replant, and to begin the process with totally new plantings. With the earnings he obtains from the organic coffee he sells Jobel will have sufficient income to meet the needs of his mother.

A loan will help Jobel to replant and certify his coffee crop which will allow him to sell his coffee at better prices and have better opportunities to get ahead in the coffee market with a quality product. Moreover, it will make his harvest more sustainable and friendly to the rich biodiversity in the area.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary materials to convert his coffee crop to organic such as: organic fertilizer, coffee plants and pay for workers.

loans.name: Isleria Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Isleria Poty integrado por 17 mujeres, está en  el 1° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, y de esa forma ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Mercedes quien es una mujer muy trabajadora, que quiere capacitarse y es por ello que se unio al grupo, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ella es modista, tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hace muy buenos pedidos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones, cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Isleria Poty consists of 17 women and they are in their first loan cycle of the Women's Committee Program. They joined together to be able to help each other and this way to help their loved ones.

One of the members is Mercedes, a very hard-working woman, who wants to get qualifications, which is why she joined the group, and to improve her living conditions. She is a dressmaker and has very good customers, who place good orders.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in fabrics, thread, rubber bands, and so on, so she can keep making dresses and fulfill her customers wishes.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, rubber bands and more.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 65 years old, married, and has one child. Loreta works very hard to provide for her family.

Loreta runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Loreta requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Loreta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a widowed woman with eight children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ma. Ann Chereyna Joy

texts.en:
Ma. Ann Chereyna Joy, 22, is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Ann Chereyna Joy has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Ma. Ann Chereyna Joy requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like fruits, oil, vegetable, etc.

In the future, Ma. Ann Chereyna Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fruits, oil, vegetable, etc.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 54  años de edad es casado con una linda familia de ocho hijos de las edades entre 5 y 18 años, esta humilde familia vive en una de las comunidades de Sololá.
Manuel es un padre de familia que se esmera mucho para brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario, el desde hace 25 años con esmero y dedicación se ha dedicado a la agricultura y gracias a esta labor a su familia ha logrado sacar adelante. Manuel ha tomado la iniciativa  de instalar una tienda de abarrotes ya que en su comunidad se carece de este tipo de negocio por lo que él quiere aprovechar la oportunidad, pero su mayor obstáculo es no contar con el capital suficiente para este negocio, cabe resaltar que Manuel no se detiene ante ningún obstáculo y por esa razón a considerado obtener un crédito para comprar productos de abarrotes como; Arroz, azúcar, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros.
El mayor anhelo de Manuel es contar con su propia tienda es por eso que espera conseguir el préstamo lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Manuel is 54 year old man who is married with a beautiful family of eight children who are between 5 and 18 years old. This humble family lives in one of the communities in Sololá.

Manuel is a father of a family and he strives a lot to provide what his children need. For 25 years, with effort and dedication, he has worked in agriculture and thanks to this labor he has gotten his family ahead. Manuel has taken the initiative to install a grocery store. Currently, his community is lacking this type of business and because of this he wants to take advantage of this opportunity. However, his biggest obstacle is he does not have access to sufficient capital for this business.

It's worth noting that Manuel does not stop when faced with any obstacle and for this reason he has considered obtaining a loan to purchase grocery products such as: rice, sugar, candies and soda, among others. Manuel's greatest yearning is to have his own store and it is because of this that he hopes to obtain a loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products such as: rice, sugar, candies and sodas, among others.

loans.name: Sara's Group

texts.en:
Sara, who is 38 years old and married, has three dependent children, two of whom are in school. The remaining child is too young for school. She resides in Kampong Cham province where she and her husband have been working on a rice farm for years. In her free time, Sara works for others for a fee to supplement their income.

The main challenges for the farming business is that rice sometimes fails to grow or produce good outputs due to drought and the price of rice on the market is sometimes low.

This is the first time for her with VisionFund. As the leader of two-member group, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes to improve the standard of living for the family, especially to be able to buy school materials for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to increase her crop yield in order to earn more income to spend on buying school materials for her children.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ma. Annie

texts.en:
Ma. Annie, 39, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Annie has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Ma. Annie requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

In the future, Ma. Annie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 30-year-old married mother of three children, who works hard to provide her family with a good standard of living.

Zeina is a hardworking woman, who puts so much effort into developing her business and attracting more customers. She has 11 years of experience in her domain, and she opened her own current restaurant in October, 2014, to support her husband in their family's income.

Zeina's business income is good enough to cover her family's daily needs, but currently she can't afford to cover any additional unexpected costs. Thus, an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will help her buy a new bedroom for her children to provide them with a better living.

She is working hard so that in the future she will be able to buy a special machine for broasting, in additional to another chicken grill.

loans.use: to buy a new bedroom for her children to provide them with a better living.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 21 years old. He is not married and has no children.

He has been running a stationery shop for two years.

He will be using the loan to purchase more stationery such as printing papers, files and envelopes to sell in hopes this will enable him to serve more clients and make more income to expand his business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be the biggest supplier of computers, laptops and stationery in the region.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery to sell and make more income to expand his business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 41 years old, married, and has nine children. With five children in school, Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

She requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like firewood, accessories, and other groceries.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like firewood, accessories, and other groceries.

loans.name: Yorokamu

texts.en:
Yorokamu is a 62-year-old Ugandan. He is married and has 11 children, five of whom are still in school.

He is a resident of Mpeefu Sub County where he operates a retail shop. He also deals in agriculture and grows crops like coffee.

The retails shop is still small and agriculture is seasonal, and so at times he gets challenges when it comes to paying tuition.

He has applied for a loan of three million shillings from Ugafode to pay for his children's tuition on time so that they don't miss exams and also to add stock in the shop.

His dream is to educate all his children. He is a hardworking man.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase supplies to make food such as meat, vegetables, seasonings, and more.

loans.name: Pheninah

texts.en:
Pheninah is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, kale, cabbages, onions and other items. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of products.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, cabbages, onions and other items.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, cabbages, onions and other items.

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que se unieron para poder formar este grupo llamado las poderosas, son de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Numilda, es peluquera, ella es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, se esfuerza por su familia, para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella comenta que poco a poco ha ido mejorando su pequeño emprendimiento.
La Sra. Numilda con este préstamo quiere invertir en la compra de tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su peluquería, y seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
There are 17 women who got together to be able to form the group called Las Poderosas. They are from the city of San Lorenzo and are in the poverty elimination program, struggling to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Numilda, a hairstylist. She is a woman who is very good at what she does. She works hard for her family to be able to give them a better quality of life. She says that little by little she has been improving her little undertaking.

Numilda, with this loan, wants to invest in the purchase of dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and more, in such as way as to be able to continue with her beauty salon and continue helping her loved ones through her work.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, creams, shampoos, rinses, and more.

loans.name: Jose Wilfrido

texts.es:
Jose es miembro de la ventanilla por ya mas de dos años es un persona muy responsable es casado tiene 6 hijos se dedica  a la venta de ganado a demas siembra maiz y papas y cria animales como puercos el dinero solicita para la compra de ganado para ampliar el negocio.

Por lo general las compras lo realiza en la ciudad de Guaranda, el sueño de jose es tener salud para seguir realizando lo que tanto le gusta cuidar del ganado.

enfrenta desafios como todos los comerciantes como es la dura competencia. En los momentos libres le gusta jugar baraje con los amigos del pueblo.
texts.en:
Jose has been a member of the rural service window for more than two years now and is a very responsible person. He is married and has 6 children. He works selling livestock and in addition grows corn and potatoes and raises animals such as pigs. The money he is asking for is to purchase livestock to expand his business.

In general, he makes his purchases in the city of Guaranda. Jose's dream is to have the health to be able to continue doing what he enjoys so much which is caring for the livestock.

He faces challenges like all business-people, which is the difficult competition. In his free time, he likes to play cards with his fiends from the town.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to expand his business.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
Margarito es un hombre casado, tiene 4 hijos, carece de estudios ya que su familia era de escasos recursos y desde pequeño se dedicó al trabajo agrícola.


Margarito tiene una experiencia de 20 años en los trabajos de agricultura  actividad que aprendió de sus padres quienes lo educaron y lo crecieron con amor y sabiduría  y es lo que lo ha llevado ser un ejemplo para su familia y a satisfacer las necesidades del hogar. 


Él solicita este crédito para pagar el alquiler de los terrenos agrícolas, preparar el terreno donde cultivar y comprar fertilizantes.

Las proyecciones que tiene para un futuro son las de apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, también pagar el crédito y adquirir un nuevo crédito para comenzar a cultivar hortalizas.
texts.en:
Margarito is a married man, has 4 children, and lacks an education because his family had limited resources and since he was little, he worked in agriculture.

Margarito has 20 years of experience in agricultural tasks, work that he learned from his parents who taught him and raised him with love and wisdom and it is what has raised him to be an example for his family and to satisfy the needs of his household.

He asks for this loan to pay the rent on the agricultural land, to prepare the land where he plants, and to purchase fertilizers.

The plans he has for the future are to support his children's education, and also to pay off the loan
and get another loan to begin to grow vegetables.

loans.use: to pay the rent on his agricultural land, prepare the land where he plants and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es: Yorleny, tiene la edad  de 35 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Yorleny is 35 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children, who are her greatest priority. With her loan, she plans to purchase fertilizers and other products to apply to the coffee crop, so that they develop well, and in addition to pay for labor costs to apply the products and assistance for the plants once she has a good development of her harvest and, in this way, to assure herself of doing good work.  What she plans is to take advantage of the good climatic and soil conditions that the zone has for this crop, and also to put into practice the experience of some years of managing coffee. In addition, she plans to be able to purchase better products and of better quality so that her plants have a good development and health such as a good harvest, and to have in the short-term a significant production. With the income from the harvest that she hopes to get, she wants to use it for the well-being of her family and to meet some family goals and to continue investing more in her crops. This is the first loan she has gotten from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other products to apply to the coffee crop and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a  house that has neither running water nor electricity. She cites school fees and food as her largest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbors and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating more hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in her business and buy clothing such as: t-shirts, jeans, shirts and pants.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with six children, one of whom attends school. Mary owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mary operates a charcoal selling business; selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the loan of 25,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated a snack selling business; selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat, flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat, flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Slivest

texts.en:
Slivest is a 42-year-old male Ugandan who is married to Grace. They have five children who are in school, and he is responsible for paying their school fees.

Slivest has applied for a loan of 2.3 million UGX from Ugafode which he will use to boost his local brew selling business. He will buy jerrycans of brew at a lower price and then he will sell at a profit. This is because he has an available market among the local residents who cannot afford canned or bottled beer. This is his major business and source of income. He is also involved in agriculture, growing crops like tomatoes and oranges, which helps to boost his income.

Slivest is hard working and resilient. He says he faces challenges of seasonality and price fluctuations.

loans.use: to buy locally processed beer to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marivic is 47 years old now.

Marivic has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a pub business over the past two years, selling to the neighbors and passersby. She mentioned transportation and seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, Amina wants to purchase stock of drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of drinks for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Rose operates a grocery and vegetable stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married mother of one child who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Azandougbe

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans, Azandougbé est une femme célibataire avec trois enfants à charge qui vit à Baguida. Azandougbé est une revendeuse de yaout traditionnel appelé « Deguê » qui s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant les quartiers environnant. Azndougbé demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de lait, de fonio et des cartons de couscous. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Azandougbé va pouvoir venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et à leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
At 35 years old, Azandougbé is a single woman taking care of three children, who lives in Baguida. Azandougbé sells traditional yoghurt called "Deguê", she gets her supplies twice per month at the market and sells it by making the rounds in the surrounding neighbourhoods.
Azandougbé requests this credit to order bowls of milk, fonio and boxes of couscous. With the resulting profit margin, Azandougbé will be able to assist in her children's schooling and development.

loans.use: to buy two bowls of milk, two boxes of couscous and twenty bowls of fonio.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée résidant à Agoè avec deux enfants à charge. Ablavi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois et du maïs qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Ablavi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois et du maïs afin réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a married woman living in Agoè and taking care of two children. She sells charcoal and corn, gets her supplies three times per month at the market and sells in front of her home.
In order to finance her purchases, Ablavi needs this loan so she can order bags of charcoal and corn so as to earn more profit and help her husband with the family expenses, then ensure their children can get a good education.

loans.use: to buy two bags of charcoal and three bags of corn.

loans.name: Essenam

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Essenam est une femme mariée âgée de 50 ans qui vit à Agoè. Essenam est une revendeuse de fournitures scolaire qui s’approvisionne et revend deux fois par mois au marché. Essenam sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paquets de cahiers de cent et deux-cent pages. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Essenam compte réinvestir dans cette activité qui est prometteur ces derniers moments de la fin des vacances scolaires puis aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants dès la rentrée.
texts.en: The mother of two children, Essenam is a married woman aged 50 years old who lives in Agoè. Essenum sells school supplies, she gets her supplies and sells twice per month at the market. She is requesting this loan to order packs of 100- and 200-page notebooks. With the resulting profit margin, Essenam intends to reinvest in this activity, which is promising during these last days of the school vacation. She will then hel^p her husband to pay their children's school fees as soon as school resumes.

loans.use: to buy forty packs of 100-page notebooks and forty packs of 200-page notebooks.

loans.name: Las Chijinis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CHIJINIS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Erika es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de muebles, servicio de carpintería, venta de carne, servicio de transporte, venta de comida, venta de zapatos deportivos, tienda de barrio. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Erika es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, por iniciativa propia y con un pequeño capital para poder emprender su negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de muebles) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz para posteriormente comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las reuniones de pago y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Las Chijinis" communal association (the Chijini community group) is starting their third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Tejada Focal Center (Tejada village focal center). The group is composed of eight members and is managed by a board of directors, where Señora Erika is the President. The businesses that the members of the group operate are varied, and include: furniture sales, carpentry, meat sales, transportation services, food sales, sports shoes sales, and a neighborhood store.

The credit that they will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, including Señora Erika. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago; introduced to it by the invitation of a friend who is a customer of the institution. Currently Erika has a business selling furniture. She recounts that she started this business several years ago, of her own initiative, and with little capital to be able to start her business.

The loan she will now take out is to increase her capital - to purchase furniture - which she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz, in order to later sell it in her own retail space. This form of work allows her to generate sufficient resources to support her family financially, as she is single and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the meetings about finance and health that Pro Mujer offers.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a widowed woman and has three children. She has owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 13 years, she has operated a fruit and coconuts selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is lack of capital in her business. With the Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married and a mother of two children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has sold green vegetables for the past one year, selling at the market. She always faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Kunthea makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mwanashabani

texts.en:
Mwanashabani is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
