For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business for neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a married woman with one child. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Asia has operated a tailoring business for the past six years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over eight years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married mother of four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

For over six years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman and is staying together with her husband and two children. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a single woman and has been blessed with one child. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over 15 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Perseverantes se unió con mujeres de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas están luchando por mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien tiene una humilde despensa que pudo montar con mucho sacrificio, ella es una persona muy sacrificada que poco a poco está luchando para poder mejorar en su emprendimiento, el cual es el sostén de su familia. Comenta que quiere capacitarse para ir mejorando en su despensa.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas, carne, panificados, enlatados, lácteos y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y de esa manera seguir dando a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener. En la foto del grupo aparecen 17 mujeres, ya que el grupo tiene 17 integrantes, pero solo 16 de ellas piden este préstamo.
texts.en:
The Perseverantes group was formed by women of the city of Paraguari. They are in the program of poverty elimination. They are all fighting to improve the conditions of life of each of them. 
One of the members if Maria, who has a modest grocery store she managed to build with a lot of sacrifice. She is a person who makes a lot of sacrifices, who little by little is fighting to be able to improve her entrepreneurship, which is the main source of support of her family. She says she needs to get more training to continue improving her grocery store. 
She asks for this loan to buy fruit, meat, bread, canned products, dairy products, among others, to be able to continue with her sales the way she has been doing, and in this way keep giving to her loved ones everything that she couldn’t have.
In the photo there are 17 women, as the group has 17 members, but only 16 of them are asking for this loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit, meat, bread, canned products, dairy products, among others.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa se formó en la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona rural de difícil acceso, donde las integrantes luchan para poder dar a su familia un mejor acceso a la educación y a la seguridad.
La Sra. Ada es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeño  negocio, que es una despensa, ella trabaja en este  plan de negocio, y lucha para poder mejorar y crecer, capacitarse para poder ayudar a su familia y seres queridos. Ada es una mujer muy luchadora que pese a los problemas lucha por poder superar cualquier circunstancia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, pollos, lácteos, enlatados y otros, para poder seguir con su trabajo y sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Guapa is from the city of Curuguaty, a rural zone which is difficult to access, where the members struggle to be able to provide their families with access to education and security. 

Ada is one of the members, she has her own small business selling food. She works in this shop and fights to be able to improve and grow, to be able to support her family and loved ones. Ada is a  determined woman who despite her problems strives to be able to improve any situation. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy supplies for her shop, such as vegetables, meats, condiments, dairy products, and tinned goods etc. to be able to continue with her work and sales. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve her business venture.

loans.use: buy vegetables, meat, condiments, chickens, dairy goods, and tinned goods etc.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en: Saida is a bright girl and was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1997. She is single and lives with her parents.  Her father is a taxi driver. Her mother is a tailor she sews traditional women dresses at home. Saida  graduated well from secondary school. and this year she passed the  entrance examination to the Technology University and is preparing to start her studies. She made a goal to study well and gain knowledge to be future specialist. She appealed to IMON and Kiva asking financial support to pay her higher education costs.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs at the Technology University

loans.name: Ghofran

texts.en: Ghofran is a 47-year-old Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and three children, who are attending school.  She has been working since 2000 at her house in tailoring to help her family to meet the needs of life. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. To better develop her work, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy a new sewing machine. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and, thus, will improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Yolanda is 50 years old now.

Yolanda has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Saly

texts.en:
Saly is a 53-year-old widowed mother with two children who lives in a village in the Province of Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Salay earns main income from selling fruit, sweets and porridge. She has been in the business since 2008. Her two children are factory workers. Together, they can make approximately $20 per day.

She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With the loan, she will be able to improve the family’s finances. For her future plans, she is going to expand her business and build a new proper house.

loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Tuju Puku Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado TUJU PUKU está en su ciclo número 1, ellas se encuentran dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, el cual les permitirá poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma, quien es agricultora, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de verduras que produce  en su propio campo se gana la vida.
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que poco a poco viene mejorando sus condiciones de vida y a la vez ayuda a su familia. Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas, abonos, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer y mejorando.
texts.en: PThe TUJU PUKU group is in in it's first cycle and is part of a program to eliminate poverty which will allow the members to improve their living conditions. One of the members is Mrs. Norma. She is a farmer who is able to earn a living through her efforts and constant work and by selling vegetables that she grows on her own plot. She is a very determined woman who, little by little, has been improving her living conditions and, at the same time, helping her family.  She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other items so that she may continue her work. She is thankful for the opportunity she has been given to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other items.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 33 year old Lebanese single woman living with her parents. After facing difficult circumstances, she decided to work at her domicile as a beautician and hairdresser. She is a talented person and a hard worker always trying her best to please her customers.

And now, Khadija is applying for a loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy hairdresser tools in order to expand more her work and develop her work and therefore her income.

loans.use: to buy hairdresser tools

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Guadalupe está en el ciclo número 1 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Se ha hecho las encuestas de eliminación de pobreza, donde se ha visto que ellas están pudiendo ir aumentando sus ingresos y su nivel de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Laura, Directora de Finanzas del Comité, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de las ventas en la despensa que tiene, lucha por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. La Sra. Laura es una mujer muy sacrificada que pese a los problemas ha podido mejorar y crecer cada día.
La Sra. Laura solicita este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para poder seguir con sus ventas, como ser: verduras, frutas, panificados, bebidas, y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas, como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Guadalupe group is in the number 1 cycle of the program of the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. They have done the surveys of poverty elimination, which have shown that they have been able to increase their incomes and their level of life. 
One of the members is Laura, the Director of the Finance Committee, who through the effort and continuous work, and through the sales of her grocery store, fights to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. 
Laura is a woman who makes a lot of sacrifices, who in spite of the problems, has been able to improve and grow every day.
Laura is asking for this loan to buy supplies, such as: vegetables, fruit, bread, drinks, and others, to be able to continue with their sales, as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, bread, drinks, and others.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en: Leonor is from Carles, Iloilo. She is married with four adult sons. Her husband is a farmer while Leonor is engaged in direct selling business. She sells underwear, shirts, shoes and beauty products from “Natasha” and “MSE” products. She has been doing this for 10 years. Leonor is a 58-year-old woman and dreams to improve her business to have better means of living. She is asking a loan to buy more products to sell which mention above and to buy gasoline for their boat, as they own a boat for fishing.

loans.use: to buy underwear, shirts, shoes, beauty products and gasoline.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 22 years old and is married with 1 child. She has had a retail shop and m-pesa business for 1 year.  She will be using the loan to purchase more stocks of sugar, flour and drinking water for sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her retail shop and become a successful business woman and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of sugar, flour and drinking water to sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Precy is 59 years old and has two children who are in school.

Precy has a buy and sell hardware business in the Philippines. Precy requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of hardware to sell.

Precy has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Precy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of hardware to sell

loans.name: Ritchelle

texts.en:
Ritchelle is 33 years old and married with two children.

Ritchelle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Ritchelle has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store  for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ritchelle aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 56 years old and married with one child, Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 57 years old and married with one child. Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like charcoal, sugar, home product care, and other groceries.

Cecilia has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like charcoal, sugar, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Tatiana Elizabeth

texts.es: Tatiana es una microempresaria residenciada en una localidad del municipio de Barranquilla que inicio su negocio hace dos años por iniciativa de su papá, quien toda la vida se ha dedicado a la comercialización de productos ferreteros y le aconsejó continuar con este legado.  Esta joven emprendedora de 27 años inicialmente ofrecía productos directamente en las viviendas del barrio, tiempo después aperturó un local en donde maneja un amplio surtido de dotaciones industriales entre ellos guantes, cascos, gafas, botas, ropa y todo lo relacionado con seguridad industrial.  Sus principales clientes son empresas del gremio de la construcción a quienes por reglamentación les exigen aprovisionar a sus empleados con los elementos de trabajo que salvaguarden su integridad. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en elementos de seguridad industrial y soldadura.  Esta inversión es muy significativa para su negocio puesto que al mejorar el surtido y mejorará sus ventas. Tatiana es madre soltera de una niña de cuatro años y su meta a largo plazo es educarla y continuar ofreciéndole bienestar.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a micro-entrepreneur from a town in the municipality of Barranquilla. Two years ago, she started her business through the initiative of her father, who had worked his whole life selling hardware goods and advised her in continuing this legacy.

Initially, this young entrepreneur of 27 years offered her goods directly in her neighbors' houses. Later she opened a store, where she offers a wide range of industrial equipment like gloves, helmets, goggles, boots, clothing, and everything related to industrial security.

Her main customers are companies in the field of construction, who are required by regulations to equip their workers with items that will ensure their physical safety.

No she is applying for her first kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest into goods for industrial safety and soldering. This investment is very important for her business, because by an improved supply, sales will improve.

Tatiana is a single mother of a 4-year-old girl and her long-term goal is to educate her and keep offering her a good life.

loans.use: to invest in goods of industrial security and soldering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married mother of one child who is too young to attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one year she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN JOVEN PADRE DE FAMILIA Y ÚNICO SOSTÉN DE ESTA. TIENE PROBLEMAS DE SALUD DENTAL QUE NO SE ATENDIÓ A TIEMPO POR LO QUE SUFRIÓ LA PERDIDA DE VARIAS PIEZAS DENTALES, ESTO LE PROVOCA PROBLEMAS PARA ALIMENTARSE ADECUADAMENTE, APARTE DEL EVIDENTE PROBLEMA ESTÉTICO, QUE LE CAUSA PENA. DESEA ATENDERSE DE MANERA INMEDIATA LAMENTABLEMENTE SUS RECURSOS SON INSUFICIENTES.
texts.en:
He is a young father, and he is the only support of his family.

He has dental health problems that were not taken care of on time. Therefore, he lost several teeth. This caused problems with eating properly, aside from the obvious aesthetic problem, which embarrasses him.

He wishes to take care of the problem immediately. Regrettably, he does not have enough financial resources.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sweets, gums, biscuits etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy oils, snacks, coffees, soaps etc.

loans.name: Manale

texts.en: Manale is a 30-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and her two children who are still attending school. Her husband provides the main income source to help her family to meet the needs of life and to be able to enhance their way of living. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the last installment of her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay the last installment of her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen is a resident in Carles, Iloilo. She is a 65-year-old woman, married with five adult children. To earn a living she sells food to the community. She has been doing this business for eight years. Since her children are old enough and perhaps has its own family, Belen is doing this business for daily consumption and to save money for the future. With this, she is asking a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, cooking oil and noodles. She also plans to buy a motorcycle for easy transportation. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to have better means of living.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, cooking oil and noodles

loans.name: Joji

texts.en:
Joji is a 48-year-old woman from Estancia, Iloilo. She is married with four children. Two of these children are still in school aged ages 20 and 14 years old. Her husband is a teacher while Joji helps her husband by buying and selling dried fish and squid. She has been doing this for 10 years. Aside from selling fish, she also engaged in selling food.

She is asking a loan to buy more dried fish to sell and to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as flour, cooking oil and sugar. Joji dreams to be prosperous. She wants to increase their livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy petrol.

loans.name: Ascah

texts.en:
Ascah is 30 years old, married and supports 3 children.

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 5 years, planting nimbler grass, earning an income of KES 15,000 per month.

Ascah has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her nimbler grass plants in order to meet her clients demand, as well her family needs.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and buy a dairy cow for milk production.

Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her nimbler grass plants, in order to meet her clients demands, who have increased in the market as well as family.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of products. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: William Antonio

texts.es:
Hace seis años, cada vez que William escuchaba una bocina sonar en la estación de buses, sabía que era la hora de entrada de su trabajo como vendedor de productos naturales. Al subirse al bus, esperaba a que todos se sentaran para él comenzara a proyectar su voz ofreciendo la mercancía que ayudaba a darle de comer a tres hijos como padre soltero. El tiempo ha pasado y con él este emprendedor ha evolucionado, a sus 43 años de edad tiene posee su propia tienda farmacia de productos naturales registrados.
El hijo mayor de William lo apoya siempre en todo lo que necesita, pues ambos sueñan con volver de este negocio toda una distribuidora de medicamentos orgánicos. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar medicamentos naturales en grandes cantidades para tener una gran variedad con excelentes productos en venta. En sus metas está establecer otro negocio para tener más ingresos en su hogar.
texts.en:
For the last six years, every time William hears a horn honk at the bus station he knows it is time to start his work selling natural products.  He boards a bus and waits for everyone to be seated before projecting out his voice, offering the products he sells in order to put bread on the table for his children.  He is a single father and over time this 43-year-old entrepreneur has evolved, now owning his own pharmacy of registered natural products.

William's oldest son helps out in every way he can since both he and his father dream of turning their business into a distributor of organic medicine.  Therefore, William is requesting a loan to buy natural medicines in bulk quantities to have a wide variety of excellent products to sell.  One of his goals is to establish another business to earn more income for the household.

loans.use: To buy natural medicines

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 47 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Janet has a food vending business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Janet has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Josefina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Josefina es de las emprendedoras que le gusta invertir constantemente en su negocio, anteriormente ya había solicitado un préstamo para comprar productos para su pulpería como pan, arroz, dulces, entre otros que le permitieron tener buenos ingresos. Por esta razón, esta emprendedora de 41 años de edad agradece a todas las personas que le apoyaron con ese crédito.
Ahora, con más de cuatro años con su negocio, sabe que la inversión es algo que debe hacerlo frecuentemente, por esta razón solicita un nuevo préstamo con el cual comprará arroz, frijoles, papel higiénico, café, azúcar, entre otros productos de alta demanda por parte de sus clientes. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos, quienes no dudan en siempre estar ahí. Al cancelar con este crédito, piensa seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefina is an entrepreneur who likes to continually invest in her business. She has previously requested a loan to buy products like bread, rice, sweets, and other products for her grocery store. They allowed her to have good earnings. It is for this reason that this 41 year old entrepreneur is grateful to all of the people who supported her with this loan.

Now, with over four years in her business, she knows that investing is something she needs to do frequently. This is the reason she is requesting a new loan to buy rice, beans, toilet paper, coffee, and sugar, among other products with a lot of customer demand.

She has the support of her husband and her children, who don't hesitate to always be there. Upon repaying this loan she plans to continue investing in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, toilet paper, coffee, and sugar, among others.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 59 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eulalia has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries.

In the future, Eulalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 32 year old male Ugandan married to Barbra and they have 05 children who are in school.
Fred is a transporter and he owns 2 vehicles for transport and he works as a driver for all the days of the week. Besides transport, Fred is also a farmer he grows crops like maize, and beans which help him to supplement his income.

He has applied for a loan of five million from UGAFODE to buy a car for business, this will help to expand his business and the income sources. His dream for the future is to buy a bus but he is quick to mention that the biggest challenge is the poor state of roads.
He appreciates the generous support of Kiva lenders and is committing himself to pay well to qualify for loans.

loans.use: to boost his transport business by paying for another car.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: Mariée, Ameyo a deux enfants à charge. Ameyo  est âgée de 48 ans et habite à Agoè où elle prépare et vend de la pâte faite à base du maïs. Ameyo  achète le nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et vend sa marchandise à la devanture de son domicile. Ameyo sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs afin de bien satisfaire ses clients et de gagner plus de bénéfices en vue de soutenir les besoins de son foyer et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Ameyo is a 48-year-old married mother to two children who lives in Agoè. Here, she cooks and sells maize mash in order to earn a living. She purchases the necessary ingredients twice monthly from market and sells the finished product out of her house.

Ameyo is requesting this loan to purchase bags of maize in order to satisfy her customers and earn a greater profit so she can meet her household expenses and improve her daily living standards.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of maize.

loans.name: Sorat's Group

texts.en: Sorat’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sorat makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ter's Group

texts.en: Ter’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ter makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Grupo Alegre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Grupo Alegre” está en su 1 º ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, cada una luchando por mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Runilda, quien vende prendas variadas, por medio de su humilde trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Ella lucha por poder darle a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener, al igual que las demás integrantes Runilda esta muy contenta por esta oportunidad que recibe.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas variadas, como ser remeras, camperas, pantalones, jeans, camisas y otros, de manera a poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Grupo Alegre" is in its first women's program loan cycle with all the members committed to working and helping each other to get ahead.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey and struggling to improve their lives.

One of the members is Runilda who sells a variety of clothing.  Through her humble work she is able to earn a decent, honest living.  She struggles to give her loved ones everything that she never had.  Like the other members of the group, Runilda is pleased to have this opportunity.

She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of clothing such as shorts, jackets, pants, jeans, shirts and other items so she can continue improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing such as shorts, jackets, pants, jeans, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda the 58-year-old widowed mother of five children with a home-based business, who started working 15 years ago to cover her family's needs after her husband passed away.
She started selling clothes and preparing special homemade sweets, to make sure she can benefit from diversified incomes for a better living.

Hoda’s special offering is homemade malban, a starchy sweet with pistachio or walnuts that is popular in the Levant. Her tasteful and clean products as well as the stylish clothes she sells have built Hoda a wide and loyal customer base.
To get ready for the coming winter season customers' requests, through buying the necessary raw food materials and clothes, Huda is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. As she increases her offerings, she would make more money, necessary to cover her living expenses as an independent woman.

loans.use: To get ready for the coming winter season customers' requests, through buying the necessary raw food materials and clothes

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.en:
Zebiniso is a careful mother. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is married and has four children and is a nurse at medical clinic. Her daughter is studying at a foreign university. Here is the picture of her and her daughter. Her salary is not enough to pay her daughter’s tuition fee.

She was informed about IMON and Kiva service that helps students to pay their tuition fees. She decided to trust to IMON and Kiva and ask a loan to pay her tuition fee. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s foreign university tuition fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her nimbler grass plants.

loans.name: Resurection

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Resurection works hard to support her family.

She has a triclcye passenger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.  Resurection is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle passenger business.

Resurection has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle passenger taxi

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 56 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is 26 years old. He lives with his wife and pensioner grandmother in Telavi, Kakheti region. Givi is involved in the transportation business with his own car. He gets orders to transport some products for a distance and generates income.

Givi decided to start an additional business to get a more stable income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3000 GEL. With the received credit Givi will open a bakery and will bake Georgian bread to sell. He already has a space; Givi will finish building the bakery and will purchase a stock of flour for baking bread. Givi expects he will get a more stable income and will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to open a bakery

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 47 ans qui vit à Agoè. Mère de cinq enfants, Yawa est une revendeuse des céréales et de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de sa maison pour atteindre son but. Pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois et de maïs, Yawa  nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de faire face aux différents qu’elle éprouve.
texts.en:
Yawa is a 47-year-old married mother to five children who lives in Agoè. Here, she cooks and sells cereals and wood charcoal. She purchases what she needs twice monthly from market then resells it out of her house in order to earn a living.

Yawa is requesting this loan to purchase bags of wood charcoal and maize in order to earn a large profit so she can meet the difficulties she is currently facing.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of wood charcoal and two bags of maize.

loans.name: Veronica Salimar

texts.es:
Lo que fue una visita al hogar de Verónica, se convirtió en el inicio de la fuente de ingresos de su hogar, pues recibió la invitación para emprendedor en la venta de productos de belleza de la marca Avon y ahora tiene más de diez años de haber penetrado en ese mercado. Ella es madre de dos pequeños que sueña con verlos convertirse en grandes profesionales, además es esposa de un hombre que la apoya moral y económicamente todo el tiempo. 
Ella sueña con llegar a tener una tienda estable y no seguir vendiendo de forma ambulante. De manera que solicita un préstamo para invertir, comprando cremas corporales, maquillaje, perfumes, jabones, entre otros productos de belleza que tanto anhelan sus clientas. Esto no solo le permitirá cumplir con los pedidos, sino también captar más clientes. En sus planes también está en variar más en mercadería.
texts.en:
What was once just a visit to Veronica's house has become the launch of a source of income for her household.  She received an invitation from Avon beauty products to become an entrepreneur selling this line of products.  Now, she has been active in the market for over ten years.  She is the mother of two small children who she wants to see become professionals, and is also the wife of a man who supports her both morally and economically every day.

She dreams of opening a shop one day and not have to work as a street vendor.  So she is requesting a loan to buy body lotions, makeup, perfumes, soaps and other beauty products her customers are interested in.  This will allow her to fill orders and also attract new customers.  Her plans include offering a wider variety of merchandise.

loans.use: To buy body lotions, makeup, perfumes, soaps and other products.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Palmeras  está integrado por 15 mujeres, todas ellas luchadoras y emprendedoras que quieren dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde ellas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudia quien tiene una despensa y peluquería, ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos variados para poder surtir su despensa y también su peluquería. Claudia quiere poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de la ayuda de su grupo.
Agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group Las Palmeras [The Palms] is made up of 15 women, all of which are determined and enterprising, who want to give their loved ones everything they were not able to have themselves. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, in which they want to better their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

One of the members is Claudia, who has a small grocery store and a hair salon. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy assorted supplies to stock her store as well as her salon. Claudia wants to be able to better her living conditions through this group's help. 

They are grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving to be able to better their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

loans.use: to buy assorted supplies to stock her pantry as well as her hair salon

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 22-year-old single young man who started selling DVDs and mobile accessories five years ago to cover his needs and expenses. He is an independent man who lives on his own and is trying hard to develop his business. Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with more mobile accessories and new DVDs to satisfy his customers' requests.

Bilal hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with more mobile accessories and new DVDs

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en:
This is Nadine, a 35 years old married mother of two children, who started in 2002 her own beauty salon business to support her husband in making their living. Nadine is well known in her region.

She was trained by her neighbor, who gave her the basic skills to start her own business.
Nadine runs her beauty salon in a well managed way and she is working hard to develop her business to make sure she can attract more customers and respond to current customers needs.
Through an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, Nadine will buy a new updated facial laser machine, in addition to increasing her beauty products capital.
She is working hard that in the future she will expand her working sector and diversify her services through opening a specialized tattoo section.

loans.use: to develop her business through buying a new updated facial laser machine, in addition to increase her beauty products capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her nappier grass, in order to meet her client demands, who have increased in the market and the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is in her late 40s and is a widow. She has three grown-up children. She has been selling fish for ten years now. She works from 07am to 6.30pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing on the small dry fish called Dagga and has successfully paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to repay the loan, took care of herself, to save in her bank account, reinvest in business and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on the small dry fish stock. She dreams of building her house.

Rehema will make sure she pays back her loan with the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase on  the small dry fish stock.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Margret is aged 29 years old, married and supports 6 children.

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 7 years, earning an income of KES 17000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her nappier grass, in order to meet her client demands who have increased in the market and the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her nappier grass in order to meet her client demands who have increased in the market and the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sell goats. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more goats. Her business goal is to start a butchery within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 47 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Consolacion has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. Consolacion requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

Consolacion has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Consolacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Zeinat

texts.en: Zeinat is a 49-year-old, married mother of one child. Twenty-two years ago, she started working as a tailor to help her husband, who works as a taxi driver, in covering the needs and expenses of their only child. Zeinat is a hard worker who has a good reputation among her region and has her loyal customers. She is trying hard to improve her family's living conditions; her family is her priority. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to renovate her house and maintain her husband's taxi car, which is his only source of income. Zeinat hopes to stay capable of providing her family with a better life.

loans.use: to renovate her house and maintain her husband's taxi car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her nappier grass.

loans.name: Nohelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
El olor a comida que perfuma toda la vivienda de Nohelia, hace saber a todos en la calle que su almuerzo o fritanga está lista. La casa de esta emprendedora de cuarenta años de edad, siempre está llena de clientes, como si se tratase de un Black Friday, donde la gente llena las tiendas para comprar,  lo que indica que su comida es una de las mejores y con tan solo tres años de haber iniciado. Ella es madre de un joven de veinte años de edad, quien estudia fuertemente para que pronto pueda ayudarle a su madre en los gastos del hogar y esposa de un esposo que la apoya, al igual que su hermana. 
Anteriormente Nohelia trabajaba en una fábrica y luego empezó en el mundo de la venta de comida en otro lugar. Ahora que ya es independiente, solicita un préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, repollo, plátanos, carne, entre otros productos para producir y vender su comida de calidad.   Esto le permitirá tener más ingresos al comprar por mayor. En sus planes está componer su hogar, construir un inodoro y comprar más sillas y mesas para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The smell of food fills all of Nohelia's home, letting everyone in the street know that their lunch or fried food is ready. The house of this forty-year-old entrepreneur is always full of clients, as if it were Black Friday, when everyone fills the stores to buy things. This proves that her cooking is one of the best, even with just three years under her belt. She is the mother of a twenty-year-old who is studying so that he can soon help his mother with the family expenses. She is also the wife of a husband who supports her, just like her sister.

Noehlia used to work in a factory and later on started in the world of selling food. Now that she's independent, she is asking for a loan to buy rice, beans, cabbage, bananas, meat and other products to produce and sell her quality food. This will allow her to have a higher income by buying wholesale. She is planning on decorating her house, constructing a restroom and buying more chairs and tables so she can offer better service to her clients.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cabbage, bananas, and meat as well as other products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy articles of clothing to sell, such as: T-shirts, collared shirts, pants, blouses and more

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat is the resident of the Vakhsh district. She is a modest and kind woman. Sharofat is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children.

Sharofat has two activities to support her family living. The first one is farming and the second is raising livestock which makes an additional income. Now Sharofat plans to expand both activities. Unfortunately her capital is not enough so she decided to ask a loan to purchase fertilizer, animal feed and buy more cattle. Sharofat believes that after she gets this loan her dream to expand her activities will come true which makes her able to increase revenue for family and also for her children study in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, animal feed and buy more cattle.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 51-year-old married woman who started twenty two years ago working as a hairdresser to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker with professional skills, as she has a good reputation among her customers. 
Amal is trying hard to develop her family's living conditions, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house through painting the walls and buying necessary furniture.
Amal hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house through painting the walls and buying necessary furniture

loans.name: Leny

texts.en: Leny, 39, is married with one child, who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leny has operated a food stall business for two years in the Philippines. She requested a 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food stall business. In the future, Leny would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall business.

loans.name: Ay

texts.en:
Ay is a 59-year-old married mother with two children who resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. One of her children is a factory worker and another one is motor mechanic. Her husband is an 81-year-old old father. Together, they can earn approximately $23 per day. To find a way to help her children earn more income.

Ay would like to apply for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy motor parts for her child to sell. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy more parts to increase her family’s income. In the future, she wants to help her child to expand his business and build fence around her house.

loans.use: to buy motor parts to sell

loans.name: Munduli B Group

texts.en:
Tano who is in her early 40s is single with two children who are still in school.  She has been selling fabrics for three years now.  She works from 09am to 04pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Tano’s 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the fabrics, sarongs and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments, bought a TV set, a plot of land, a radio and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy up dated fabrics, sarongs and meet her customer's requirement.  She dreams of educating her children  up to university.

Tano will share this loan with her loan group  MUNDULI B which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up dated fabrics, sarongs and meet her customer's requirement.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 1er Del programa de comité de mujeres,  están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Irma.
Ella  a través del esfuerzo y por medio de la venta de ropas que hace, está esforzándose para poder seguir y cada día mejorar en su pequeño emprendimiento. Irma comenta que poco a poco quiere seguir capacitándose para poder seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
La Sra.Irma pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones, polleras, blusas, y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando y esforzándose por sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Emprendedoras is in its first cycle in the committee of women program, which is conducting a survey on elimination of poverty. One of the members is Irma.

By her efforts and through her sale of clothes, Irma is striving to be able to continue and constantly improve her small business. Irma states that little by little she wants to continue equipping herself in order to continue helping her family through her business.

Irma seeks this loan to be able to buy tee shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, skirts and blouses, among other things, in order to continue fighting and striving for her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy tee shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, skirts, blouses and other articles to sell.

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
20 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, ellas se unieron para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada.
Ella vende joyas y a través de ello se gana la vida de una manera digna, se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, quien hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exige y al mismo tiempo incentiva a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar su situación de pobreza.
La Sra. Lidia solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar joyas variadas para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy, luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
Twenty women make up this group. They come together to be able to grow and to improve their conditions of life through a poverty-elimination program. Lidia, a very hard-working and sacrificing woman, is one of the members.

Lidia sells pieces of jewelry and in this manner, earns her livelihood in a dignified way. She credits the Fundacion Paraguaya for providing continuous training and verification programs which are always demanding and, at the same time, provide incentives to the women to struggle to be able to overcome their situation of poverty.

Lidia is requesting a loan to be able to purchase a variety of jewelry to sell, in order to continue with her sales business as she has done up to now, struggling for her family.

loans.use: buy a variety of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a single man with 2 children. He describes himself to be courageous. He operates a farm where he keeps poultry and has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more poultry and farm inputs. His business goal is to own a poultry hatchery company within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more poultry and farm inputs

loans.name: Esta

texts.en: Esta is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables,eggs. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock  of vegetables. Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock  of vegetables

loans.name: Leanette

texts.en:
Leanette’s previous loan with Center for Community Transformation (CCT) really helped her scrap business. She’s able to buy large quantity of scrap varieties and resell to become reusable and turn into profit. Though profit is not that drastic compared to other businesses, hard work and patience are her strengths to be able to run the business and support her family. She’s grateful for the support provided by Kiva, lenders and CCT. 

Leanette believes in the saying “May pera sa basura” or “There’s money in junk”. It is a job without days off where your hands get dirty just to make a profit. Leanette wants to have her own junk shop and variety store someday, continue to support her children’s education and provide needs for her family. Aside from hard work and patience, capital is one of the bases for her business’ success to take place. That’s why Leanette decided to apply for a P15,000 loan that will be used as added capital to buy large quantities of scrap material like plastic, metal, steel, carton and glass.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Leanette spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consists of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of scrap material like plastic, metal, steel, carton and glass.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 51 years old and married with five children. Belinda works very hard to provide for them.

Belinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Belinda has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned good, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future Belinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a rice retailing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Helen dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Joeseth

texts.en:
Joeseth is 33 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Joeseth has a fishing business in the Philippines. Joeseth requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Joeseth has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Joeseth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 45 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marissa has a clothing retail business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.  

Marissa requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kayed

texts.en:
Kayed is a 23-year-old, single man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Five years ago, he started working in collecting and selling metal scrap.
Kayed is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua to finalize building his own house, and prepare for his wedding which is his dream to come true. 
Kayed's future plan is to open his own metal scrap plot and to increase his capital and take a good care of his future family.

loans.use: to finalize building his own house and prepare for his wedding.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon was born in northern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an agrarian. Her family is employed in planting agricultural products on their land. For example expenditures to cultivating cotton are increasing and cannot cover spent money.

Guljahon had come to mind to open a new business. Before getting married, her mother taught her how to sew traditional women dresses. She always dreamed to sew. However, she heard about IMON that provides training for startup clients and chance to get a loan. She participated at a three day training and got the necessary knowledge. She wrote a business plan where she sums up all necessary things to do in order to open a sewing factory.

Last year she has bought sewing machines. This year she has no money to buy textiles for sewing. She is asking a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy textiles for her business. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and support. The loan will help one more entrepreneur from Tajikistan to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her newly created sewing business

loans.name: Ruena

texts.en:
“Ukay-ukay” is a Tagalog word, which means to “dig in,” unlike in department stores or boutiques where clothes are folded, ironed and arranged accordingly. In an ukay-ukay, clothes are put on hangers regardless of the classification or brand. Others are stocked in a box that you need to “dig in” to see and choose a variety of designs. Aside from clothes, shoes, bags, hats, bed sheets and other items are being sold here. A lot of people patronize this kind of business since you can get cheap, but branded items. Yes items are cheap since all are used, but with high a quality imported from other countries.

Ruena is a 32-year-old businesswoman, married to Rodrigo, who’s helping her in the business. They live in Pasay City, Philippines. She has been running the business for 10 years already, and they are blessed having five different branches. She’s earning about PHP 32,000 every month. Like any other business, you need to be dedicated, hardworking, and you also need to set goals. Ruena decided to apply for loan of PHP 50,000 as a supplementary capital for the business to have a variety of items for her ukay-ukay like added clothes, shoes, bags, hats and such.

Ruena believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from members’ life changing testimonies, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to have a variety of items for her business like added clothes, shoes, bags, hats and such.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena is engaged in food processing such as “tusino” (a Filipino word which means sweetened cured meat) and “embutido” (a Filipino meatloaf). She has been doing this for two years. Aside from this, she is also engaged in knitting bonnets and bags. She works hard for her 14 year old daughter. Lucena is a 53-year-old woman and dreams to be successful in her business. She wants to be a supplier of tusino and embutido in the future. She also wants to export her knitting business to have a sustainable life. With that, she is asking a loan to buy ingredients such as spices, aluminum foil, pork and chicken meat. She also buys yarn for her knitting business.

loans.use: to buy spices, aluminum foil, pork and chicken meat and yarn for her knitting business

loans.name: Ma. Pinky

texts.en:
Ma. Pinky is 42 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Pinky has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Pinky requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Pinky has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ma. Pinky would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en: Da’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Da makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is 54 years old, married with five children.

Remy works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Remy has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Remy aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a sari-sari storeowner from Estancia, Iloilo. She has been doing this for 17 years. Aside from her sari-sari store, she is engaged in a tailoring business, while her husband works hard as a laborer. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as toiletries, spices, laundry soap, candies, biscuits, chips, eggs, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks. She also needs to buy tailoring accessories such as needles, thread and cloth. Aside from this, she wants to buy a new sewing machine.

In the future, she dreams to be successful in her married life and have a better means of living. In addition, Myrna is 52 years old and has two school-aged children, ages 13 and 10 years old.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, spices, laundry soap, candies, biscuits, chips, eggs, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, needles, thread, cloth and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 53 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Pamela has a general store business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell. Pamela has been in this business for five years. In the future, Pamela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1976 and is living in a village with her family. She is divorced and has one child. She is one of the trustees and responsible clients at IMON. She is punctual, hardworking and honest person. After divorce she decided to work and earn money to ensure their family. She entered to collective farm as an accountant worker. At the same time she got classes to teach students at college.

Now she has higher pedagogical and accountant knowledge and well knows her specialty. She is new at work and does not earn enough money to pay her daughter’s education costs. She is asking financial support from IMON and Kiva to pay college tuition fee of her daughter. She awaits your kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay college tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that  neither has electricity and nor piped water.
For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is 52 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Zeny has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Zeny requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Zeny has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Zeny would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Greth Griselda

texts.es:
Estar rodeada de personas, le ha permitido a Greth, una joven de 24 años de edad, estudiar la licenciatura en Psicología con mención en clínica. Ella ha luchado por cinco años, todos los sábados, para estar hasta donde está. Lo aprendido le ha servido mucho para destacarse en su trabajo como docente de primaria, donde se siente apta para detectar cualquier problema con los niños. 
Greth tiene el apoyo de su madre, quien le manda remesas que le ha ayudado a estar a punto de concluir sus estudios. Ahora que está cerca de terminar esta etapa,  por lo que no duda en invertir en su educación, de manera que solicita un préstamo para pagar su título. Al obtener su título, ella podrá optar a mejores puestos laborales. En sus planes está poder especializarse en una materia para impartir en secundaria, además sueña con que más adelante pueda estudiar computación.
texts.en:
The support of others has allowed Greth, a young 24 year old woman, to study psychology with a clinical specialization. She has worked for five years, every Saturday, to get to where she is now. What she learned has been useful in enabling her to excel in her work as an elementary school teacher, where she feels capable of detecting any problems amongst the children.

Greth has the support of her mother, who sends her remittances that have helped her get to the brink of completing her studies. Now that she's close to the end of this stage, she won't hesitate to invest in her education, so she's applying for a loan to pay to finish getting her degree. Once she acquires her degree, she'll have better job opportunities to choose from. One of her plans is to specialize in a field that she can teach in high school, and she also dreams of studying computers further down the road.

loans.use: To pay to finish getting her degree.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
A young woman, who is a local farmer of Bovel district of Battambang province, is 19 years old and Sary has a young child. The primary sources of her family’s income are from growing rice, raising pigs and chicken. Meanwhile, she is working for a labor fee to get extra income to support her living condition. These businesses have been with her for 2 years. she can earn only about 6 USD per day and be able to save around 3 USD each day after expenses.

This is the first time for Sary to ask for a loan with VisionFund. Through this loan, she is going to use it to buy seed and fertilizer to increase her crop yield and the remaining money will be spending on buying pigs and chicken for raising to support her business. She hopes that this first loan will help her to get more income to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to increase her crop yield so that she can earn more income to save for future need.

loans.name: Felipa Amada

texts.es:
La vocación por ser parte del crecimiento cognitivo de los niños, la tiene Felipa, una mujer luchadora de 46 años de edad, quien desde hace diez años es docente de primaria, aventurándose a un mundo donde el aprendizaje es el principal protagonista. Por otro lado, ella posee su propia pulpería y cuenta con el apoyo de sus tres hijos y de su esposo, quien ofrece el servicio de mototaxi en su pueblo.
Felipa es una mujer que durante muchos años, se despertaba todos los domingos con el objetivo de obtener su licenciatura en Español. Si bien su edad, trabajo y familia le toman mucho tiempo, ella ha ido poco a poco profesionalizando, por esta razón ella no duda en invertir en ella misma y solicita un préstamo para pagar su título, lo que le permitirá en convertirse oficialmente en licenciada. Esto también trae consigo mejores oportunidades laborales. En sus planes está especializarse en otra rama de la educación.
texts.en:
Being a part of children's cognitive development is Felipa's vocation. She's a hardworking 46 year old woman who has been an elementary school teacher for ten years, venturing into a world where learning is the central element. On the other hand she has her own grocery store and has the support of her three kids and husband, who provides motor taxi services in town.

Felipa is a woman who, for many years, woke up every Sunday with the goal of obtaining a degree in Spanish. Although her age, her job and her family have made this process a lengthy one, little by little she has worked toward a professional degree. For this reason she doesn't hesitate in investing in herself and is applying for a loan to pay for her degree, which will allow her to officially become a professional. This will also bring her better job opportunities. One of her plans is to specialize in another branch of education.

loans.use: To pay for a degree.

loans.name: Miller

texts.en: Miller is a 23-year-old man and a father of two children ages three and two years old. He is from Carles, Iloilo and works hard as a fisherman to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. Her wife stays at home and takes good care of their children. Thus, Miller is requesting a loan for boat repair to continue his livelihood. In the future, he dreams to expand her business for sustainability.

loans.use: for boat repair

loans.name: Teresa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Teresa en una mujer muy trabajadora se dedica a la siembra de maiz y al engorde de cerdos para luego vender los es un muy buen negocios, el dinero solicita para la compra de fertilizantes, semillas y abonos ademas necesita dinero para la compra de balanceados para engordar a los cerditos.

Teresa tien 36 años no tiene hijos el sueño de ella es tener salud para seguir trabajando en el campo puesto que le encanta en los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar musica folklorica y bailar.
texts.en:
Teresa is a very hard-working woman who works growing corn and fattens pigs to later sell them. It is a good business. The money she is requesting is to buy fertilizer, seeds, manure and balanced feeds to fatten her pigs.

Teresa is 36 years old and has no children. Her dream is to remain healthy so she can continue to work in the fields as she loves it. In her free time she likes to listen to folk music and dance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, manure and balanced feeds.

loans.name: Ekomefeemo 1 Group

texts.en:
The community group, Ekomefeemo 1, will begin its seventh loan cycle with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch as part of their loan business with the community. It includes six members and is represented by Grace. The businesses of the community group members, which help them get ahead, are varied: fish, dresses, mobile, clothes, groceries, foodstuffs, beans, frying plantains, secondhand clothing and school bags.

The loan will benefit small-business owners including group member Grace. She indicated that this is the seventh time that she has involved ID-Ghana, joining as a result of an invitation from the institution’s massive promotion in the area. Currently, she has a neighborhood fish business. She learned this business several years ago on her own, as she had little savings and decided to start this business. As time went on, she added cutlery sets to increase her profit margins.

The loan is for raising capital through the purchase of cutlery sets, firewood, and fish, which she will smoke and sell to her customers through trekking. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is married with two children. When asked why she likes ID-Ghana, Grace replied that she likes the training and the life insurance the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase cutlery sets, firewood, and fish, which she will smoke and sell to her customers through trekking.

loans.name: Jhoselynne Geraldine

texts.es: Jhoselynne es una joven universitaria de 20 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el quinto ciclo de su carrera de Enfermería. Ella decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le gusta mucho cuidar de las personas. Además de ser una joven muy aplicada en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar voley con sus amigas. Para obtener algún ingreso trabaja esporadicamente como vendedora de verduras. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. Ya se encuentra a dos años y medio de terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecida con los socios de Kiva por ayudarle a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Jhoselynne is a young, 20 year old university student.  She is currently in the fifth cycle of her nursing degree program.  She chose nursing because she really likes to take care of people.

In addition to being a very focused student, she likes to go out to play volleyball with her friends in her free time.  In order to bring in a bit of income, she works sporadically selling fruit.

She seeks this loan in order to pay her university fees.  She has just two and a half years left to finish her degree.  She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support in helping her reach her goals.
