loans.use: To pay her university fees.

loans.name: Canan

texts.en:
Canan is 33 years old and has one child.

She sells the cleaning products of Farmasi and Ersağ. She started this business with the support of her mother. First she used the products for her child and herself, and later on she sold them to her relatives and neighbours and started to earn money.

This is her third loan from Maya. She wants her child to have a good future.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Canan hanım, 33 yaşında ve bir çocuk annesi. Farmasi ve Ersağ (temizlik malzemesi) ürünlerinin satışını yapıyor. Bu işe annesini desteği ile girdi. Ürünleri önce kendisi ve çocuğu için kullandı. Daha sonra ailesine ve yakın çevresine satışlar yaparak kar elde etmeye başladı. MAYA’dan 3’üncü kredisini kullanan Canan Hanım çocuğuna iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel se dedica a la agricultura por mas de 20 años es una herencia de su abuelo, israel siembra maiz el dinero necesita para la compra de insumos como fertilizantes, abonos, y quimicos para el cuidado de la siembra.

Israel es un hombre divorsiado tiene 3 hijos pero por cosas de leyes no viven con el, el sueño de el es poder compartir los ultimos dias de su vida con los hijos que tanto extraña. Lo que hace en los tiempos libres es leer el periodico.
texts.en:
Israel has worked in agriculture for more than 20 years. It is an inheritance from his grandfather. Israel grows corn. He needs the money to buy inputs like fertilizer, manure and chemicals to maintain his crops.

Israel is divorced. He has three children but because of legal reasons he does not live with them. His dream is to be able to share the last days of his life with them as he misses them so much. He likes to read the newspaper in his free time.

loans.use: fertilizer, manure and chemicals to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Wilmar

texts.en:
Wilmar is a 28-year-old man from Carles, Iloilo. He is married with three children, ages 5, 4 and 2 years old. He is running a sari-sari store business to earn a living. He has been doing this for seven years.

He is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as bottled juice, bottled water, candies, chips, biscuits, soft drinks and chocolate bars. In the future, he wants to expand his business to uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy bottled juice, bottled water, candies, chips, biscuits, soft drinks and chocolate bars.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Pov makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is in her late 40’s and is married. She has five children who are still at school. She has been selling fish for 10 years now. She works from 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Angelina's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.

She used the previous loans to keep increasing on the small dry fish called Dagga, and has successfully paid back all her loans. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profits to repay the loan, took care of her kids, reinvested in her business and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to increase on the small dry fish stock. She dreams of expanding the fish business. Angelina will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase on the small dry fish stock.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 53 years old, single, and has one child. Letecia is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Letecia has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jiban Joti Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Jhuna, 43, is a humble, differently abled lady standing on the right hand side in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is a blessed mother of two beautiful daughters and wife of a mason.

Jhuna owns a food stall in her locality where she sells tasty and healthy snack items. She has a good name in her community for the delicious food she offers to her customers. However, her food stall needs serious repair as the rooftop of her food stall has deteriorated due to long years of wear and tear.

Therefore, Jhuna, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to renovate her food stall so that she can continue to serve her customers in an efficient manner.

Jhuna aspires to build a house for her family where they can live happily without paying rent.

loans.use: to renovate her food stall.

loans.name: Sokina

texts.ru:
Сокина трудолюбивая женщина 49 лет. Она замужем и  имеет четырех детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Сокина мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Сокину выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома, Сокина никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Сокина вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Сокина выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Сокина получает хороший доход. Муж Сокины также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Сокина с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Сокина заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en: Sokina is a hard-working 49 year old woman. She is married, has four children, and lives in a small rural town. Since childhood Sokina dreamed of being a teacher, but her family's lack of financial resources kept her from attending college. Instead Sokina married right after finishing high school and became a housewife. Even being at home all the time though, Sokina stays busy. She and her husband try to do everything they can to provide their children with everything they need. To earn a consistent income for the family Sokina and her husband began their own business in animal husbandry. Sonia raises livestock, then sells their meat and milk, which earns her a good income. Sokina's husband also works in a local workshop, which earns additional income for the family. Their mutual income is enough for an average livelihood, but but still isn't sufficient to cover all their needs. Now Sokina and her husband would like to buy a few more head of livestock for fattening, so they contacted Arvand, wanting to obtain a loan to purchase the animals. Sokina thanks Arvand in advance for the support, which will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cattle

loans.name: Bircan

texts.en:
Bircan is 38 years old and lives with her mother. She started making jewelry as a hobby but in time turned it into a business. First she sold her work to her neighbors, but later on she began to sell to stores in bulk. With the help of her second loan from MAYA she is planning to buy bulk of materials for her jewelry making.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Bircan Hanım 38 yaşında ve annesiyle birlikte yaşıyor. Hobi olarak başladığı takı tasarım işini kendisi için bir ek gelire çevirmiş. Yaptığı takıları önce çevresine satmaya başlamış daha sonra mağazalara toplu olarak satarak işini geliştirmiş. Maya dan 2. kredisini kullanan Bircan Hanım kredileri ile toplu takı malzemesi alacak.

loans.use: to buy materials for jewelry making.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 46 years old and married with four children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Cristy is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies.

Cristy has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 39 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

May has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnet, bamboo and other materials for her business.

May has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishnet, bamboo and other materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dolores is 46 years old, and three of her children are presently in school.

Dolores has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishnet and gasoline for her boat, and to pay for maintenance for her business.

Dolores has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishnet and gasoline for her boat, and to pay for maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Omukwenda

texts.en:
Omukwenda is a married man, aged 58, and he has three children. He is a resident of Kihereza Muhororo. His major source of income is agriculture, but he also has rentals, which provide him extra income.

He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to complete the construction of his rentals in order to generate more income. His dream for the future is to improve his household's living standards and educate all of his children.

loans.use: to complete construction of his rentals.

loans.name: Jiban Joti Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Rup, 41, is the lady standing in a red saree to the right hand side in the photograph. She is a widow and has one son in her care. Life was never easy for her after her husband passed away. She had to struggle really very hard in order to earn her living and fulfill the necessities of her son.

Rup is a farmer by profession. She cultivates wheat and paddy on her farmland and enjoys a contented life with her son. The major problem she faces is that of pests and insects, because of which she is having a lower level of output than the desired output.

Rup, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase insect-and-pest-resistant seeds and organic fertilizers so as to have a voluminous and qualitative output, which will fetch her a higher price and enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase insect-and-pest-resistant seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
Leona is 47 years old, married and has eight children, three still in school.

Leona is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Leona requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Leona has been fattening pigs for four years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Betül

texts.en:
Betül is married and is a university graduate.  She could not find a job so she started selling Tupperware with advice from her mother-in-law just to earn her pocket money. She organized Tupperware meetings with women and easily sold the products.  This year she is starting her new job as a teacher but she says that she will continue selling Tupperware.  With the help of her third loan she is planning to buy more products and increase her sales.  Her wish is to have a good future. 


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Betül hanım evli.  Üniversite mezunu.  Hemen iş bulamayınca kayınvalidesinin önerisiyle Tupperware işine harçlıksız kalmamak ve ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için yeni  başlamış.  Kadınlar arasında Tupperware günü  kurarak kadınların rahat ürün almalarını sağlamış.  Bu şekilde kendisi de daha rahat satış yapabiliyor.  Bu sene öğretmenliğe başlayacağını ama bu işini bırakmayarak devam ettireceğini söyledi.  Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile mal alıp satışını arttıracak.  Güzel bir gelecek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware products

loans.name: Rahime

texts.en:
Rahime is 27 years old, married and a mother of two.  In order  to make a contribution to the family budget and support her husband, she makes wedding candies for weddings and henna nights (which is a party given to the bride's friends before the wedding where guests henna their fingers) for the bride.  

With the help of this second loan from MAYA, Rahime is planning to open a wedding candy store.

loans.use: to buy materials to make wedding candies

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie is a 45-year-old married mother of five children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Emilie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Emilie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like a fishing net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Emilie has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like a fishing net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tajiri Village. Peter joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Peter suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Peter will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicide and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Peter now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Umar

texts.en: Umar is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tajiri Village. Umar joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Umar will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicide and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Umar now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: La Manzana Group

texts.es: Grupo la manzana, por segunda vez están solicitando crédito a los miembros de KIVA, para seguir ampliando sus negocios, coordinado por María Cristina, de 35 años, soltera, con un hijo de 11 años, ella es estilista domiciliar. El crédito que solicita lo requiere para comprar materiales de belleza como pintura de uña, secadora, gorro para tinte de cabellos y cosméticos. Los demás socios son Fátima, quien vende joyas y ropa desde hace 2 años; y José de 48 años quien tiene una pulpería en su hogar.
texts.en:
For the second time the 'La Manzana' group is requesting a loan from the members of Kiva to continue to expand their businesses. It is coordinated by María Cristina who is 35 years old, single and has an 11 year old son. She is a home based stylist. She needs the loan she is requesting to buy beauty supplies like nail polish, a dryer, hair dyeing caps and cosmetics.

The other members are: Fátima who has been selling jewellery and clothing for two years and José who is 48 and has a grocery store in his house.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, a dryer, hair dyeing caps and cosmetics.

loans.name: Bahriye

texts.en:
Bahriye is married and a mother of three. She makes jewelry, tiaras and wristbands. As well as making individual or wholesale, she also makes sales at stands. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bulk material for her jewelry, make good sales and improve her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Bahriye hanım evli üç çocuk annesi. Evde takı, taç ve bileklik yapıyor. Toptan ve perakende olarak satışının yanı sıra stantta da ta satış yapıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile takı malzemelerini toptan alarak ve üreterek satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy material for jewelry.

loans.name: Iro

texts.en:
Iro is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gangarida Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Iro suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Iro has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 60 bags of maize this year, Iro can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ermelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store. Ermelinda is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Ermelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell from her store.

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
Rolinda is 56 years old and married with five children. Rolinda works very hard to provide for her family.

Rolinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread and personal care products.

Rolinda has been in this business for seven years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread and personal care products

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 60-year-old married mother of six children, one still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elsa has a food production business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Elsa has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Safiye

texts.en:
Safiye is 41 years old, married and a mother of two.  After retirement, she opened a florist shop both as a hobby and as an additional income source.  She designs her flowers according to her customers' needs.  With the help of her second loan from Maya, she is planning to buy flowers in bulk.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Safiye Hanım 41 yaşında evli ve 2 çocuk annesi.  Eşi emekli olduktan sonra hem ek gelir amaçlı hem de hobi olarak bir çiçekçi dükkanı açmış.  Safiye hanım çiçekleri müşterilerinin isteklerine göre tasarlıyor.  Maya dan 2. kredisini kullanan Safiye Hanım kredileri ile toptan çiçek alacak.

loans.use: to buy flowers in bulk.

loans.name: Danyaro

texts.en: Danyaro is a Babban Gona farmer from Badamasi Village. he joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Danyaro no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Danyaro has ambitious plans to harvest 12 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Danyaro now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Philibus

texts.en:
Philibus is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tsanyawa Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Philibus suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to improve his farming skills. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Philibus now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Usama

texts.en: Usama is a Babban Gona farmer from Liman Vilage. Usama joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Usama will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seed. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian small-holder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Usama would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Al Ekhlas Group

texts.en:
Ahlam is the featured borrower of Al Ekhlas group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they work hard to develop their living.

Ahlam is the lady at the center of the picture. She is a 50 year-old divorced lady, who has run her bakery for fifteen years, after working as a nurse and deciding to create her own business.

Her acquired income is barely enough to cover her living needs. Thus, a requested loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, will be invested in paying for necessary medical expenses she has to do.

As for the other group members, Rasha is the lady at the left side of the picture with a grey top, while Majida is the lady at the right side.

loans.use: To pay for necessary medical expenses

loans.name: Marziya

texts.en: Marziya is an honest person. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1950. She is a widow and has three children. She has been a business lady for almost 20 years. She trades souvenirs and gifts at a central mall. She is not young, but is still working to feed her family. As she has become older she has developed health problems. She appealed to IMON to get a loan to receive treatment in the hospital. She needs Kiva lenders’ compassion and support. Unfortunately she has no money so the loan will help her to be healed and continue her work.

loans.use: to receive treatment and continue her work

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is a hardworking woman who was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1980. She is married and has two young children. Her husband is a taxi driver and she is a tailor. She sews traditional women's dresses at home. She has permanent clients every day.

After the birth of her child, she and her daughter had health problems. The health condition worsened, and she appealed to IMON to get a loan to be treated at a hospital with her daughter. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and support.

loans.use: to be treated at a hospital with her daughter

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 53-year-old married woman with six children; one child is still in school. Marilyn is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old and married. She has two children who are still in school. Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, bread, coffee, milk, drinks, spices, noodles, snack food and other personal care products.

Gemma has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, bread, coffee, milk, drinks, spices, noodles, snack food and other personal care products.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. Melinda is married and has one child. She has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Melinda requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Melinda has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Yunusa

texts.en: Yunusa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Liman Village. Yunusa joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yunusa will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicide and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yunusa now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better home for his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Alyasau

texts.en: Alyasau is a Babban Gona farmer from Liman Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Alyasau no longer has to worry about having adequate income to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase him increase his income considerably.  This season Alyasau has ambitious plans to harvest 30 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alyasau now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.en:
Zebonisso is a cheerful woman. She was born in a southern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is not married and has two children. She is working at a mobile networking company. She has more than seven years of work experience. She is a head of a department. She manages sales and service of network places. She likes her job and can ensure her family with earned money.

Upset, she is sick now and needs to get a course of treatment. She has to be recovered in order to work and live better. She appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking financial support to pay for her treatment at hospital. She awaits your kindness and support. A Kiva loan will help her to be healed at the medical clinic.

loans.use: to pay for her treatment at hospital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tires and helmets for his customers' protection as well as his

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 28 years old and married and supports four members of the family. He runs a retail shop business as well as a motorcycle service. His monthly income is KSH 18,000.

He is borrowing loan of KSH 109,852 to buy a new motorcycle for transportation. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya.

He would use the profit to repay the loan and pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have wholesale and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transportation,

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is married and has seven children, all attending school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has owned a food stall business serving neighbors and town dwellers. Najma faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients, hence perishable goods leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Florence mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Florence dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, maize  and french beans for resale. She decided to join yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, maize  and french beans for resale

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine's husband was deceased and she is living with her daughter. She is knitting babywear, such as sweaters, vests and socks. She sells them on stands and makes contributions to the family budget. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bulks of threads and accessories, make more babywear, sell them and gain money to improve her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Emine hanım eşi vefat etmiş kızı ile beraber yaşıyor. Emine hanım örgüden bebek ürünleri hırka, yelek ve patik üreterek stant da satarak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. Kullandığı mikro kredi ile örgü ipi ve aksesuarları alarak bebek ürünleri üreterek satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy threads and accessories

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with seven children, five of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past six years, she has operated a mat weaving business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials for her mat making business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials for her mat making business.

loans.name: Ekomefeemo 2 Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 56 years old and has been with Ekomefeemo 2 Group for several years. She is the group representative because of her wealth of experience in being a good client. She is married with one dependent child. 

Ekomefeemo 2 Group needs a total loan of GHS 4,900. Sarah's share of GHS I,700 will be used to purchase additional fish, corn paste, firewood and oil to prepare kenkey (fermented corn dough) and fried fish to sell to customers.

Sarah trades in kenkey and fried fish on the pavement close to the roadside in Teshie. Her business, which has been in existence for over 12 years, is the main source of her livelihood and that of her family; and also supports her child’s education. Her business is open Monday through Saturday every week from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sarah is a hard-working woman. Sarah is in the middle of the group picture.

In the future, Sarah plans to support her child to acquire a university education. She hopes that one day she will become a renowned businesswoman.

She is very appreciative to anyone who can help. She thanks you for supporting her group.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish, corn paste, firewood, oil to prepare kenkey (fermented corn dough) and fried fish.

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es:
Miguel es el coordinador del Grupo ¨Rayito de sol¨, este grupo esta por 5ta ves solicitando crédito para poder crecer económicamente. A sus 32 años se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 3 años, gracias a los financiamientos de ADIM. Su compañera lo ayuda en el negocio, y sus dos hijos son su motor de vida. Ahora con el crédito invertirá en la compra de camisas, pantalones, blumers, brazzieres y talladores. 
Los otros integrantes son Maria Magdalena, de 35 años, quien posee una carpintería desde hace 8 años y elaboran camas matrimoniales u otros muebles. Edda, de 27 años, tiene su taller de costura en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Miguel is the coordinator of the "Rayito de Sol" group. This group is seeking a loan for the 5th time, in order to grow economically. He is 32 years old, and began to sell new clothes 3 years ago, thanks to financing from ADIM. His life partner helps him with the business, and their two children are his reason for living.

With this loan he will invest in the purchase of shirts, pants, briefs, bras and shape wear. The other group members are: Maria Magdalena, who is 35 years old, and for the past 8 years has had a carpentry business in which she makes double beds and other furniture; and Edda, who is 27 years old and has a sewing shop in her home.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, briefs, bras and shapewear.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 38 years old and married with seven children. He runs a business of motorcycle transport services. He has been in this business for the last 10 years. His monthly income is KES 20,000. He is borrowing KES 113,520  to buy a motorcycle for transporting goods. He would use his anticipated profit to repay the loan and buy spare parts for the motorcycle. His hopes and dreams are to buy another motorcycle and educate his children to a higher level.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transporting goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shaving machines and charts showing new designs of hair cuts

loans.name: Rabbeca

texts.en:
Rabbeca is 47 years old. She is widowed and has three children. She operates two businesses - selling new clothes and running a green grocery kiosk for fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for five years. She earns a monthly income of 33,000 KES.

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, kales and onions, bananas and mangoes. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children and provide food and medical care for the family. Her hopes and dreams are to be stable and healthy and expand her business to become a wholesaler of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy stock of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, kales and onions, bananas and mangoes.

loans.name: Pretty

texts.en:
Pretty is 44 years old, married and has six children. She is in the agricultural business of raising goats in the Philippines. 

Pretty requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and additional goats to raise. Pretty has been raising goats for 14 years now. She has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF, in order to sustain this activity.

She would like to build and expand her business, in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional goats to raise.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah used the previous loan to buy beads and decorative cloth for her business. She has a craft business, a decorating service for parties, and she hires out traditional items for an additional income.

Her business is located in the busy street of Fort Portal town, which has enabled her to sell more and become very marketable. With the proceeds from the business, she was able to repay the loan, look after her family, and pay rent for her business premises.

Sarah is looking forward to expanding her business to new areas and becoming a distributor in the area. She has has asked for another loan to buy crafts and traditional items to sell.

loans.use: to buy crafts and traditional items to sell.

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a married woman and owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Nzadze has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are men and women. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge in her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is a married woman with four school-aged children. She has a owns house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a motorcycle transportation business from door to door. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

She will use 20,000 KES to purchase spare parts and a new motorcycle for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Ana Bernardina

texts.es:
Ana Bernardina es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad, con una linda familia que vive en una comunidad de Santo Tomas La Unión.
Ana Bernardina es una mujer que día con día se esmera para darle a su familia lo necesario, pues con mucho sacrificio a su familia ha logrado sacar adelante, aparte de realizar oficios domésticos también se dedica a la venta de panes de casa en casa. A Dios gracias con el préstamo que obtuvo logro realizar la remodelación de su casa, que ahora ya cuenta con otro aspecto y mucho más cómodo, con este cambio ha favorecido a su familia. Pero ella nuevamente necesita de un préstamo para la construcción de su casa y lo hace con el afán de que sus hijos estén mejor. Con el préstamo comprara materiales como: cemento, cal, arena y block.
El gran sueño de Ana Bernardina es terminar la construcción de su casa para instalar una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Ana Bernardina is 44 year old mother of a beautiful family that lives in the community of Santo Tomas La Unión.

Ana Bernardina is a woman who day by day does her best to provide her family what it needs and with much sacrifice has manged to get her family ahead. Besides doing domestic work she also sells bread from house to house. With the loan she got, she managed, thanks to God, to remodel her house. And now it has a different appearance and is much more comfortable so this change has been good for her family.

But she once again needs a loan for the construction on her house which she is doing out of the desire for her children to live better. With the loan she will buy materials like cement, lime, sand and cinder blocks.

Ana Bernardina's big dream is to finish the construction of her house and install a grocery store in it.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Clark Group

texts.en:
This is the Clark Group which consists of three hard-working Filipino ladies who decided to leave their hometown and come to work as housekeepers in Lebanon to provide their family with a better income and living conditions.

Perlita, pictured in the center of the photo, is the featured borrower who joined with other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. They became close friends after they arrived in Lebanon and are working hard to make a living.

Perlita is a 51-year-old married mother of three children. Her limited monthly income is barely enough to cover her family's increasing living expenses. For this reason, the group acquired a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for Perlita's children's school tuition. She hopes she can remain capable of providing her children with a better education for a brighter future.

As for the other group members, Sharon is on the left while Jaciel is on the right.

loans.use: To pay for her children school tuition fees

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as ambitious; she operates a restaurant.

She needs adequate clean water and will use 60,000 KES to buy a water storage facility to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility to store clean water

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married and the mother of two children who earns a living by selling cassava flour. The main challenge she faces is late payments from customers, which affects her sales. She also farms to supplement her income. Rose would like to expand her cassava-flour business but is limited by inadequate capital. She has requested this loan to meet customer needs by buying more cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Nsuura 1 Savings And Credit Group

texts.en:
Alfred has 4 children and they live in Fort Portal Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy maize and cassava flour to sell. He has a produce business and sells timber for additional income.

Group members have various businesses which have enabled them to support their families and develop their businesses. This is a trustworthy group which started with a few members but now the number has increased due to admiration from other community members who have seen them succeed. The group is grateful for the support from Kiva.

Alfred intends to use the loan to buy garlic and coffee to sell. He is a member of Nsuura 1 Savings and Credit group. The members guarantee each other in order to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy garlic and coffee to sell

loans.name: Luvumo

texts.en:
Luvumo is a married woman with four school-aged children. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a business to buy and sell livestocks at the market. She is challenged by seasonal demands and the high cost of transportation.


With the loan, that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu access to loan and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows.

loans.name: Rapheal

texts.en: Rapheal is a married man with a child, they live in Kasese-Uganda. He operates a retail shop and a clinic business. He is a honest man  who can be trusted  to repay the loan. He wants to build a house for his family and reduce  rental costs.  He will use the loan to buy construction stones, metals, and bricks for building.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like stones, metals, and bricks.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is married and has seven children, all attending school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has owned a food stall business selling to neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the  number of clients, hence perishable goods leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Mesalimu wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

She faces a major challenge of creditors taking long to repay for goods taken on credit. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a farmer who mainly grows bananas and coffee in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has also raised  cattle since 2006 to supplement on his income and improve his life. He wants to be a modern commercial farmer but inadequate capital and bad weather, especially drought, have hindered his plans. Alfred is requesting a loan to buy manure and seedlings to plant this season.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings to plant this season.

loans.name: Chan Doeurn's Group

texts.en:
Chan Doeurn is a 41-year-old farmer, who lives in Kampong Cham province. She has four children, two of whom are in school. She and her husband have been growing rice for 23 years. To supplement her income, she sells some grocery items in her community. The businesses earn the family about 42,200KHR a day, used to support the family’s needs. She currently can sell her rice at lower price in market, which is the main obstacle to the business. 

Chan Doeurn, the leader of the group of two, will spend her loan on purchasing rice seed, organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to increase productivity. She hopes the use of organic fertilizer will improve the farm, so that she can afford to improve their standard of living. This is the second time that she requests a loan from VisionFund.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to increase productivity and earn more income to support her children's studies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jiban Joti Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Manik, 30, is a differently abled lady standing to the right in a black saree. She hails from a humble background of Koraput district, Odisha, India. She owns and manages a ladies' novelty corner in her house, where she sells cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, bangles, and other fashion accessories.

She wants to enhance her business by adding more stock of what she sells. She says that adding different designs and brands of products will improve her earnings and her family's status.

Manik, along with her group member, has requested a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, bangles, and other fashion accessories for her ladies' novelty corner.

She dreams of educating her children and saving some money to make her future secure.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, bangles, and other fashion accessories for her ladies' novelty corner.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en: Zachary is a single man who describes himself as prayerful. He operates a transport business and serves customers using a motorcycle. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He has requested a Kes 60,000 loan to buy his own motorcycle. His goals are to own a minibus within five years and buy land in the future. This is his second loan from SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is a 33-year-old married woman. In 2013, Fatmata established her provisions, cement, and drinks business. She began her business with the hope of getting a permanent source of income to provide a livelihood and support her family. She works 6 days a week and 10 hours a day to earn 1,000,000 SLL every month.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 to purchase 150 bags of cement, dozens of sardines, milk, and soft drinks. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit and develop her business.

In the future, Fatmata plans to purchase two plots of land around the Waterloo highway. She is hard working and committed; she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase  100 bags of cement, milk, sardines, and milk.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as generous. She operates a retail business to sell tomatoes, onions, bananas and other vegetables. She will use 20,000 KES to buy a water storage facility to store clean water for domestic use.. She hopes that in the future to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.en:
Fabiano is a hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more cattle for fattening. His main business is still cattle grazing and fattening along with farming, where he earns a living. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children.

He has hardships of inadequate capital to expand his business and seasonal changes, especially drought. Fabiano is requesting a loan to buy more cows to add on his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add in his farm.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married, and has three kids who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past three years, she has operated a motorcycle transport business from door-to-door. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to add with her savings to purchase another motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to add with her savings to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is asking for a loan facility. He will use the loan to buy more goats for rearing in his farm. He is a farmer who grazes both cows and goats, alongside crop farming. These activities have helped him earn income and save on food expenses for his family. He plans to educate his children, open up a butcher shop to sell goat meat, and expand his goat-buying-and-selling business, but his capital is little and the prices of goats have increased.

loans.use: to buy more goats for rearing in his farm.

loans.name: Shavleg

texts.en:
Shavleg is a 26-year-old man from Kharagauli district. He lives with his parents and pensioner grandmother. The family is involved in agricultural, they have a cow, 2 calves and 2 pigs. They also grow maize and haricot.

Shavleg and his family work hard to insure a good harvest and sell locally. Shavleg decided to start a new business to provide a stable income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan. He will purchase a minibus to transport people and generate a stable income.

Shavleg hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus.

loans.name: Fatos

texts.en: Fatos wants to thank all of his lenders for a previous loan. He was able to use that loan to pay for water irrigation and wells so he could plant fruit. He is very happy with his business and its success so far and hopes to continue to do well in the future. He is now requesting a second loan to pay to repair his fruit stand. He is very excited by this loan, and is grateful for the opportunity these loans give him to continue to improve his business.

loans.use: to repair his fruit stand.

loans.name: Kheurn's Group

texts.en:
Kheurn, 46, is living in a house made of wood and covered by clay roof tiles, located in Kampong Cham province. She is married with a daughter. She, along with her husband, have been growing rice and cassava as their main source of income for years. As well, Kheurn occasionally works for others for a fee. The problem that this smallholder farmer faces is her crops are being destroyed by pests. 

She is now leading a five-member group to apply for a loan from VisionFund, in order to save the farming business. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and pesticide, in order to help boost crop productivity. She hopes that the farming business will grow bigger and will earn her family a better income, to meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer, which will boost crop productivity and allow her to earn more income and save for future needs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Amonullo

texts.ru:
Амонулло перспективный 32-летний молодой человек. Он женат и  имеет 2-их детей. У него свой бизнес. На центральном рынке Истаравшана у него есть магазин по продаже детской одежды. Он привозит  товар из Худжанда и продает в своем магазине.  Постепенно он  расширил ассортимент своего товара и создал свою клиентскую базу. В бизнесе его поддерживает его семья. У него среднее образование. Теперь когда дела идут хорошо, он решил расширить еще больше свой бизнес. 
В данное время Амонулло хочет   отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у него недостаточно. Для этого Амонулло обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Amonullo is a promising young 32-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He has his own business. He has a store at the central market in Istaravshan selling children's clothing. He buys in goods from Khujand and sells them in his store. He gradually expanded his range of goods and created a client base. His family supports him in his business. He has a secondary education. Now that things are going well, he has decided to expand his business even further.

At the present time Amonullo wants to renovate the house where they live in order to improve living conditions, but he does not have sufficient funds. Amonullo has applied to Arvand for this, and wants to receive a loan to buy construction materials to renovate his house. He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate his house.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 37-year-old, married mother of two children. She requests a loan to pay for her children's tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation, and fees, for students from low-income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Mona hopes to continue to provide her children with the necessities for living, and to develop their living standard.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is grateful that she has, numerous times, received and promptly repaid all the past loans granted to her. It is important that she has regular funds to properly maintain her tricycle for safe and efficient service. Aside from her tricycle business she is also blessed with a small farm that helps cover her family's needs.

Marilyn trusts that she can now request a 50,000 PHP loan to pay for the regular maintenance of her tricycle. There are times that her unit will stop in the middle of the road due to its worn out tires. She will use the proceeds to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle. She will also use part of the loan to buy fertilizers for a productive harvest on her farm. Although her farm's sales are not always high, she maintains her faith that her sales will always recover in time. She is thanking God for your continuous support of her livelihood.

Marilyn's prayer is for God to bless their lives with abundance. She dreams of seeing her children become professionals someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories and the maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: jose de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz, frijol, yuca y tomates desde hace 15 años e inicio con capital propio, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia y asi poder continuar con su trabjo que le genera buenos ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
José, 39, lives in his own home with his four children.

He has earned a living for 15 years growing corn, beans, yuca, and tomatoes, having started with his own capital. With his earnings he's able to pay for some of the expenses that come up at home.

José is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, pest control, and other agricultural inputs to improve the plot of land that's shown in the photograph. That way he'll be able to continue with his work, which earns him a good income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, pest control, etc., to improve his plot of land

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Sarah. She is married and has two children, aged 8 and 4 years. She has three additional dependents, who live with her because of schooling. In 2008, Sarah established her clothing business. She began her business because she wants to be self-employed. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Sarah requires a loan in order to buy more clothing. In the future, Sarah still plans to establish other shops in different areas. She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Josephine. She is married and has four children, aged 20, 18, 15 and 8 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to take care of his education.

In 2012, Josephine established her provisions business. Her business is located in the outskirts, close to the main road. Her main customers are the general public. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about SLL1,000,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Josephine requires a loan in order to purchase more cartons of milk, sugar, Ovaltine, mayonnaise, etcetera, to resell. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her profit margin. In the future, Josephine plans to educate her two children and help other family members. The challenges she faces in her business are financial constraints and the cost of goods, which do increase in the market due to inflation. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of milk, sugar, Ovaltine, mayonnaise, etcetera.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth used the previous loan to finish paying for a vehicle. She owns rentals and a taxi transport business for extra income. She has been in business for the last two years, having started with an aim of raising more income for her family. Her family dream is constructing a good permanent house. 

Being a hard working woman, Ruth is determined to take her business to greater levels by buying many vehicles, which will increase her income and her lifestyle at large, despite being challenged by bad roads that lead to constant mechanical breakdowns and the expense they cause her.

Ruth has asked for another loan to buy a second vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a second vehicle.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He owns rentals and also earns a salary from the local government.

He ventured into business in 2001 with a purpose of raising income for family support. He uses the proceeds from his business to repay the loan, feed his family, and top up his children's school fees.

He is faced with challenges of late payment of his salary and tenants who don't pay him on time. He has a dream of expanding his rentals and becoming a renowned landlord in his area, serving the university students who are in need of hostels for renting.

Fred needs a loan to pay school fees for his children ahead of the promotion term.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Diamant

texts.en: Diamant is 28 years old and single. He is very hardworking and as a hairdresser gained experience by working for a long time in various places. Now he has been able to open his own salon and is very proud of his business and what he has accomplished. He loves his work and he is usually very busy, especially in the summer when many people are visiting from other countries and request his services since prices are lower than in Western European countries.  Diamant is requesting a loan to replace some inventory. He has never had a chance to renovate his business and would like to buy new chairs and paint his salon. His goal is to be able to open another salon and hire people to work for him. He is very happy for the opportunity presented by this loan and wants to thank all of his lenders.

loans.use: to revise his inventory and replace some items.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with four children, three attend school. She lives in her own house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past eight years, she has operated a door-to-door mat weaving business. She faces a major challenge of seasonal demand.

She wants to purchase paints and sewing materials for her weaving business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: Sandra de 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y frijol se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 20 años y comercializa sus prodcutos en los pueblos aledaños, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder obtener buenas cosechas para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Sandra, 37, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her child.

She earns a living in agriculture growing corn and beans. She has been in this line of work for 20 years and she sells her crops in nearby communities. With her earnings she's able to cover some of her household expenses.

Sandra's requesting a loan to buy seeds, soil amendments, pest control, and so on. That way she can produce good crops and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, soil amendments, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Jospeter

texts.en:
Jospeter is 57 years old. He is married and blessed with five children. He has been practicing small scale farming for four years, earning an income of KES 17,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase maize seedlings to plant.

With the additional income, Jospeter will be able to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a good family and a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase maize seedlings to plant

loans.name: Afadjina

texts.fr: Divorcée, Afadina est une femme sans enfant. Afadina  est âgée de 46 ans et habite à Tokoin où elle prépare et vend de la pâte bandée faite à base du maïs appelée « Akpan ». Afadina  achète le nécessaire servant à la préparation cinq fois par mois au marché et vend sa marchandise à la devanture de son domicile. Afadina  sollicite ce crédit pour commander le sac de maïs afin de gagner plus de bénéfices en vue de subvenir à ses besoins et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Afadina is a divorced woman with no children. She is 46 and lives in Tokoin where she prepares and sells wrapped dough made of maize, called « Akpan ».

Afadina buys the necessary ingredients for the preparation of her dough five times a month at the market and sells her dough in front of her house. She is asking for this loan to order a sack of maize so as to make more profit to support herself and improve her day-to-day living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one sack of maize

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 36 years old and married. He has three children and two other dependents. He runs a welding business and farms. He has been in business for the past three years. His monthly income is KES 15,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 98,360. He will use it to buy a motorcycle for transporting goods. He would use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand the business and to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transporting goods.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has four children, aged 24, 19, 14 and 6 years. In 2014, Kadiatu established her timber or board leaves business. She began her business because she was trained by her parent and because of her low level of education. She decided to set up her own business to be self-reliant. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are the general community. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more timber or board leaves in large quantity in order to maximize profits. She hopes that this loan will support her to cater for more customers, which will expand as a result the business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to become an international businesswoman and build her own shop and open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more timber or board leaves in large quantity in order to maximize profits.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es: Ana Milena es una artesana que por tradición familiar se desempeña en esta labor hace 5 años y    generar ingresos adicionales para aportar a la economía familiar; ella elabora mochilas de fique  y relojes artesanales, productos que su señora madre le enseñó a diseñar y manifiesta que eligió este trabajo porque la relaja mucho y  desea mostrar su talento pues considera que la artesanía es un don especial, que es muy bueno que las demás personas conozcan, valoren y disfruten. Ella trabaja diariamente de 8:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. y comercializa sus productos a través de los comerciantes de la ciudad de Barranquilla que exponen sus artesanías en sus negocios. Actualmente  está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo recursos que invertirá en la compra de materias primas como fique, madera y tintas, para ampliar su producción y diversificar sus productos, con lo que espera un incremento en sus ventas y por lo tanto de sus utilidades. Su meta es fidelizar la clientela con buenos productos y servicios, para afianzar su negocio de tal manera que crezca lo suficiente para generar ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Milena is an artisan who, for 5 years, has been doing this work because of family tradition, and to make additional income to help support her family. She makes woven bags and artisanal clocks, which is something her mother taught her how to do. She chose this work because it relaxes her, and she wants to display her talent because she believes that craftwork is a special gift that others recognize, value and enjoy.

She works every day from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM and markets her products through vendors in Barranquilla who show her craftwork in their businesses. Her first Kiva loan is currently processing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She needs the resources to invest in raw materials like fique fibers, wood, and dyes so that she can increase her production and diversify her products. With this loan, she hopes to see a growth in sales and therefore in profits as well.

Her goal is to build a loyal clientele by offering good products and services. She wants to secure her business so that it can grow and generate the income she needs to improve her quality of life and remodel her home.

loans.use: invest in raw materials like fique fibers, wood and dyes.

loans.name: Christiana Y

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Christiana. She is married and has three children, aged 40, 37, and 18 years. In 2005, Christiana established her frozen fish business. She began her business to be self-reliant. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city, and her customers are the general community. Working six days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about SLL1,900,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Christiana requires a loan in order to buy 10 more cartons of frozen fish for her business. She hopes that this loan will support her to cater for more customers and that, as a result, the business will expand.

In the future, Christiana plans to be well-established and to build a house for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 10 more cartons of frozen fish for her business.

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa is 31 years old and a very dedicated mother. While her husband works in construction, she is involved in agriculture, raising her two cows and two calves. She is able to save on dairy products for her family with her work and is able to supplement their income from the dairy products she is able to sell in the market. She and her husband also own land that they use to harvest corn and wheat on.

At this time she is requesting a loan to be able to purchase some guano for the land and food for the cows. Her goal is to be able to generate enough income to expand her farm and increase the number of cows and their production. She would then be able to generate even more money to improve the living conditions of her family. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase some guano for the land and food for the cows.

loans.name: Josinter

texts.en:
Josinter is a married woman and she has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances to expand the business.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to own a hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a better life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Amewate

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Amewate est une veuve femme  âgée de 66 ans habitant à Tokoin. Amewate prépare et vend de la pâte bandée à la devanture de son domicile. Amewate s’approvisionne de son nécessaire six fois par mois au marché. Amewate désire accroitre son commerce et sollicite ce prêt pour commander le sac de maïs et du sucre afin de réaliser un bon revenu pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
The mother of three children, Amewate is a widow aged 66, living in Tokoin. Amewate prepares and sells wrapped dough in front of her house. She stocks up on the necessary ingredients six times a month at the market.

Amewate would like to grow her business and is asking for this loan to order a sack of maize and a sack of sugar so as to make a good income to help her children with their schooling.

loans.use: to buy one sack of maize and one sack of sugar

loans.name: Lolahon

texts.ru:
Лолахон доброжелательная и молодая женщина, ей 39 лет. Она замужем и у неё пятеро детей. Лолахон живет вместе со своей семьёй в городе Истаравшан. Она швея. Она покупает ткани на рынке, шьет национальные платья и продает их.   Всё что она зарабатывает, расходуется на содержание семьи. У неё нет возможности накопить денег для другие более перспективные цели. 
В данное время Лолахон вместе со своим мужем хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Лолахон обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Lolahon is a kind-hearted young woman. She is 39 years old. She is married and she has five children. Lolahon and her family live in the town of Istaravshan. She is a seamstress. She buys cloth at the market, sews national dresses, and sells them. Everything that she earns is spent on supporting the family. She is not able to save up for other long-term goals.

At the present time Lolahon and her husband want to renovate the house they live in to improve living conditions, but they do not have enough funds. For this Lolahon has applied to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy construction materials to renovate her house. She hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Kadijatu

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Kadijatu. She is married and has no children. In 2014, Kadijatu established her cosmetics and provisions business. She began her business to develop herself and be self-reliant. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are the general community. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Kadijatu requires a loan in order to buy razac lotion, cartons of Colgate, pure slain oil spray and pharmaderm cream to sell. She hopes that this loan will help her to cater for more customers, which will expand as a result of the business. In the future, Kadijatu plans to become an international businesswoman and wants build her shop and open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy razac lotion, cartons of Colgate, pure slain oil spray and pharmaderm cream to sell.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Isha. She is married and has 1 child, aged 8 years. In 2012, Isha established her grocery shop business. She began her business because she is not educated, and so she decided to engage in a business to educate and support her family. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are the general community. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Isha requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of milk, sardines, ovaltine and bundles of drinks to sell. She hopes that this loan will support her to cater for more customers, which will expand as a result of the business. In the future, Isha plans to use the profits she gets to establish a bigger shop. Isha will be very appreciative to anyone that can help.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of milk, sardines, ovaltine and bundles of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz, frijol y maicillo desde hace 30 años e inicio con capital propio, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante y con las ganancias que obtiene puede solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas entre otros y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in his own home with his three children.

He has worked for 30 years growing corn, beans, and sorghum, having started with his own capital. Thanks to his job he has been able to get ahead and cover some of his household expenses with his earnings.

Manuel is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, herbicide, and other supplies. That way he can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, herbicide, and other supplies

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 42 ans, Massan est femme habitant à Tokoin avec ses cinq enfants à charge. Massan produit et vend du jus fait avec du citron et du sucre. Massan s’approvisionne du nécessaire au marché et revend sa marchandise à la devanture de son domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Massan sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de citrons et du sucre afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
