A widow of 42, Massan lives in Tokoin and is responsible for raising five children. She makes and sells juice made with lemons and sugar. She stocks up on the necessary ingredients at the market and sells her juice in front of her house and in the neighboring districts.

Massan is asking for this loan to order some sacks of lemons and sugar so as to meet the demand of her clientele and have enough financial autonomy to help her children with their schooling.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of lemons and one sack of sugar

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 65-year-old Hawa. She is married and has four children, ages 48, 46, 43 and 38. She has three additional dependents, grandchildren who live with her for school assistance. In 2014, Hawa established her clothing and shoes business. She began her business because she was trained up in business by her parent and decided to establish her own business. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are the general community. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,900,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy wax cotton by the bale, clothes and footwear to increase the profit margin in order to expand the business. She hopes that this loan will help her to cater for more customers, which will expand as a result of the business. In the future, Hawa plans to complete building her shop, and help her children and grand children to be well educated. When she retires from active service they will step into her shoes. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy wax cotton by the bale, clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Egamurod

texts.ru: Эгамурод мужчина в возрасте 46 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. Он занимается скотоводством. Его родители тоже занимались скотоводством. Поэтому это занятие у него наследственное. С детство родители научили его как ухаживать за скотом, теперь он учит этим своих детей. У Эгамурода была стая коров, но когда ее дочка заболела и ей понадобилась операция он продал всех коров, оставил только три. Прошло несколько лет теперь ее дочка полностью здорова, помогает папе ухаживать за скотом. Они Всей семьей с любовью занимаются скотоводством, это у них как хобби. Так как коров мало, Эгамурод решил умножит количество голов скота, он хочет опять завести много коров. На это ему понадобились деньги и он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Заранее благодарен за поддержку!!!
texts.en: Egamurod is a 46-year-old man. He is married and has four children. He rears animals. His parents also reared animals, and so this is a hereditary activity. His parents taught him how to look after cattle since his childhood, and now he is teaching it to his own children. Egamurod had a herd of cattle, but when his daughter fell ill and she needed an operation he sold all of his cows, leaving only three. A few years have passed and now his daughter is fully recovered and helps her father to look after the cattle. All the family looks after the animals with love; it is like a hobby for them. Since he only has a few cows, Egamurod has decided to increase his herd of cattle, and he wants to have a lot of cows once again. He needs money for this, and he has applied to Arvand for a loan. He is grateful in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy some cattle.

loans.name: Samon Group

texts.en:
Samon is a 52-year-old married rice farmer with a dependent child who resides in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has cultivated rice and fattened cows since 1983. Her only child is a factory worker. Her husband is a 55-year-old rice farmer as well. The family can earn around $10 each day.

Samon, as group leader, would like to request a loan as a group of four members and she will use her portion to buy cows to breed for calves to sell. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy cows and earn more income when the cows are able to produce calves. In the future, Samon is going to buy more farmland, and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Savoeurn Group

texts.en: Savoeurn is a 34-year-old married rice farmer with four children, and she resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Two of her children attend school. Savoeurn is pictured 1st from the left and cultivated rice since 2001. Her husband is a 31-year-old rice farmer as well. Savoeurn and her husband can earn approximately 3 USD per day. Savoeurn, a group leader, would like to request a loan as part of a group of four members, and she will use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming in the dry season. This loan helps her to increase her income as well as her family's standard of living. In the future, Savoeurn hopes that she can do farming both in dry and rainy seasons more than two times per year, renovate for a proper house, and support her children to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming in the dry season.

loans.name: Mira Luna

texts.en: Mira Luna is from Estancia, Iloilo. She is married with seven children. Two of these are still school-aged children ages 16 and 10 years old. Mira Luna and her husband are engaged in a fishing business and seaweed farming to earn a living. They have been doing this for 20 years. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and additional capital for their seaweed farm in order to upturn their livelihood. In the future, she dreams of increasing their business so they can have enough money to send her two children to college. She dreams that they will finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and additional capital for her seaweed.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina La Esperanza, es un grupo unido   que se formó en la Ciudad de Santaní, integrado por 17 señoras independientes y emprendedoras, que quieren poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido.
Se destaca entre ellas la Sra. Lelia, por su laboriosidad, cuenta con una pequeña despensa en su propia casa donde ofrece todos los productos de las necesidades básicas del hogar. Tiene mucha clientela del barrio que siempre se acerca hasta su negocio.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, para que pueda continuar con sus ventas, luchando para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The bank called La Esperanza, formed in the city of Santaní, is a close group made up of 17 independent and enterprising women who want to be able to help their families by working together.

One of the members, Lelia, stands out for her industriousness. She has a small store in her own home where she sells all the basic household necessities. She has a lot of customers from the neighborhood who shop in her business.

Lelia's requesting this loan to buy a variety of supplies for her store so she can continue making sales and striving to help her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of supplies for the store

loans.name: Maren

texts.en: Maren is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 45,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially independent. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a married man and he has two children. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells cooking fat, sugar, flour, bread and other items. His primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy sugar, soda, cooking fat, flour and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soda, cooking fat, flour and other items.

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
Rizalyn is 27 years old and married with two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rizalyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rizalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Rizalyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rizalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married mother of three children, none of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, Julia has operated a clothes-selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, Julia wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married mother of five children, none of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past eight years, Mbeyu has operated a clothes-selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, Mbeyu wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 52 years old and married with nine children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Marilou has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. In the future Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maa Budhithakurani Shg-B Group

texts.en: Sabitri, 39, is an enterprising and hardworking lady from Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is the one standing on the left hand side in the photograph. She is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman with a strong desire for self-improvement. She is a small-business owner who manages her own businesses, which include a cosmetics business and a grocery store where she sells products for daily use, such as basic grains, soap, detergents, soda, ice, bread, eggs, and frozen goods, among other items. Her merchandise is of high quality and affordable for her customers. She buys her merchandise from markets and distributors in the region. She has loyal customers as well as irregular customers. She started her business with her savings from her previous work. She started with a small window and little by little she invested until she has a well-stocked store. She starts her day very early, opening the doors to her business and tending to her customers. One of her dreams is to expand her business so that she can increase her profits and make some repairs in her home. For these reasons, Sabitri along with her group member, is seeking a loan of 30,000 INR to invest in working capital for her businesses by purchasing basic goods such as rice, beans, cosmetics, snacks, etc. By increasing the size of her business, she can purchase products at better prices, stock her store better with the products that are in highest demand, and in so doing, increase her income and offer her customers better prices.

loans.use: to purchase basic goods such as rice, beans, cosmetics, and snacks

loans.name: Maa Budhithakurani Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Daimati, 23, is the differently abled lady standing in a blue saree on the left hand side of the photograph. She lives in a small village in Koraput district of Odisha state, India. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a self-employed bicycle mechanic who sells bicycle spare parts and installs them. Daimati has been a tailor since 2009 and has managed to survive off the tailoring business since then. She specializes mostly in ladies dresses such as blouses and salwar-kurta. She has been helping her husband with household obligations.

Before coming to People’s Forum, business for her was slow. This was because she did not have enough capital to buy materials to meet the demands. She also lacked business management skills that she obtained from the training offered at People’s Forum.

Daimati, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase an industrial sewing machine for her business, and this will enable her to achieve better efficiency and effectiveness. With the Kiva loan, she hopes to get more materials and an assistant so she can be able to take on bigger jobs as her business is expanding. She wishes to one day have her own house where she can live with her family.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura, 40 years old, is married and has 2 children, aged 20 and 14. Many years ago, she established her tailoring business. Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, Nura supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy clothes and threads. In the future, Nura plans to raise the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as kurta pieces and clothes, for tailoring

loans.name: Swastika

texts.en:
Swastika is 31 years old and married, and she has two children aged 10 and 7. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.

Swastika has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent one to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Swastika plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seeds and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Gbassay

texts.en:
This is 41 year-old Gbassay. She is married and has 3 children aged 24, 18 and 16yrs. In 2005, Gbassay established her cigarette business. Gbassay was born from illiterate parents and did not even think of going to school so she decided to join them in business. After some time, she started her own business to improve her living standards, enhance her monthly earnings and profit margin.

Her business is located on the outskirts of the city and her main customers are from the general community. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy more cartons of cigarettes for her shop. She hopes that this loan will allow her to carter to more customers and as a result, her business will expand. In the future, Gbassay plans to be well established and build a house for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of cigarettes for her shop.

loans.name: Ankil Devi

texts.en:
Ankil Devi is 65 years old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 35 and 28.

Many years ago, she established her meat shop business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy goats and chickens.

In the future, Ankil Devi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chicken, goats and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy goat and chickens

loans.name: Daba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce  groupe composé de cinq femmes a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois.
Il regroupe des femmes unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Daba est la responsable elle est marié" et mère de trois enfants dont un garçons tous majeurs.
Elle fait un commerce de tissus et de parfums. Avec son nouveau crédit de 450000 francs achète des balles de tissus et des parfums qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires et sanitaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
This five-woman group was started since the first 'banc villageois' cycle.

It brings together women who are united by good social and professional relationships.

Mrs. Daba is the leader. She is married and the mother of three children, one of which is a boy. All are adults.

She has a business selling fabric and perfume. With her new 450,000 franc loan, she will buy bales of fabric and perfume that she will resell in retail in her neighborhood. She has much experience in this area. The profits made through the sales will allow her to cover her family's dietary and sanitary needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric and perfume to run an income generating business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. In addition she also operates a shoe selling business that earns her another source of income.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Maa Budhithakurani Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Sushila is a 34-year-old single mother of a four-year-old daughter. She is from a remote village in the Koraput district, Odisha, India. She lives with her father and her child. She was always determined not to break down but remain strong and face all the adversities of life very boldly. She has been involved in vegetable cultivation for two years and her father has been involved in paddy cultivation for five years. As a farmer, her father has knowledge of vegetable cultivation and he is helping her in this activity. Whatever they earn is not sufficient to manage their family.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR and will use her portion to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor charges. The family income will increase and they will be inspired to do more. She says that the income will help to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor charges.

loans.name: Maa Budhithakurani Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Mani, from Koraput, in rural Odisha, India, has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Mani, her husband and her three children are one among the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Joining hands with two others whose families also face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Mani has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Without access to a toilet, their families walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, or even insect or animal bites.

With a toilet in their homes, they will be able to lead healthier lives and save the time they spent on walking long distances to relieve themselves. They seek a loan of INR. 45,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 35 years old, married, and has one child. He is a Palestinian refugee. He lives and works in a Palestinian refugees camp in Lebanon. He works in the transportation business, which he has been doing for 15 years. He transports students and employees. His business is requested in his region since most of his clients cannot afford to buy their own car.

Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy another bus to increase the number of customers he can accommodate with transportation services. He hopes to stay capable of developing his family's living in a well managed way.

loans.use: to purchase another bus

loans.name: Yefry Arismendy

texts.es:
Yefry Arismendy es un joven estudiante de Licenciatura en Mercadeo, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Yefri Arismendy, tengo 25 años de edad nací y me crie en Santiago, tengo dos hermanas de parte de mi padre una trabaja y estudia y la otra solo estudia, estoy casado, tenemos una hija  7 meses de nacida, mi madre es ama de casa y mi padre trabaja como chofer.
 
Estoy estudiando en la universidad O&M ejerciendo la carrera de Lic. En Mercado, voy cursando el primer ciclo de mi carrera y me gusta mucho, la  lengua española, contabilidad e inglés.
 
Para mi es necesario este préstamo ya que trabajo pero los ingresos no me alcanza para mantener a mi familia y pago de la universidad  por esta  razón  solicito ayuda ya  que no quiero  parar mis estudios, deseo continuarlos hasta terminar  ya que una vez me vi en la necesidad de pararla ahora que empecé no me gustaría dejarla, tengo el hambre de ser profesional para darle el ejemplo a mi hija y poder sostener a mi familia en el futuro con una mejor posición dentro de la sociedad, de no recibir el préstamo me vería en la necesidad de algún día tener que pararla ya que tengo una familia que depende de mí y pueden llegar meses que no tenga el dinero para pagarla y atrasaría mis metas y mis sueños, este préstamo daría un giro a mi vida ya que me daría la posibilidad de lograr mis sueños y tener el título que tanto anhelo y que me haría más grande como persona.
 
Dentro de mis metas académicas esta pasar cada cuatrimestre con buen índice no dejar que se me quede ni una materia para que no me atrase mi carrera y tener un buen índice académico, dentro de lo familiar esta ayudar a mi madre poder sostenerla en lo que ella necesite y mi hija y mi esposa poder darle un mejor lugar dentro de tantos impedimentos que existen ahora por la situación económica, de poder decir que si a las cosas que mi hija necesite, a poder salir sin preocupación a las cosas que ahora se me hace difícil poder brindarles, quiero tener un buen empleo y desarrollar todos mis conocimientos pagar lo que hace posible que pueda estudiar, trabajar en el  área de negocios poder desarrollar estrategias que permitan un crecimiento a la empresa.
texts.en:
Yefry Arismendy is a young student studying a bachelor's degree in marketing. He is asking for a loan to cover his educational expenses. This is his story:

My name is Yefry, I am 25, and I was born and raised in Santiago. I have two sisters on my father's side: one works and is a student, and the other is only a student. I am married and have a 7-month-old daughter. My mother is a homemaker and my father works as a chauffeur. 

I need this loan because, even though I work, my income is not enough to support my family and pay for school. That's why I am asking for help because I want to see my studies through to the end. There was a time when I saw the need to stop, and now that I've started I don't want to give up. I want to be a professional and set a good example for my daughter. I want to be able to provide for my family in the future with a better position in society. 

If I don't receive a loan, I might have to quit one day since my family depends on me. There could be months that I don't have money to pay for school and my goals and dreams would be delayed. This loan would change my life, giving me the chance to achieve my dreams and have the degree that I so badly want and that will make me a better person.

Among my academic goals is to pass each semester with good grades, not neglecting a single subject, and have a good grade point average overall so that I don't delay my degree. At home, I want to help support my mother with whatever she needs. I want to be able to make a better living situation for my wife and daughter, and be able to say "yes" to the things that my daughter needs instead of worrying about what I can't provide. 

I want to have a good job and develop my skills to pay off what has made my education possible. I want to work in the business sector to develop strategies that allow companies' growth.

loans.use: to cover the costs of higher education.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 46 years old and the father of 5 children. Together, they live in a minority community in very bad conditions and are very poor. In order to earn a living he sells used shoes in the market with his wife. They are able to purchase the shoes at a lower price to resell at a higher profit. Their business is sometimes inconsistent. At times business goes well and other times they make barely enough to secure adequate food for the children.

Some of the furniture that they have has been destroyed by mold while other pieces are old and worn, having been given to them by others after they already used it. He is in desperate need of a loan to purchase new furnutre such as sofa beds and other necessary items. He promises to pay on time and wants to thank the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new furnutre such as sofa beds and other necessary items

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en: Chreb, 42 years old and living in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, is a married mother of five dependent children, two of whom are in school. She has been earning an income via rice farming and working for others for a fee to earn additional income for 22 years. Because her crop has been destroyed by insects, it has not grown well and she is able to earn a very low income. Now, she is leading a group of three to get a loan via VisionFund. With the loan, she will spend her portion to buy fertilizer to increase the crop’s productivity. She hopes to get a high yield to earn more income so that she can improve her lifestyle and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase the crop’s productivity so that she can earn more income to keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district
